C:
Awake, my soul, and with the sun
Thy daily stage of duty run;
Shake off dull sloth, and joyful rise,
To pay thy morning sacrifice.
D:
Ji okan mi ba oorun ji
Mura si ise ojo re;
Mase ilora, ji kutu,
K’o san gbese ebo oro

C:
All praise to Thee, who safe has kept
And hast refreshed me while I slept
Grant, Lord, when I from death shall wake
I may of endless light partake.
D:
Ogo fun Enit' o so mi,
To tu mi l’ara loj' orun;
Oluwa ijo mo ba sun,
Ji mi s’aiye ainipekun.

C:
Lord, I my vows to Thee renew;
Disperse my sins as morning dew.
Guard my first springs of thought and will,
And with Thyself my spirit fill.
D:
Oluwa mo tun eje je,
Tu ese ka b’ iri oro
So akoro nu mi oni
Si f' Emi Re kun inu mi.

C:
Direct, control, suggest, this day,
All I design, or do, or say,
That all my powers, with all their might,
In Thy sole glory may unite.
D:
Oro at’ ise mi oni,
Ki won le ri bi eko Re,
K’ emi si f’ ipa mi gbogbo
Sise rere fun ogo Re.

C:
Wake, and lift up thyself, my heart,
And with the angels bear thy part,
Who all night long unwearied sing
High praise to the eternal King.
D:
Ji, gbon ‘ra nu, ‘wo okan mi,
Yan ipo re l’arin Angel’
Awon tin won nkorin iyin
Ni gbogbo oru s’ Oba wa.

C:
Thy precious time misspent, redeem,
Each present day thy last esteem,
Improve thy talent with due care;
For the great day thyself prepare.
D:
Ro gbogb’ ojo t’o fi sofo
Bere si rere ‘se loni:
Kiyes’ irin re l’aiye yi:
K’ o si mura d’ ojo nla ni.

C:
By influence of the Light divine
Let thy own light to others shine.
Reflect all Heaven’s propitious ways
In ardent love, and cheerful praise.
D:
Gba ninu imole orun,
Si tanmole na f’ elomi:
Je ki ogo Olorun re
Han n’nu iwa at’ ise re.

Yin Olorun ibu ore;
E yin, enyin eda aiye
E yin, enyin eda orun
Yin Baba, Omo on Emi.  Amin

C:
Forth in Thy Name, O Lord, I go,
My daily labor to pursue;
Thee, only Thee, resolved to know
In all I think or speak or do.
D:
OLUWA mi, mo njade lo,
Lati se ise ojo mi;
Iwo nikan l' emi o mo,
L' oro, l' ero: ati n' ise.

C:
The task Thy wisdom hath assigned,
O let me cheerfully fulfill;
In all my works Thy presence find,
And prove Thy good and perfect will.
D:
Ise t' O yan mi l' anu Re,
Jeki nle se tayotayo;
Ki nr' oju Re ni ise mi,
K' emi si le f’ ife Re han.

C:
Preserve me from my calling’s snare,
And hide my simple heart above,
Above the thorns of choking care,
The gilded baits of worldly love.
D:
Dabobo mi lowo 'danwo,
K' o pa okan mi mo kuro
L’ owo aniyan  aiye yi,
Ati gbogbo ifekufe.

C:
Thee may I set at my right hand,
Whose eyes mine inmost substance see,
And labor on at Thy command,
And offer all my works to Thee.
D:
Iwo t'oju Re r' okan mi,
Maa wa low’ otun mi titi,
Ki nmaa sise lo l' ase Re,
Ki nf' ise mi gbogbo fun O.

C:
Give me to bear Thy easy yoke,
And every moment watch and pray,
And still to things eternal look,
And hasten to Thy glorious day.
D:
Jeki nreru Re t' o fuye,
Ki nmaa sora nigba gbogbo,
Ki nma f' oju si nkan t' orun,
Ki nsi mura d' ojo ogo.

C:
For Thee delightfully employ
Whate’er Thy bounteous grace hath giv’n;
And run my course with even joy,
And closely walk with Thee to Heav’n.
D:
Ohunkohun t' O fi fun mi,
Jeki nle lo fun ogo Re,
Ki nf' ayo sure ije mi,
Ki mba O rin titi d' orun.

C:
Come to me, Lord, when first I wake,
as the faint lights of morning break;
bid purest thoughts within me rise,
like crystal dewdrops to the skies.
D:
Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Ni kutukutu owuro,
Mu k’ ero rere so jade,
Lat’ inu mi soke orun.

C:
Come to me in the sultry noon,
or earth's low communings will soon
of thy dear face eclipse the light,
and change my fairest day to night.
D:
Wa s’ odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Ni wakati osan gangan,
Ki’ yonu ma ba se mi mo,
Nwon a si s’ osan mid’ oru.

C:
Come to me in the evening shade,
and, if my heart from thee hath strayed,
O bring it back, and at thy side
securely let me there abide.
D:
Wa s’ odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Nigbati ale ba nle lo,
Bi okan mi ba nsako lo,
Muu pada; f’ oju ’re wo mi.

Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Li oru, nigbati orun
Ko woju mi: je k’okan mi,
Ri ‘simi je li aiya Re.

C:
Come to me through life's varied way,
and when its pulses cease to play,
then, Savior, bid me come to thee,
that where thou art, thy child may be.
D:
Wa s’ odo mi, Oluwa mi
Ni gbogbo ojo aiye mi:
Nigbati emi mi ba lo,
Ki nle n’ ibugbe lodo Re

C:
Come to the Morning Prayer,
Come let us kneel and pray;
Prayer is the Christian pilgrim's staff
To walk with God all day.
D:
Wa s’ adura ooro,
Kunle k’a gbadura;
Adura ni opa Kristian,
Lati b’ Olorun rin.

C:
At noon, beneath the Rock
Of Ages, rest and pray;
Sweet is that shadow from the heat,
When the sun smites by day.
D:
Losan, wole labe
Apat’ aiyeraiye
Itura ojiji Re dun
Nigbat’orun ba mu.

C:
At eve, shut to the door,
Round the home-altar pray,
And finding there the House of God,
At "heaven's gate" close the day.
D:
Je ki gbogbo ile,
Wa gba’ dura l’ ale;
Ki ile wa di t’ Olorun
Ati’ bode orun.

C:
When midnight seals our eyes,
Let each in spirit say,
"I sleep, but my heart waketh, Lord,
With Thee to watch and pray."
D:
Nigbat’ o d’ oganjo,
Je k’ a wi l’ emi, pe
Mo sun, sugbon okan mi ji
Lati ba O sona.

C:
The morning bright,
With rosy light,
Hath waked me from my sleep;
Father, I own
Thy love alone
Thy little one doth keep.
D:
Imole oroo didun yi,
Ji mi nin’ orun mi,
Baba, ife Tire nikan,
L’ o pa omo Re mo

C:
All through the day,
I humbly pray,
Be Thou my Guard and Guide;
My sins forgive,
And let me live,
Blest Jesus, near Thy side
D:
Ni gbogbo oni, mo be O,
Maa se Oluso mi,
Dariji mi, Jesu mimo,
Ki ’m je Tire loni.

Wa se ‘bugbe Re ninu mi,
Emi ore-ofe!
So mi di mimo laiye yi,
K’ emi le r’ oju Re.

C:
Holy Father, hear me;
thou art my defender,
be thou ever near me,
loving, true and tender.
D:
Baba mi gbo t’ emi
Wo ni Alaabo mi,
Ma sunmo mi titi;
Oninure julo.

C:
Jesus, blessèd Savior,
Lord of life and glory,
grant me now thy favour
as I kneel before thee.
D:
Jesu, Oluwa mi,
Iye at' ogo mi,
Ki’ gba naa yara de,
Ti ngo de odo Re.

C:
Comforter benignest,
who abiding in me
all my need divinest,
move me, draw me, win me.
D:
Olutunu julo,
'Wo ti ngbe inu mi,
'Wo t’o mo aini mi,
Fa mi, k' o si gba mi.

C:
Holy, holy, holy,
come, and leave me never,
thine abode most lowly,
only thine for ever.
D:
Mimo, Mimo, Mimo,
Ma fi mi sile lai,
Se mi n'ibugbe Re,
Tire nikan lailai.

C:
Through all the dangers of the night,
Preserv'd, O Lord! By thee;
Again we hail the cheerful light,
Again we bow the knee.
D:
Ninu gbogbo ewu oru,
Oluwa l’o so mi;
Awa si tun ri ‘mole yi
A tun te ekun ba.

C:
Preserve us, Lord! throughout the day,
And guide us by thy arm;
For they are safe, and only they,
Whom thou preserv'st from harm.
D:
Oluwa, pa wa mo loni,
Fi apa Re so wa;
Kiki awon ti ’wo pamo,
L’ o nyo ninu ewu

C:
Let all our words and all our ways,
Declare that we are thine,
That so the light of truth and grace
Before the world may shine.
D:
K’ oro wa, ati iwa wa,
Wipe, Tire l’ awa;
Tobe t’ imole otito
Le tan loju aiye

C:
Let us ne'er turn away from thee;
Dear Saviour, hold us fast,
Till with immortal eyes, we see
Thy glorious face at last.
D:
Ma je k’a pada lodo Re, 
Olugbala owon;
Titi ao f’ oju wa ri
Oju Re li opin.

C:
Christ, whose glory fills the skies,
Christ the true, the only Light,
Sun of Righteousness, arise!
Triumph o'er the shades of night:
Dayspring from on high, be near;
Daystar, in my heart appear.
D:
Kristi, Ologo, Olola,
Iwo imole aiye,
Orun ododo, dide,
K'o si bori okunkun;
'Mole oro, sun mo mi
'Rawo ooro, w' aiya mi.

C:
Dark and cheerless is the morn
unaccompanied by thee;
joyless is the day's return,
till thy mercy's beams I see,
till they inward light impart,
glad my eyes, and warm my heart.
D:
Okunkun l'owuro je
B' Iwo ko pelu re wa:
Ailayo l' ojo yi je,
Fun mi n' imole, Jesu,
M' okan mi gbogbo gbona.

Wa be okan mi yi wo,
Le okunkun ese lo
F' imole orun kun mi,
Si tu aigbagbo mi ka,
Ma f' ara Re han mi si,
Si ma ran b' osangangan

C:
Jesus, Sun of righteousness,
brightest beam of love divine,
with the early morning rays
do thou on our darkness shine,
and dispel with purest light
all our night.
D:
JESU Oorun ododo,
Iwọ imọle ifẹ,
Gbati 'mọlẹ owurọ,
Ba nt' ila orun tan wa,
Tan 'mọlẹ ododo Rẹ
Yi wa ka.

C:
As on drooping herb and flower
falls the soft refreshing dew,
let thy Spirit's grace and power
all our weary souls renew;
showers of blessing over all
softly fall.
D:
Gẹgẹ bi iri ti ńsẹ,
Sori eweko gbogbo,
K' Ẹmi ore-ọfẹ Rẹ
Sọ ọkan wa di ọtun:
Rọ ojo ibukun Rẹ
Sori wa.

C:
Like the sun's reviving ray,
may thy love with tender glow
all our coldness melt away,
warm and cheer us forth to go,
gladly serve thee and obey
all the day.
D:
B' imọlẹ oorun ti nran,
K' imọlẹ ifẹ Tirẹ,
Si ma gbona l' ọkan wa,
K' o si mu wa l' ara ya,
Ka le ma fayọ sin Ọ
Laiye wa.

Amọna, ireti wa,
Ma fi wa silẹ titi,
Fi wa s’ abẹ isọ Rẹ,
Titi opin aiye wa.
Sin wa la ajo wa ja
S' ile wa.

C:
Lead us all our days and years
in thy straight and narrow way;
lead us through the vale of tears
to the land of perfect day,
where thy people, fully blest,
safely rest.
D:
Pa wa mọ n'nu ifẹ Rẹ,
L’ọjọ aiye wa gbogbo.
Si mu wa bori iku,
Mu wa de 'le ayọ na,
K’a le ba’ wọn mimọ gba
Isimi.

C:
Glory to thee, my God, this night,
For all the blessings of the light:
Keep me, O keep me, King of kings,
Beneath thine own almighty wings
D:
Ogo f’Olorun l’ale yi
Fun gbogbo ore Imole
So mi, Oba awon Oba
L’abe ojiji iye Re.

C:
Forgive me, Lord, for thy dear Son,
the ill that I this day have done,
that with the world, myself, and thee,
I, ere I sleep, at peace may be.
D:
Oluwa f’ ese mi ji mi,
Nitori omo Re loni
K’ emi le wa l’ alafia,
Pelu iwo ati aiye.

C:
Teach me to live, that I may dread
The grave as little as my bed.
Teach me to die, that so I may
Rise glorious at the judgment day.
D:
Jek’ okan mi le sun le O,
K’ orun didun p’ oju mi de,
Orun ti y’o m’ara mi le,
Ki nle sin O li owuro.

C:
O may my soul on thee repose,
And with sweet sleep mine eyelids close,
Sleep that may me more vigorous make
To serve my God when I awake.
D:
Bi mo ba dubule laisun,
F’ ero orun kun okan mi,
Maje ki nlala bururu,
Ma je k’ ipa okun bo mi.

Yin Olorun, gbogbo eda,
Ti mbe nisale aiye yi:
E yin loke, eda Orun,
Yin Baba, Omo on Emi.

C:
Thy love has spared our lives to-day,
Weary we are kneeling down,
Guard us throughout the still of night,
Let our foes disturb us not;
Jesus guide and take care of us
It is sweet to trust in Thee.
D:
Ife Re da wa si l’oni
L’are a si dubule,
Ma so wa ni'dake oru,
k'ota ma yo wa lenu:
Jesu, se olutoju wa,
iwo l’ o dun gbekele.

C:
Pilgrims and strangers in this world,
Amongst foes we are living,
Save us, for we are in danger,
In Thylaps o we shall sleep;
When earthly sorrows are ended,
O let us rest in Thee.
D:
Ero at’ alejo l’aiye,
A ngb’ arin awon ota
Yo wa, at’ile wa l’ ewu
L’apa Re ni k’ a sun si:
N’ ijo iyonu aiye pin,
K’ a le simi l’ odo Re.

C:
Abide with me! fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens; Lord, with me abide!
When other helpers fail and comforts flee,
Help of the helpless, oh, abide with me.
D:
Wa ba mi gbe, ale fere le tan:
Okunkun nsu, Oluwa ba mi gbe;
Bi oluranlowo miran ba ye
Iranwo alaini, wa ba mi gbe.

Ojo aye mi nsare lo s’ opin,
Ayo aiye nku, ogo re nwomi,
Ayida at’ ibaje ni mo nri,
‘Wo ti ki yipada wa ba mi gbe.

Ma wa l’ eru b’ Oba awon oba
Sygbon ki o ma bo b’oninure,
Ki O si ma kanu fun egbe mi
Wa, Ore elese, wa ba mi gbe.

C:
I need Thy presence every passing hour:
What but Thy grace can foil the tempter’s power?
Who like Thyself my guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine, oh, abide with me.
D:
Mo nfe O ri, ni wakati gbogbo:
Ki lo le segun esu b’ ore Re?
Tal’ o le se amona mi bi Re?
N’nu ‘banuje at’ayo ba mi gbe

C:
I fear no foe, with Thee at hand to bless:
Ills have no weight, and tears no bitterness:
Where is death’s sting? where, grave, thy victory?
I triumph still, if Thou abide with me.
D:
Pelu ‘bukun Re, eru ko ba mi,
Ibi ko wuwo, ekun ko koro,
Oro iku da? ‚segun isa da?
Ngo segun sibe, bi ’Wo ba mi gbe

Wa ba mi gbe ni wakati sisun,
Se ‘mole mi, si toka si orun
B’ aiye ti nkoja, k’ ile orun mo
Ni yiye, ni sisun, wa ba mi gbe.

C:
Sun of my soul, thou Saviour dear,
It is not night if thou be near;
O may no earth-born cloud arise
To hide thee from thy servant's eyes.
D:
Iwo Imole okan mi,
Li odo Re oru ko si,
Ki kuku aiye ma bo O,
Kuro L’ oju iranse Re.

C:
When the soft dews of kindly sleep
My weary eyelids gently steep,
Be my last thought, how sweet to rest
For ever on my Saviour's breast.
D:
Nigbat’ oorun  ale didun
Ba npa ipenpeju mi de,
K’ ero mi je lati simi
Lai L’ aiya Olugbala mi.

C:
Abide with me from morn till eve,
For without thee I cannot live;
Abide with me when night is nigh,
For without thee I dare not die.
D:
Ba mi gbe l'oro tit'ale,
Laisi Re emi ko le wa,
Ba mi gbe gbat'ile ba nsu,
Laisi Re emi ko le sun.

C:
If some poor wand'ring child of thine
Have spurned today the voice Divine,
Now, Lord, the gracious work begin;
Let him no more lie down in sin.
D:
Bi otosi omo Re kan
Ba tapa s'oro Re loni
Oluwa sise ore Re
Ma je k'o sun ninu ese.

C:
Watch by the sick; enrich the poor
With blessings from thy boundless store;
Be ev'ry mourner's sleep tonight,
Like infant's slumbers, pure and light.
D:
Bukun fun awon alaisan,
Pese fun awon talaka,
K'orun alawe l'ale yi,
Dabi orun omo titun.

C:
Come near and bless us when we wake,
Ere through the world our way we take,
Till in the ocean of thy love
We lose ourselves in heav'n above.
D:
Sure fun wa nigbat'aji,
K'a to m'ohun aiye yi se,
TIti awa o de b'ife
T'a o si de ijoba Re.

C:
At even, ere the sun was set,
the sick, O Lord, around thee lay;
O in what divers pains they met!
O with what joy they went away!
D:
L ’oju ale, ’gbat ’orun wo,
Nwon gbe abirun w ’odo Re;
Oniruru ni aisan won
Sugbon won f ’ayo lo ’Ie won.

C:
Once more 'tis eventide, and we
oppressed with various ills draw near;
what if thy form we cannot see?
we know and feel that thou art here
D:
Jesu a de Ioj’ ale yi,
A sunmo O, t’ awa t` arun wa,
Bi a ko tile le ri O,
Sugbon a mo p’O sunmo wa,

Olugbala, wo osi wa;
Omi ko san, mi ‘banuje,
Omi ko ni ife si O,
Ife elomi si tutu.

Omi mo pe, asan l’ aiye
Beni nwon Ko f’ aiye sile,
Omi l’ ore ti ko se ’re,
Beni nwon ko fi O s’ ore.

C:
And none, O Lord, have perfect rest,
for none are wholly free from sin;
and they who fain would serve thee best
are conscious most of wrong within.
D:
Ko s’ okan ninu wa to pe,
Gbogbo Wa’ si ni elese,
Awon t’o si nsin O toto,
Mo ara Won ni alaipe.

Sugbon Jesu Olugbala,
Eni bi awa ni ’Wo ’se,
’Wo ti ri ’danwo bi awa
’Wo si ti mo ailera wa.

C:
Thy touch has still its ancient power;
no word from thee can fruitless fall:
Hear, in this solemn evening hour,
and in thy mercy heal us all.
D:
Agbar’ owo Re wa sibe
Ore Re si ni agbara,
Gbo adura ale wa yi,
Ni anu, wo gbogbo wa san

C:
Lead, Kindly Light, amidst th'encircling gloom,
Lead Thou me on!
The night is dark, and I am far from home,
Lead Thou me on!
Keep Thou my feet; I do not ask to see
The distant scene; one step enough for me.
D:
‘Wo Imole larin ookun aiye
Ma sin mi lo
Okunkun su mo si jina sile
Ma sin mi lo
To ‘sise mi: ohun ehin ola
Emi ko bere: sise kan to fun mi

C:
I was not ever thus, nor prayed that Thou
Shouldst lead me on;
I loved to choose and see my path; but now
Lead Thou me on!
I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears,
Pride ruled my will. Remember not past years!
D:
Nigbakan ri, emi ko be O pe
Ma sin mi lo
Be ni nko fe O: sugbon nigbayi
Ma sin mi lo;
Afe aiye ni mo ti nto le-hin
Sugbon Jesu, ma ranti igbani

C:
So long Thy power hath blest me, sure it still
Will lead me on.
O'er moor and fen, o'er crag and torrent, till
The night is gone,
And with the morn those angel faces smile,
Which I have loved long since, and lost awhile!
D:
Ipa Re l’ o ti ndi mi mu y’o si
Ma sin mi lo
Ninu ere ati yangi aiye
Ma sin mi lo
Titi em’ o fi ri awon wonni
Ti mo fe tin won ti f’ aiye sile

C:
O Saviour, bless us ere we go,
Thy word into our minds instil,
And made our lukewarm hearts to glow
With lowly love and fervent will.
Through life's long day and death's dark night,
O gentle Jesus, be our light.
D:
Jesu, bukun wa k'a to lo:
Gbin oro Re si aiya wa,
K'o si mu k'ife gbigbona
Kun okan ilowowo wa,
Nigba iye at'iku wa,
Jesu jare, se 'mole wa.

C:
The day is gone, its hours have run;
And Thou hast taken count of all,
The scanty triumphs grace hath won,
The broken vow, the frequent fall.
D:
Ile ti su orun ti wo,
'wo si ti siro iwa wa,
Die n'isegun wa loni
Isubu wa l'opapoju:

C:
Forgive us, Lord; yea, give us joy,
Sweet fear, and sober liberty,
And loving hearts without alloy
That only long to be like Thee.
D:
Jesu, dariji wa; fun wa
L'ayo ati eru mimo,
At'okan ti ko l'abawon
K'a ba le jo O l'ajotan

C:
Labour is sweet, for Thou hast toil'd,
And care is light, for Thou hast cared:
Let not our works with self be soil'd
Nor in unsimple ways ensnared.
D:
Lala dun, tori 'Wo se ri;
Aniyan fere, O se ri,
Ma je k'a gbot'ara nikan
K'a ma bo sinu idewo

A mbe O f'awon alaini
F'elese at'awon t'afe,
Je ki anu Re mu wa yo,
'Wo Jesu, l'ohun gbogbo wa.

C:
O Saviour, bless us; night is come;
Thy holy Presence with us be,
Good angles watch about our home,
And we are one day nearer Thee.
D:
Jesu bukun wa ile su,
Tikalare wa ba wa gbe,
Angel'rere nso ile wa,
A tun f'ojo kan sunmo O.

C:
Father, breathe an evening blessing
Ere repose our spirits seal;
Sin and want we come confessing:
Thou canst save, and Thou canst heal.
D:
K’a to sun Olugbala wa,
Fun wa n’ ibukun ale:
A jewo ese wa fun O,
Iwo l’o le gba wa la.

C:
Though the night be dark and dreary,
Darkness cannot hide from Thee;
Thou art He who, never weary,
Watchest where Thy people be.
D:
B’ ile tile ti su dudu,
Okun ko le se wa mo:
Iwo eniti ki sare
Nso awon enia Re.

C:
Though thick-darkness walk around us,
Though the arrow past us fly,
Angel-guards from Thee surround us;
We are safe if Thou art nigh.
D:
B’ okunkun tile yi wa ka
Ti ofa nfo wa koja,
Awon Angeli yi wa ka,
Awa o wa l’ ailewu,

C:
Father, to thy holy keeping
Humbly we ourselves resign;
Savior, who hast slept our sleeping,
Make our slumbers pure as thine
D:
Nirele awa f’ara wa
S’abe abo Re Baba,
Jesu ‘Wo t’o sun bi awa,
Se orun wa bi Tire.

C:
Blessèd Spirit, brooding o’er us,
Chase the darkness of our night,
Till the perfect day before us
Breaks in everlasting light.
D:
Emi Mimo rado bo wa,
Tan ‘mole s’ okunkun wa
Tit’ awa o fi ri ojo
Imole aiyeraiye.

C:
Our gracious Lord, today is ended,
The darkness falls at Thy behest;
To Thee our morning hymns ascended,
Thy praise shall hallow now our rest.
D:
Oluwa ojo yi ti d'opin
Okunkun si de l'ase Re
'Wo l'a korin owuro wa si,
Iyin Re y'o m'ale wa dun.

C:
We thank Thee that Thy church, unsleeping,
While earth rolls onward into light,
Through all the world her watch is keeping,
And rests not now by day or night.
D:
A dupe ti ijo Re ko nsun,
B'aiye ti nyi lo s'imole
O si nsona ni gbogbo aiye,
Ko si simi tosan-toru

C:
As o’er each continent and island
The dawn leads on another day,
The voice of prayer is never silent,
Nor dies the strain of praise away.
D:
B'ile si ti nmo lojojumo
Ni orile at'ekusu
Ohun adura ko dake ri,
Be l'orin iyin ko dekun.

C:
The sun that bids us rest is waking
Our brethren ’neath the western sky,
And hour by hour fresh lips are making
Thy wondrous doings heard on high.
D:
Oorun t'o wo fun wa, si ti la
S'awon eda iwo-oorun
Nigbakugba li enu si nso
Ise 'yanu Re di mimo.

C:
So be it, Lord; Thy throne shall never,
Like earth’s proud empires, pass away:
But stand, and rule, and grow for ever,
Till all Thy creatures own Thy sway. Amen

Father, again in Jesus' Name we meet,
And bow in penitence beneath Thy feet:
Again to Thee our feeble voices raise,
To sue for mercy, and to sing Thy praise.
D:
Baba a tun pade l’ ooko Jesu
A si wa teriba lab’ ese Re
A tun fe gb’ ohun wa soke si O
Lati wa anu, lati korin ‘yin

C:
Oh we would bless Thee for Thy ceaseless care,
And all Thy works from day to day declare:
Is not our life with hourly mercies crowned?
Does not Thine arm encircle us around?
D:
A yin O fun itoju ‘gbagbogbo
Ojojumo l’ a o ma rohin ‘se re
Wiwa laye wa anu Re ha ko?
Apa Re ki o fi ngba ni mora?

C:
Alas, unworthy of Thy boundless love,
Too oft with careless feet from Thee we rove;
But now, encouraged by Thy voice, we come,
Returning sinners to a Father's home.
D:
O se! a ko ye fun ife nla Re
A sako kuro lodo Re poju
Sugbon kikankikan ni O si npe
Nje, a de, a pada wa ‘le Baba

C:
Oh by that Name in whom all fullness dwells,
Oh by that love which every love excels,
Oh by that blood so freely shed for sin,
Open blest mercy's gate, and take us in.
Amen.
D:
Nipa ooko t’o bor’ ohun gbogbo
Nipa ife t’o ta ‘fe gbogbo yo
Nipa eje ti a ta fun ese
Silekun anu si gbani si ‘le

C:
We lift up our eyes to Thee,
With our hands and all our minds,
Accept then all our prayers,
Although they must not be strong.
D:
A gboju s'oke si O,
At'owo, ati okan
Tewogba adura wa,
B' o tile se ailera.

C:
O Lord let us know Thy self,
O let us know Thy good name,
And let us Thy will perform,
Just as they do in heaven.
D:
Oluwa je k'a mo O,
Je k'a mo oruko Re
Je k' awa se ife Re
Bi won ti nse li orun.

C:
O Lord, when we sleep at night,
Please keep us, keep and stand by us,
And when the day light breaks,
Awakened, let us praise Thee.
Amen.
D:
Nigbati a sun loru,
So wa, k'o duro ti wa;
Nigbati ile si mo,
K' a ji, k 'a f'iyin fun O.

C:
Now the day is over,
Night is drawing nigh;
Shadows of the evening
Steal across the sky.
D:
Ojo oni lo tan,
Oru sunmole:
Okunkun ti de na,
Ile si ti su.

C:
Now the darkness gathers,
Stars their watches keep,
Birds and beasts and flowers
Soon will be asleep.
D:
Okunkun bo ile
Awon ‘rawo yo;
Eranko at’ eiye,
Lo si ‘busun won

C:
Jesus, give the weary
Calm and sweet repose;
With Thy tenderest blessing
May mine eyelids close.
D:
Jesu f’ orun didun
F’ eni alare;
Je ki ibukun Re
Pa oju mi de.

C:
Grant to little children
Visions bright of Thee;
Guard the sailors tossing
On the deep blue sea.
D:
Je k ‘omo kekere
La alar ere
S’ oloko t’ ewu nwu
Ni oju mi.

C:
Comfort every sufferer
Watching late in pain;
Those who plan some evil
From their sin restrain.
D:
Ma toju alaisan
Ti ko r’ orun sun
Awon ti nro ibi,
Jo da won l’ ekun.

C:
Through the long night watches
May Thine angels spread
Their white wings above me,
Watching round my bed.
D:
Ninu gbogbo oru
Je k’ angeli Re
Ma se oluso mi
L’ ori ‘busun mi.

C:
When the morning wakens,
Then may I arise
Pure and fresh and sinless
In Thy holy eyes.
D:
‘Gbat’ ile ba si mo
Je k’ emi dide;
B’ omo ti ko l’ ese
Ni iwaju Re

C:
Glory to the Father,
Glory to the Son,
And to Thee, blest Spirit,
While all ages run.
D:
Ogo ni fun baba,
Ati fun Omo,
Ati f’ Emi Mimo,
Lai ato lailai.  Amin

C:
The day is past and over;
All thanks, O Lord, to Thee!
We pray Thee now that sinless
The hours of dark may be.
O Jesus, keep us in Thy sight
And guide us through the coming night.
D:
Ojo oni koja lo,
A dupe, Oluwa,
Jo, gba wa lowo ese
Ni wakati oru,
Chr: Jesu, jo, f‘iso Re so wa,
Si mu wa la oru yi ja.

C:
The joys of day are over;
We lift our heart to Thee
And ask Thee that offenceless
The hours of dark may be:
O Jesus, make their darkness light
And guard me through the coming night.
D:
Ayo oni koja lo,
A gb‘okan wa s‘oke
Jo, ma je k‘a n‘ikose
Ni wakati oru;
Chr :Jesu, jo fun wa n‘imole,
Sa mu wa la oru yi ja

C:
The toils of day are over:
We raise our hymn to Thee
And ask that free from peril
The hours of dark may be.
O Jesus, keep us in Thy sight
And guard us through the coming night.
D:
Lala oni koja lo,
A fi orin yin O,
Jo, ma je k‘a ri ewu
Ni wakati oru;
Chr: Jesu, jo f‘is Re so wa,
Si mu wa la oru yi ja.

C:
Be Thou my Soul's Preserver,
For Thou, O God, dost know
How many are the perils
Awaiting us below:
O loving Jesus, hear our call
And guard and save us from them all.
D:
S‘Olupamo wa, Baba,
Nitori; Wo l‘O mo
Gege b‘ewu ti po to,
Ti a o ba pade;
Jesu, Olufe, gbo ti wa,
Si mu wa la gbogbo won ja.

C:
The radiant morn hath passed away,
And spent too soon her golden store;
The shadows of departing day
Creep on once more.
D:
Oro didan ti rekoja;
Wawa l‘akoko na fo lo,
Bi osan si ti nkoja lo,
Nile nsu bo.

C:
Our life is but an autumn day,
Its glorious noon how quickly past!
Lead us, O Christ, Thou living way,
Safe home at last.
D:
Kukuru, l‘ojo aye wa,
Were l‘osan re nde opin;
Krist‘ Wo ti se Ona iye,
Sin wa de ‘le.

C:
O by Thy soul-inspiring grace
Uplift our hearts to realms on high;
Help us to look to that bright place
Beyond the sky.
D:
Jo fi ore-ofe Re nla
Gbe okan wa b‘ilu t‘orun;
Je k‘a ma wo ‘le didan ni
Ti mbe l‘oke.

C:
Where light, and life, and joy, and peace
In undivided empire reign,
And thronging angels never cease
Their deathless strain.
D:
Nibi ‘mole, iye ayo
At‘ alafia gbe njoba,
T‘awon angel‘ ko dekun ‘ko
Orin iyin.

C:
Where saints are clothed in spotless white,
And evening shadows never fall;
Where Thou, eternal Light of light,
Art Lord of all.
D:
T‘awon mimo wa ‘so ala,
Ti okunkun ale ki su,
Ti ‘Wo ‘Mole ayeraye
Je Oluwa.

C:
ERE I sleep, for every favour
This day showed
By my God,
I will bless my Saviour.
D:
Ki nto sun, fun ore t'oni
T'Olorun
Se fun mi,
ngo yin Olugbala

C:
O my Lord, what shall I render
To Thy name,
Still the same,
Merciful and tender?
D:
Oluwa, kini ngo fi yin
Oko Re,
T‘o kun fun
Anu ati Ore.

C:
Thou hast ordered all my goings
In Thy way,
Heard me pray,
Sanctified my doings.
D:
Iwo ti s‘eto irin mi,
L'ona Re
'Wo gb'ebe;
'Wo si gba ise mi

C:
Leave me not, but ever love me;
Let Thy peace
Be my bliss,
Till Thou hence remove me.
D:
Ma ko mi, ma fe mi titi;
F‘alafia
Re fun mi,
Titi ‘Wo y‘o pe mi

C:
Thou my rock, my guard, my tower,
Safely keep,
While I sleep,
Me, with all Thy power.
D:
Wo apata at‘odi mi,
F‘ipa Re
Pa mi mo
‘gba m‘ba dubule sun.

C:
So, whene’er in death I slumber,
Let me rise
With the wise,
Counted in their number.
D:
Nigbakugba ti mo ba ku,
Je k‘emi
Ji dide
Pelu awon mimo.

C:
The God who led His people thro' the parted sea,
And from Egyptian bondage set His children free,                 
Who rain'd down bread from heaven all the pilgrim way.        
Is the God to whom I pray.
Chorus
Just the same today, just the same today,
As when He led His children thro' the sea,                           
His trustful child l'll be, For in His word I see,                     
The God who doeth wonders,                                                  
Is just the same today.
D:
Oluwa t’o mu Israel la okun ja,
Ti O si gba won kuro li oko eru,
Ti O rojo onje sile lati orun,
On ni mo ngbadura si.
Okanna loni, okanna loni,
B’ akoko t’ O sin Israeli la okun:
Omo Re ni ngo je, ‘tori oro Re so.
Pe okanna no Olorun Iyanu loni.

C:
The God who rescued Daniel from the lion's den,
And from the fiery furnace sav'd the three young men,       
Who speaks, and constellations will His voice obey               
Is the God to whom I pray.                                              
Chorus: Just the same today, just the same today,
D:
Olorun t’ O gba Danieli lowo Kiniun,
T’ O si yo awon meta n’nu ina l’ eru,
Eniti awon irawo ngba Tire gbo
On ni mo ngbadura si
Okanna loni, okanna loni. &c.

C:
The God who stills the tempest with a word divine,
And on the clouds of sorrow, makes His rainbows shine,   
Who from the tomb of Jesus rolled the stone away,               
Is the God to whom I pray.                                              
Chorus: Just the same today, just the same today,
D:
Olorun t’ O f’ oro Re d’ afefe duro,
T’ o sin so ‘banuje oni d’ ayo l’ola,
Eniti O yi okuta ‘boji kuro,
On ni mo ngbadura si
Okanna loni, okanna loni. &c.

C:
The God who clothes the lily in its robe of snow,
Who in the barren desert makes His rivers flow,                   
The God who lifts the sinner from the miry clay,                      
Is the God to whom I pray.                                            
Chorus: Just the same today, just the same today,
D:
Olorun t’ O wo itanna igbe l’ aso
Eniti O si mu Omi san l’ aginju,
Ti O we elese mo ninu eri re.,
On ni mo ngbadura si,
Okanna loni, okanna loni. &c.    Amin

Ko su wa lati ma ko orin ti igbani,
Ogo f’olorun Halleluya
A le fi igbagbo korin na s’oke kikan;
Ogo f’olorun, Halleluya
Omo olorun ni eto lati ma bu s’ayo
Pe ona yi nye wa si,
Okan wa nsa feri Re
Nigb’o se a o de afin Oba wa ologo,
Ogo f’olorun, Halleluy!

C:
We are lost amid the rapture of redeeming love
Glory to God, hallelujah!
We are rising on its pinions to the hills above:
Glory to God, hallelujah!
O the children of the Lord etc
D:
Awa mbe n’nu ibu ife t’o ra wa pada,
ogo f’olorun Halleluya
Awa y’o fi iye goke lo s’oke orun
Ogo f’olorun, Halleluya!

C:
We are going to a palace that is built of gold;
Glory to God, hallelujah!
Where the King in all His splendor we shall soon behold
Glory to God, hallelujah!
Chorus: O the children of the Lord etc
D:
Awa nlo si afin kan ti a fi wura ko,
ogo f’olorun Halleluya
Nibiti a ori Oba ogo n’nu ewa Re
Ogo f’olorun, Halleluya

Nibe ao korin titun t’anu t’o da wa nde
Ogo f’olorun Halleluya
Nibe awon ayanfe yo korin ‚yin ti Krist;
Ogo f’olorun, Halleluya

C:
Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
Sing, O earth, His wonderful love proclaim!
Hail Him! hail Him! highest archangels in glory,
Strength and honour give to His holy name!
Like a shepherd, Jesus will guard His children;
In His arms He carries them all day long:                                  
O Ye saints that dwell on the mountain of Zion,                          
Praise Him! Praise Him! Ever in joyful song.
D:
Fi iyin fun! Jesu, Olurapada wa,
Ki aiye k’ okiki ife Re nla ;
Fi iyin fun ! eyin Angeli ologo,
F’ ola at’ ogo fun oruko re,
B’ Olusagutan, Jesu y’o to omo Re,
Apa Re lo ngbe won le lo jo jo;
Enyin enia mimo ti ngb’oke Sion
Fi iyin fun U pelu orin ayo.

C:
Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
For our sins, He suffered and bled and died;
He our Rock, our hope of eternal salvation,
Hail Him! hail Him! Jesus the crucified.                                   
Loving Saviour, meekly enduring sorrow,                                   
Crown'd with thorns that cruelly pierc'd His brow;                     
Once for us rejected, despis'd and forsaken.                           
Prince of Glory, ever triumphant now.
D:
Fi iyin fun!, Jesu Olurapada wa,
Fun wa, O t’eje Re sile, O ku
On ni Apata, ati ‘reti ‘gbala wa,
Yin Jesu ti a kan m’ agbelebu;
Olugbala t’o f’ara da irora nla
Ti a fi ade egun de lori
Eniti a pa nitori awa eda
Oba ogo njoba titi lailai.

C:
Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
Heavenly portals loud with hosannas ring!
Jesus, Saviour, reigneth for ever and ever;
Crown Him! crown Him! Prophet and Priest and King!           
Death is vanquish'd! tell it with joy, ye faithful.                         
Where is now thy victory, boasting grave?                                 
Jesus lives! no longer thy portals are cheerless,                      
Jesus lives, the mighty and strong to save.
D:
Fi iyin fun!, Jesu Olurapada wa
Ki ariwo iyin gba orun kan
Jesu Oluwa njoba lae ati lailai,
Se l’ Oba gbogb’ eyin alagbara,
A segun iku; fi ayo royin na ka,
Isegun re ha da? isa oku?
Jesu ye! ko tun si wahala fun wa mo:
Tori O l’agbara lati gbala.

C:
I will praise the Lord for His love to me,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
In the fount that flows from the cross so free,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
Refrain
Glory, glory, glory to the Lamb,
I am saved from sin and He makes me what I am;
Oh, glory, glory, glory to the Lamb,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
D:
Em‘o yin Oluwa fun ife Re,
A we mi nin ‘eje Olurapada,
Eje na t‘o nsan nib‘agbelebu,
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada,
Ogo, Ogo fun Od‘agutan
O gba mi l‘owo ese mo si di mimo,
Ogo, Ogo, Ogo, f‘Od‘agutan,
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada

C:
I am saved by grace, and to Him bro’t near,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
I would sing so loud that the world might hear,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer. [Refrain]
D:
Ore-Ofe mu mi sunm‘odo Re,
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada,
Em‘o korin soke, aye y‘o gbo,
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada

C:
What a constant peace in my heart I feel,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
There’s a holy joy I can ne’er reveal,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer. [Refrain]
D:
Alafia wo l‘o to yi l‘okan mi?
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada;
Ayo mimo na ko se f‘enu so,
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada,

C:
I will lift my voice while on earth I stay,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
Then my soul shall sing in the realms of day,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer. [Refrain]
D:
Emi o ma gb‘ohun iyin s‘oke,
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada,
Okan mi y‘o ma korin lojojo
A we mi nin‘eje Olurapada.

C:
Praise the king of Glory, He is God alone,                    
Praise Him for the wonders He to us hath shown;               
For His promised presence, All the pilgrim way,                   
For the flaming pillar, And the cloud by day.
Praise Him, shining angels,
Strike your harps of gold,
All His hosts adore Him,
Who.. His face be hold
Through .., His great dominion,
While the ages roll,
All His works shall praise Him,                                                 
All His works shall praise Him,                                                   
All His works shall praise Him,                                           
Bless the Lord, my soul!
D:
Eyin Oba ogo, On ni Olorun:
Yin fun 'se 'yanu ti O ti fihan,
O wa pelu awon ero mimo l'ona;
O si je imole won l'osan l'oru.
E yin Angel 'didan, lu duru wura
Ki gbogbo yin juba, t'e now oju Re.
Ni gbogbo 'joba re, b'aye ti nyi lo.
Ise re y'o ma yin
Ise re y'o ma yin
Fi ibukun fun Oluwa okan mi.

E yin fun 'rapada ti gbogbo okan,
E yin fun orisun imularada;
Fun inu rere ati itoju Re
Fun 'daniloju pe O ngbo adura

C:
Praise Him for the trials, sent as chords of love,
Binding us more closely, to the things above;
For the faith that conquers, hope, that naught can dim,
For the land where loved ones, gather unto Him.           
Chorus: Praise Him, shining angels.
D:
E yin fun idanwo bi okun ife,
T' o nso wa po mo awon ohun orun
Fun 'gbagbo ti nsegun , 'reti ti ki sa
Fun ile Ogo t' O ti pese fun wa.

C:
How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
It soothes my sorrows heals his wounds,
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Chorus: Blessed be the name! 
Blessed be the name!
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Blessed be the name! Blessed be the name!
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
D:
B’ oruko Jesu ti dun to,
Ogo ni fun Oruko Re
O tan ‘banuje at’ ogbe
ogo ni fun oruko Re
ogo f’oko Re, ogo f’oko Re
ogo f’oruko Oluwa
ogo f’oko Re, ogo f’oko Re
ogo f’oruko Oluwa

C:
It makes the wounded spirit whole
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
'Tis manna to the hungry soul
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Chorus: Blessed be the name! Blessed be the name!
D:
O wo okan t’ o gbogbe san
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Onje ni f’ okan t’ ebi npa,
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

C:
It soothes the troubled sinner’s breast
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
It gives the weary sweetest rest
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Chorus: Blessed be the name! Blessed be the name!
D:
O tan aniyan elese,
Ogo ni fun oruko Re,
O fun alare ni ‘simi
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

C:
Then will I tell the sinners round,
Blessed be the name of the Lord
What a dear savior I have found,
Blessed be the name of the Lord!
Chorus: Blessed be the name! Blessed be the name!
D:
Nje ngo royin na f’ elese,
Ogo ni fun oruko re
Pe mo ti ri Olugbala,
Ogo ni fun oruka Re.

C:
Christ is my portion for ever,
He is my Saviour from sin;
He is my blessed salvation,
I have the witness within.
Chorus
I have the witness within
Jesus now saves me from sin
In His heart I've a place,
I am saved by His grace,
And I have the witness within.
D:
Kristi ni ipin mi titi,
On l’ O ngba mi nin’ ese,
O je ona igbala mi,
Eri yi wa l’ okan mi,
Eri yi wa l’ okan mi,
Jesu gba mi low’ ese;
Mo l’ ayo laiya Re,
Or’ ofe Re gba mi;
Eri yi si wa l’ okan mi

C:
He is my Fortress and Tower
He is my Guide and my King;
He is my Shepherd, my Keeper,
Joyfully now I can sing.
Chorus: I have the witness within
D:
On ni odi agbara mi,
Amona at’ Oba mi,
On si ni Olupamo mi
Hje mo le f’ ayo korin;
Eri yi wa l’ okan mi, &c.

C:
Praise the One who redeems me,
Praise to my Crucified Lord,
Now I am saved, Hallelujah,
Praise the wonderful word.
Chorus: I have the witness within
D:
Iyin fun Enit’ O ra mi.
Iyin f’ Eniti a pa,
Nje emi bo, Halleluya!
Iyin fun Oro ‘yanu.  Amin

C:
The God of Abra'am praise,
Who reigns enthroned above;
Ancient of everlasting days
And God of love.
"Jehovah, Great I AM"By earth and heaven confess'd;
I bow and bless the sacred name
For ever bless'd.
D:
Yin Olorun Abra‘am,
Ti O njoba l‘oke
Eni t‘O ti wa titi lae
Olorun ‘fe
“Jehofa nla Emi”
Gbogbo eda jewo,
Mo fi ‘bukun Re
Titi lailai

C:
The God of Abra'am praise,
At whose supreme command
From earth I rise, and seek the joys
At His right hand.
I all on earth forsake,
Its wisdom, fame and power,
And Him my only portion make,
My shield and tower.

He by Himself hath sworn;
I on His oath depend.
I shall, on eagle wings up borne,
To heaven ascend.
I shall behold His face;
I shall His power adore
And sing the wonders of His grace
For evermore.
D:
On na ti se ‘leri;
Mo gbekele eyi,
Un I fi iye idi goke
Lo si orun
Un o ma wo oju Re
Un o si yin ipa Re,
Un o korin ‘yanu to‘or‘ofe
Titi lailai

C:
Though nature’s strength decay,
And earth and hell withstand,
To Canaan’s bounds I urge my way
At His command.
The watery deep I pass,
With Jesus in my view,
And through the howling wilderness
My way pursue.
D:
B‘agbara eda pin,
T‘aye at‘esu nde,
Un o d‘ojuko ona kenan‘
Nipa ‘se Re
Un o re odo koja
Bi Jesu wa lokan
Un o koja n‘nu igbo didi
Lo s‘ona mi.

C:
The God,  who reigns on high
The great archangels sing,
And "Holy, holy, holy!" cry,
"Almighty King!
Who was and is the same.
And evermore shall be:
Jehovah, Father, Great I AM!
We worship Thee!"
D:
Oba Oke orun
Olor‘Angeli nke
Wipe “Mimo, Mimo, Mimo”
Oba titi
Cr En ‘ti ki yi pada,
Ti y‘o si wa laelae
Jehofa Baba, “Emi ni”
Awa yin O

C:
The whole triumphant host
Give thanks to God on high.
"Hail, Father, Son, and Holy Ghost!"They ever cry.
Hail, Abra'am’s God and mine!
I join the heavenly lays:
All might and majesty are Thine
And endless praise. Amen.
D:
Gbogbo ‘gbe asegun
Yin Olorun loke,
Baba, Omo at’Emi, ni
Won nke titi
Yin Olorun Abra‘am!
Un o ba won korin na,
Tire l‘agbara at‘ola
Pelu iyin.

C:
Let us, with a gladsome mind,
Praise the Lord, for He is kind.
For His mercies aye endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
E je k’ a f’ inu didun
Yin Oluwa Olore;
Anu Re, O wa titi,
Lododo dajudaju.

C:
Let us blaze His Name abroad,
For of gods He is the God.
For His mercies aye endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
On, nipa agbara Re,
F’ imole s’aiye titi
Anu Re O wa titi,
Lododo dajudaju.

C:
He with all commanding might
Filled the new made world with light,
For His mercies aye endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
O mbo gbogb’ eda ‘laye
O npese fun aini won;
Anu Re O wa titi,
Lododo dajudaju

C:
All things living He doth feed,
His full hand supplies their need
For His mercies aye endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
O bukun ayanfe Re,
Li aginju aiye yi
Anu Re O wa titi,
Lododo dajudaju.

C:
Let us, with a gladsome mind,
Praise the Lord, for He is kind
For His mercies aye endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
E je k’a f’ inu didun
Yin Oluwa Olore
Anu Re O wa titi,
Lododo dajudaju

Niwaju ite Jehofa,
E f‘ayo sin, Orin‘ede
Mo p‘Oluwa, on nikan ni,
O le da, O si le parun

C:
His sovereign power, without our aid,
Made us of clay, and form’d us men;
And when like wandering sheep we stray’d,
He brought us to His fold again.
D:
Ipa Re, laisi ranwo wa,
F‘amo da wa ni eniyan;
Nigba t‘a sako b‘aguntan
O tun a mu si agbo Re

C:
We’ll crowd Thy gates with thankful songs,
High as the heavens our voices raise;
And earth, with her ten thousand tongues,
Shall fill Thy courts with sounding praise.
D:
A o f‘orin Sunmo ‘le Re,
Lohun giga l‘ao korin;
Ile, ‘legbarun ahon re,
Y‘o fiyin kun agbala Re

C:
Wide as the world is Thy command,
Vast as eternity Thy love;
Firm as a rock Thy truth must stand,
When rolling years shall cease to move.
D:
Ase Re gboro k‘agbaye,
Ife Re po b‘ayeraye;
Oto Re y‘o duro laelae
Gbat‘odun o dekun ‘yipo

C:
Through all the changing scenes of life,
In trouble and in joy,
The praises of my God shall still
My heart and tongue employ.
D:
N‘nu gbogbo ayida aye
Ayo on wahala;
Iyin Olorun ni y‘o ma
Wa l‘enu mi titi

C:
Oh, magnify the Lord with me,
With me exalt His name;
When in distress to Him I call’d,
He to my rescue came.
D:
Gbe Oluwa ga pelu mi,
Ba mi gb‘oko Re ga:
N‘nu wahala, ‘gba mo ke pe
O si yo mi kuro

C:
The hosts of God encamp around
The dwellings of the just;
Deliverance He affords to all
Who on His succor trust.
D:
Ogo Olorun wa yika
Ibugbe Oloto;
Eniti o ba gbekel'E,
Yio ri igbala

C:
Oh, make but trial of His love,
Experience will decide
How blest they are, and only they,
Who in His truth confide.
D:
Sa dan ife Re wo lekan
‘Gba na ‘wo o mo pe,
Awon t‘o di oro Re mu
Nikan l‘eni ‘bukun

C:
Fear Him, ye saints, and you will then
Have nothing else to fear;
Make you His service your delight,
Your wants shall be His care
D:
E beru Re, eyin mimo,
Eru miran ko si;
Sa je ki ‘sin Re j‘ayo yin
On y‘o ma tojun yin

C:
For mercies, countless as the sands,
Which daily I receive
From Jesus, my Redeemer's hands,
My soul, what canst thou give?

Alas, from such a heart as mine,
What can I bring forth?
My best is stain'd and dyed with sin
My all is nothing worth.
D:
Kini un o fi fun Oluwa,
Lat‘inu Okan mi?
Ese ti ba gbogbo re je,
Ko tile jamo nkan

C:
Yet this acknowledgement I'll make
For all He has bestow'd
Salvation's sacred cup I'll take,
And call upon my God
D:
Eyi l‘ohun t‘emi o se
F‘ohun t‘O se fun mi:
Emi o mu ago igbala,
Un o kepe Olorun

C:
The best return for one like me,
So wretched and so poor,
Is from His gifts to draw a plea,
And ask Him still for more.
D:
Eyi l‘ope ti mo le da,
Emi osi, are;
Em‘o ma soro ebun Re,
Un o si ma bere si.

C:
I cannot serve Him as I ought
No works have I to boast;
Yet would I glory in the thought
That I shall owe Him most
D:
Emi ko le sin boti to,
Nko n‘ise kan to pe,
Sugbon em‘o sogo yi pe,
Gbese ope mi po

C:
O for a thousand tongues to sing
My great Redeemer's praise,
The glories of my God and King,
The triumphs of his grace!
D:
Emi ‘ba n‘egberun ahon,
Fun ‘yin Olugbala,
Ogo Olorun Oba mi,
Isegun ore Re.

C:
Jesus! the name that charms our fears,
That bids our sorrows cease,
'Tis music in the sinner's ears,
'Tis life and health and peace.
D:
Jesu t‘o seru wa d‘ayo
T‘o mu banuje tan
Orin ni l‘eti elese
Iye at‘ilera

O segun agbara ese
O da onde sile,
Eje Re le w‘eleri mo,
Eje Re seun fun mi

O soro, oku gb‘ohun Re,
O gba emi titun,
Onirobinuje y‘ayo,
Otosi si gbagbo

Odi, e korin iyin re,
Aditi, gbohun Re;
Afoju, Olugbala de,
Ayaro, fo f‘ayo

C:
My gracious Master and my God,
Assist me to proclaim,
And spread through all the earth abroad
The honors of your name.
D:
Baba mi at‘Olorun mi,
Fun mi ni ‘ranwo Re;
Ki nle ro ka gbogbo aye,
Ola oruko Re.

C:
The strain upraise of joy and praise ,Alle/luai//
To the glory of their king shall the ransomed people  Sing// Allel/uia!// Alle/luia !
D:
E gbe ohun ayo at’ iyin ga, Alle/luya!
Orin ogo oba nla l’awon ti a rapada/
Y’o ma ko :Alle/luya!

C:
And the choirs that / dwells on high //
Shall re-echo /through the sky, //
Alle/luia! //Alle/luia !!
D:
Awon egbe ako/rin orun
Nwon o  gberin na yi/ka orun :
Alle/luya!Alle/luya

C:
They thro’ the fields of para/dise that roam,//
The blessed ones ,repeat thro’ / that bright home ,//Alle/luia //Alle/luia//
D:
Awon ti nrin gbefe kiri ni pa/radise
Awon eni bukun ni, nwon o ma ko/rin
Wipe, Alle/luya! Alle/luya!

C:
The planets glittering  on their /heavenly way ,//
The shinning constellation ,/join and say ,//
Alle /luia! Alle/luia!!
D:
Awon ‘rawo tin tan/ mole won
Ati gbogbo awon egbe irawo, da
Ohun won/lu wipe,Alle/luya Alle/luya!

C:
ye clouds that onward sweep,
ye wind on /pin-ions light ,//
ye thunders , echoing loud and deep , ye lightnings , /
wild-ly bright ;// in sweet con/sent u-nite / your Alle/luia!
D:
Enyin sanmo t’onwo si lo at’enyin/efufu
Eyin ara t’o nsan wa / enyin mana-mana
Efi a/yo gberin Alle/luya!

C:
Ye  floods and ocean billows , ye storms and/win-ter snow,//
Ye days of cloudless beauty hoar frost and/ sum-mer glow; //
Ye groves that wave in spring,and glorious /forests, sing,//Alle/luia!
D:
Enyin omi , at’igbi okun, enyin ojo,a/t’otutu
Enyin ojo dida/ra gbogbo’
Enyin igboro at igbo , e / gberin na

C:
First let the birds , with painted/ plumage gay ,//
Exalt their great creator’s / praise ,and say, //                                              
Alle/luia!// Alle/luia!
D:
Enyin oniruru eiye,e ko/rin iyin/Ele/
Da nyin pe,Alle/luya!Alle/luya!

C:
Then let the beast of earth, with / vary-ing strain,//
Join in creation’s hymn, and/ cry again,//
Alle/uia// Alle/luia!!
D:
Enyin eranko igbe,e d’ohun nyin  lu
E si korin iyin Ele/da wipe
Alle/luya!Alle/luya!

C:
Here let the mountains thunder forth /. Sonorous //  Alle/luia!
There let the valleys sing in gentler
Cho/rus//Alle/luia!!
D:
Je k awon oke k’o/bus ‘ ayo,Alle/luya!
K’awon petele si / gberin na
Alle/luya

C:
Thou jubilant abyss of / ocean , cry,// Alle/luia!
Ye tract of earth and conti/nents reply//
Alle/luia!
D:
Enyin ogbun omi okun,e/ko wipe Alle/luya!
Enyin ile gbigbe e da / hun wipe
Alle/luya!

C:
To God , who all cre/ation made//                  
The frequent hymn be / duly paid;//
Alle/luia! Alle/luia!!
D:
Olorun t’o / da aiye ni k’a / f’orin yin ;
Alle/luya! Alle/luya!

C:
This is the strain, the eternal strain, the Lord of/all things loves://
All/luia!
This is the song, the heavenly song, that ChristHim/ self approves://
Alle/luia!
D:
Eyi l’orin ti o/ lorun fe’ Alle/luya!
Eyi ni Krist’tika/lare fe Alle/luya!

C:
wherefore we sing , both heart and a voice a/waking .//
Alle/luia!
And children’s voices echo , answers /making , //Alle/lluia!
D:
Nitorina tokantokan l’ao/fi korin Alle/luya!
Awon omode wewewe y’o gba orin na / ko wipe
Alle/luya!

C:
Now from all men / be out –pour’d//
Alleluia to the lord; //       
With Alleluia / ever more // The son and spirit /we adore.
D:
Ki gbogbo enia / ki o ko Alleluya si / Olorun;
Alleluia ti / aiye,fun omo on E/miMImo

C:
Praise be done to the Three in one,         
Alle / luia! Alle / luia!
Alle / luia // Alle/ luia!
D:
Ogo ni f’Olo/go Meta
Alle/luya! Alle/luya! Alle / luya

E wole f’Oba, Ologo julo
E korin ipa ati ife Re
Alabo wa ni at’Eni igbani
O ngbe ‘nu ogo, Eleru ni iyin

C:
Oh tell of His might, oh sing of His grace,
Whose robe is the light, whose canopy space.
His chariot of wrath deep thunderclouds form,
And dark is His path on the wings of the storm.
D:
E so t’ipa Re, e so t’ore Re
‘Mole l’aso Re, gobi Re orun
Ara ti nsan ni keke ‘binu Re je
Ipa ona Re ni a ko si le mo

C:
The earth, with its store of wonders untold,
Almighty, Thy power hath founded of old,
Hath stablish'd it fast by a changeless decree,
And round it hath cast, like a mantle, the sea.
D:
Aiye yi pelu ekun ‘yanu Re
Olorun agbara Re l’oda won
O fi id ire mule, ko si le yi
O si f’ okun se aso igunwa Re.

C:
Thy bountiful care what tongue can recite?
It breathes in the air; it shines in the light;
It streams from the hills, it descends to the plain,
And sweetly distills in the dew and the rain.
D:
Enu ha le so ti itoju Re?
Ninu afefe ninu imole
Itoju Re wa nin’ odo ti o nsan
O si wa ninu iri ati ojo

C:
Frail children of dust, and feeble as frail,
In Thee do we trust, nor find Thee to fail;
Thy mercies, how tender how firm to the end,
Our Maker, Defender, Redeemer, and Friend.
D:
Awa erupe aw’alailera
‘Wo l’a gbekele, O ki o da ni
Anu Re rorun o si le de opin
Eleda, Alabo, Olugbala wa

C:
O measureless Might, ineffable Love,
While angels delight to hymn Thee above,
The humbler creation, though feeble their lays,
With true adoration shall lisp to Thy praise.
D:
‘Wo Alagbara Oni ‘fe julo
B’awon angeli ti nyin O l’oke
Be l’awa eda Re, niwon t’a le se
A o ma juba Re, a o ma yin O.

C:
All hail the power of Jesus' name! 
Let angels prostrate fall;
Bring forth the royal diadem,
And crown Him, Lord of all.
D:
Gbogbo aiye, gbe Jesu ga
Angel’, e wole fun
E mu ade Oba Re wa,
Se l’ Oba awon oba

C:
Crown Him, ye martyrs of our God,
Who from His altar call;
Extol the Stem of Jesse's Rod,
And crown Him, Lord of all.
D:
E se l’ Oba enyin Martyr,
Ti npe ni pepe Re
Gbe gbongbo-igi Jese ga
Se l’ Oba awon oba

C:
Ye seed of Israel's chosen race,
Ye Ransom'd of the fall,
Hail Him who saves you by His grace,
And crown Him, Lord of all.
D:
Eyin iru omo Isreal,
Ti a ti rapada
E ki Enit’ O gba nyin la
Se l’ Oba awon oba

C:
Sinners, whose love can ne'er forget
The wormwood and the gall,
Go, spread your trophies at His feet,
And crown Him, Lord of all.
D:
Gbogbo enia elese
Ranti ‘banuje nyin
E te ‘kogun nyin s’ ese Re
Se l’ Oba awon oba

C:
Let every kindred, every tribe
On this terrestrial ball,
To Him all majesty ascribe,
And crown Him, Lord of all.
D:
Ki gbogbo orile-ede
Ni gbogbo agbaiye
Ki won ki, « Kabiyesile
Se l’ Oba awon oba

C:
Oh that with yonder sacred throng,
We at His feet may fall! 
There join the everlasting song,
And crown Him, Lord of all.
D:
A ba le pel’ awon t’ orun
Lati ma juba Re
K’a bale jo jumo korin
Se l’ Oba awon oba

C:
Alleluia! Songs of gladness,
Voice of everlasting joy;
Alleluia sound the sweetest
Heard among the choirs on high,
Hymning in God’s blissful mansion
Day and night incessantly.
D:
Alleluya! Orin t’ o dun,
Ohun ayo ti ki ku:
Alleluya! Orin didun,
T’ awon t’ o wa l’orun fe:
N’ ile ti Olorun mi ngbe,
Ni won nko tosantoru.

C:
Alleluia church victorious,
Thou mayst lift the joyful strain.
Alleluia! Songs of triumph
Well befit the ransom’d train
Faint and feeble are our praises
While in Exile we remain.
D:
Alleluya! Ijo orun,
E le korin ayo na,
Alleluya! Orin ‘segun
YE awon t’ a rapada.
Awa ero at’ a- *oielejo,
Iyin wa ko nilari.

C:
Alleluia! Songs of triumph
Suit not always souls forlorn.
Alleluia! Sounds of sadness
‘Midst our joyful strains are borne
For in this dark world of sorrow
We with tears our sins must mourn.
D:
Alleluia! Orin ayo
Ko ye wa nigbagbogbo.
Alleluia! Ohun aro
Da mo orin ayo wa;
Gbat’ a wa laiye osi yi
A ni gbawe f’ ese wa.

C:
Praise with our prayers uniting,
Hear us, blesses Trinity,
Bring us to thy blissful presence,
There the paschal Lamb to see,
There to Thee our alleluia
Singing everlasting.  Amen
D:
Iyin dapo m’ adura wa;
Gbo tiwa, Metalokan!
Mu wa de ‘waju Re layo,
K’ a r’ Odagutan t’a pa
K’ a le ma ko Alleluya
Nibe lai ati lailai.  Amin

Okan mi yin Oba orun
Mu ore wa s’ odo re
‘Wo t’a wosan, t’a dariji
Tal a ba ha yin bi Re ?
Yin Oluwa, yin Oluwa
Yin Oba ainipekun

C:
Praise Him for His grace and favour
To our fathers in distress;
Praise Him, still the same as ever,
Slow to chide and swift to bless:
Praise Him! praise Him! (2ce)
Glorious in His faithfullness.
D:
Yin fun anu t’O ti f ihan
F’awon Baba ‘nu ponju
Yin L Okan na ni titi
O lora lati binu
Yin Oluwa, yin Oluwa
Ologo n’nu otito

C:
Father-like He tends and spares us,
Well our feeble frame He knows;
In His hands He gently bears us,
Rescues us from all our foes:
Praise Him! praise Him! (2ce)
Widely as His mercy flows.
D:
Bi baba ni O ntoju wa
O si mo ailera wa
Jeje l’ O ngbe wa l’apa Re
O gba wa lowo ota
Yin Oluwa, yin Oluwa
Anu Re, yi aiye ka

C:
Just like grass, our lives be compared,
Which can faint when the wind blows
For a while we live and we die
But the Lord remains the same
Praise Him, praise Him, (2ce)
Praise the everlasting King.
D:
A ngba b' itanna eweko
T' afefe nfe, t'o si nro
Gbati a nwa, ti a si nku
Olorun wa bakanna
Yin oluwa, yin oluwa
Oba alainipekun

C:
Angels, help us to adore Him,
Ye behold Him face to face;
Sun and moon, bow down before Him,
Dwellers all in time and space:
Praise Him! praise Him, (2ce)
Praise with us the God of grace.
D:
Angel’ e jumo ba wa bo
Eyin ri i l’ ojukoju
Orun, Osupa, e wole
Ati gbogbo agbaiye
E ba wa yin, e ba wa yin
Olorun Olotito.

C:
To God be the glory, great things He hath done!                                                          
So lov'd He the world that He gave us His Son,                                                             
Who yielded |His life an atonement for sin,                                                                   
And open'd the life gate that all may go in.
Praise the Lord, praise the Lord,
Let the earth hear His voice,
Praise the Lord, praise the Lord,
Let the people rejoice!
O come to the Father thro' Jesus the Son,
And give Him the glory, great things He hath done.
D:
Ogo ni f’ Oluwa, to se ohun nla;
Ife lo mu k’O fun wa ni Omo Re,
Eniti O f’ emi Re lele fe’se wa,
T’O si s’ilekun iye sile fun wa.
Yin Oluwa, yin Oluwa,
FIyin fun Oluwa!
Yin Oluwa, yin Oluwa,
E yo n’iwaju Re!
K’a to baba wa lo, L’oruko Jesu,
Jek’a jo f’ ogo fun Onise ’yanu.

C:
O perfect redemption, the purchase of blood,
To ev'ry believer the promise of God;
The vilest offender who truly believes,
That moment from Jesus a pardon receives.
D:
Irapada kikun, ti Eje Re ra,
F’ enikeni t’o gba ileri Re gbo;
Enit’o buruju b’o ba le gbagbo,
Lojukanna y’o ri idariji gba.

C:
Great things He hath taught us, great things He hath done,
And great our rejoicing thro' Jesus the Son;
But purer, and higher, and greater will be
Our wonder, our transport, when Jesus we see
D:
O s’ohun nla fun wa, O da wa l’ola.
Ayo wa di kikun ninu Omo Re;
Ogo ati ewa Irapada yi
Y’o ya wa l’enu ’gbat’ a ba ri Jesu.

C:
O Lord of heaven and earth and sea,
To Thee all praise and glory be.
How shall we show our love to Thee,
Giver of all?
D:
Oluwa orun on aiye,
‘Wo n’iyin at’ ope ye fun;
Bawo l’a ba ti fe O to
Onibu Ore?

C:
The golden sunshine, vernal air,
Sweet flowers and fruit, Thy love declare.
Where harvests ripen, Thou art there,
Giver of all.
D:
Orun tin ran, at’ afefe,
Gbogbo eweko nso ‘fe Re;
‘Wo l’ O nmu irugbin dara,
Onibu Ore

C:
For peaceful homes and healthful days,
For all the blessings earth displays,
We owe Thee thankfulness and praise,                    
Giver of all
D:
Fun ara lile wa gbogbo,
Fun gbogbo ibukun aiye,
Awa yin O, a si dupe.
Onibu Ore.

C:
Thou didst not spare Thine only Son,
But gav'st Him for a world undone,
And freely with that Blessed One
Thou givest all.
D:
O ko du wa li Omo Re
O fi fun aiye ese wa,
O si f’ ebun gbogbo pelu,
Onibu Ore.

C:
Thou giv'st the Holy Spirit's dower,
Spirit of Life and Love and Power,
And dost His sevenfold graces shower
Upon us all.
D:
O fun wa l’ Emi Mimo Re,
Emi iye at’ agbara,
O rojo ekun bukun Re.
Le wa lori.

C:
For souls redeem'd for sins forgiven,
For means of grace and hopes of heaven,
What can to Thee, O Lord, be given
Who givest all?
D:
Fun dariji ese wa,
Ati fun ireti orun,
Kil’ ohun t’ a ba fi fun O?
Onibu Ore.

Owo ti a nna, ofo ni,
Sugbon eyi t’a ba fi fun O?
O je isura tit’ aiye
Onibu Ore.

C:
Whatever, Lord, we lend to Thee                             
Repaid a thousand fold will be,                                  
Then gladly will we give to Thee,                              
Giver of all;
D:
Ohun t’ a bun O Oluwa,
‘Wo o san le pada fun wa;
L’ayo l’ a o ta O lore
Onibu Ore.

C:
To Thee, from whom we all derive
Our life, our gifts, our power to give.
Oh, may we ever with Thee live,
Giver of all.
D:
Ni odo Re l’ati san wa,
Olorun Olodumare;
Je k’a le ba O gbe titi,
Onibu Ore. Amin

C:
Awake, my soul, to joyful lays
And sing Thy great Redeemer's praise.
He justly claims a song from me,
His loving kindness, oh, how free!
D:
Ji okan mi, dide l’ayo
Korin iyin Olugbala;
Ola Re bere orin mi :
‘Seun ife Re tip o to.!

C:
He saw me ruined in the Fall,
Yet loved me not withstanding all.
He saved me from my lost estate,
His loving kindness, oh, how great!
D:
O ri mo segbe n’ isubu,
Sibe, O fe mi l’a fetan’
O yo mi ninu osi mi:
‘Seun ife Re tip o to.!

C:
Tho’ num’rous hosts of mighty foes
Tho’ earth and hell my way oppose
He safely leads my soul along
His loving-kindness, oh, how strong.
D:
Ogun ota dide si mi,
Aiye at’ esu ndena mi,
O nmu mi la gbogbo re ja:
‘Seun ife Re tip o to.!

C:
This weak heart of mine is always,
Transgressing the laws of the Lord,
The more I tend to forget him
His endless love will never fail.
D:
‘Gbagbogbo l’okan ese mi
Nfe ya lehin Oluwa mi;
Sugbon bi mo ti ngbagbe Re,
Iseun ife Re ki ye.  Amin

C:
Head of Thy Church triumphant,
We joyfully adore Thee;
Till Thou appear, Thy members here
Shall sing like those in glory.
We lift our hearts and voices
With blest anticipation,
And cry aloud, and give to God
The praise of our salvation
D:
Olori ijo t’orun
L’ayo l’a wole fun O;
K' O to de ijo t' aiye
Y'o ma korin bi t’orun
A gbe okan wa s’oke
Ni ’reti t’o ni ‘bukun
Awa kigbe, awa f’ iyin
F' Olorun igbala wa.

C:
While in affliction’s furnace,
And passing through the fire,
Thy love we praise, which knows our days,
And ever brings us nigher.
We clap our hands exulting
In Thine almighty favor;
The love divine which made us Thine
Shall keep us Thine for ever.
D:
Gbat’a wa ninu 'ponju,
T'a nkoja ninu ina,
Orin ife l’ awa o ko
Ti o nmu wa sun mo O
Awa sape, a si yo
Ninu ojurere Re
Ife to so wa di Tire
Y’o se wa ni Tire lai.

C:
Thou dost conduct Thy people
Through torrents of temptation,
Nor will we fear, while Thou art near,
The fire of tribulation.
The world with sin and Satan
In vain our march opposes,
Through Thee we shall break through them all,
And sing the song of Moses.
D:
Iwo mu awon enia Re
Koja isan idanwo
A ki o beru wahala
'Tori O wa nitosi
Aiye, ese at' esu,
Koju ja si wa lasan
L’ agbara Re a o segun
A o si ko orin Mose.

C:
By faith we see the glory
To which Thou shalt restore us,
The cross despise for that high prize
Which Thou hast set before us.
And if Thou count us worthy,
We each, as dying Stephen,
Shall see Thee stand at God’s right hand,
To take us up to Heaven.
D:
Awa f’ igbagbo r’ogo
T'O tun nfe fi wa si
A kegan aiye ‘tori
Ere nla iwaju wa
Bi O ba si ka wa ye
Awa pelu Stefen t' o sun
Y’o ri O bo ti duro
Lati pe wa lo sorun

C:
All people that on earth do dwell,
Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice,
Him serve with mirth, His praise forthtell;
Come ye before Him and rejoice.
D:
Gbogbo eyin ti ngbe aiye
E f’ ayo korin s’ Oluwa;
F’ iberu sin, e yin l’ ogo
E wa s’ odo Re, k’ e si yo.

C:
Oh enter then His gates with praise,
Approach with joy His courts unto;
Praise, Laud, and bless His name always,
For it is seemly so to do.
D:
Nje, f’ iyin wo ile Re wa
F’ ayo sunmo agbala Re;
Yin, k’ e bukun oruko Re,
’Tori o ye be lati se.

Eese! Rere l’ Olorun wa,
Anu Re o wa titi lae,
Ooto Re ko figbakan ye,
O duro lat’ iran-de-ran.

C:
Now thank we all our God
With heart and hands and voices,
Who wondrous things has done,
In whom his world rejoices;
Who from our mothers' arms
Hath blessed us on our way
With countless gifts of love,
And still is ours to-day.
D:
A f’ope f’ Olorun
L’okan ati l’ohun wa
Eni s’ohun ‘yanu
N’nu Enit’ araiye nyo
Gbat’ a wa l’ om’owo
On na l’ o ntoju wa
O si nf’ ebun ife
Se ‘toju wa sibe

C:
Oh may this bounteous God
Through all our life be near us,
With ever joyful hearts
And blessed peace to cheer us,
And keep us in his grace,
And guide us when perplex’d,
And free us from all ills
In this world and the next.
D:
Oba onib’ore
Ma fi wa sile lailai
Ayo ti ko l’opin
On ‘bukun y’ o je tiwa
Pa wa mo n’nu ore
To wa gb’ a ba damu
Yo wa ninu ibi
Laiye ati l’ orun

C:
All praise and thanks to God
The Father now be given,
The Son and Spirit blest,
Supreme reign in highest heaven
The One eternal God,
Whom heaven and earth adore;
For thus it was, is now,
And shall be evermore.
D:
K’ a f’ iyin on ope
F’ Olorun Baba Omo
Ati Emi Mimo
Ti o ga julo l’ orun
Olorun kan lailai
T’ aiye at’ orun mbo
Be l’ o wa d’ isiyi
Beni y’o wa lailai

C:
Praise, O praise our God and King;
Hymns of adoration sing:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
Yin Qlorun Oba wa,
E gbe ohun iyin ga,
Anu Re, o wa titi;
L‘ododo dajudaju.

C:
Praise him that he made the sun
Day by day his course to run:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
Yin Enit‘o da orun
Ti o nran lojojumo,
Anu Re, o wa titi;
L‘ododo dajudaju.

C:
And the silver moon by night,
Shining with her gentle light:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
Ati osupa l‘oru,
Tio tan ‘mole jeje,
Anu Re,owa titi
L‘ododo dajudaju.

C:
Praise him that he gave the rain
To mature the swelling grain:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
Yin Enit‘om‘ojo ro,
T‘o mu irugbin dagba,
Anu Re, o wa titi:
L‘ododo dajudaju.

C:
And hath bid the fruitful field
Crops of precious increase yield:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.

Praise him for our harvest-store;
He hath filled the garner-floor:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
Yin fun ikore oko,
O mu ki aka wa kun,
Anu Re, o watiti,
L‘ododo dajudaju.

C:
And for richer food than this,
Pledge of everlasting bliss:
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
D:
Yin f onje t‘o ju yi lo,
Eri ‘bukun ailopin
Anu Re, o wa titi;
L‘ododo dajudaju.

C:
Glory to our bounteous King;
Glory let creation sing:
Glory to the Father, Son,
And blest Spirit, Three in One.
D:
Ogo f’ Oba olore
Ki gbogbo eda gberin,
Ogo fun Baba, Omo
At‘Emi: Metalokan.

C:
Praise to the Holiest in the height,
And in the depth be praise:
In all his words most wonderful,
Most sure in all his ways.
D:
Iyin f Eni mimo julo
L‘oke ati ni ‘le;
Oro Re gbogbo je ‘yanu,
Gbogb‘ ona Re daju.

C:
O loving wisdom of our God!
When all was sin and shame,
A second Adam to the fight
And to the rescue came.
D:
Ogbon Olorun ti po to
‘Gbat‘ eniyan subu;
Adam‘ keji wa s‘oju ‘ja .
Ati lati gbala.

C:
O wisest love! That flesh and blood,
Which did in Adam fail,
Should strive afresh against the foe,
Should strive and should prevail;
D:
Ogbon ife! p‘eran ara
T‘o gbe Adam‘ subu
Tun b‘ota ja ija otun
K‘o ja, k‘o si s‘egun.

C:
And that a higher gift than grace
Should flesh and blood refine,
God's presence and his very self,
And essence all-divine.
D:
Ati p‘ebun t‘o j‘or-ofe
So ara di otun
Olorun papa tikare
J‘Olorun ninu wa.

C:
O generous love! That he, who smote
In Man for man the foe,
The double agony in Man
For man should undergo;
D:
Ife ‘yanu! ti Eni ti
O pa ota eniyan
Ninu awo awa eniyan
Je irora f‘eniyan.

C:
And in the garden secretly,
And on the cross on high,
Should teach his brethren, and inspire
To suffer and to die.
D:
Nikoko, ninu ogba ni
Ati l‘ori igi
T‘o si ko wa lati jiya
T‘o ko wa lati ku.

C:
Praise to the Holiest in the height,
And in the depth be praise:
In all his words most wonderful,
Most sure in all his ways.
D:
Iyin f‘Eni mimo julo
L‘oke ati nile
Oro Re gbogbo je ‘yanu
Gbogb‘ ona Re daju.

C:
O Day of rest and gladness,
O Day of joy and light,
O balm of care and sadness,
Most beautiful, most bright,
On Thee, the high and lowly
Through ages join'd in tune,
Sing, "Holy, holy, holy,"To the great God Triune..
D:
Ojo ‘simi at’ ayo
Ojo inu didun
Itunu fun ibanuje
Ojo dida julo
Ti awon eni giga
Niwaju ite Re
Nko MIMO, MIMO, MIMO,
S’eni Metalokan

C:
On thee at the Creation
The light first had its birth;
On thee for our salvation
Christ rose from depth of earth;
On thee our Lord victorious
The Spirit sent from heaven,
And thus on thee, most glorious,
A triple light was given
D:
L’ ojo yi ni ‘mole la
Nigba dida aiye
Ati fun igbala wa
Kristi jinde loni
L’ ojo oni l’ Oluwa
Ran Emi t’ orun wa
Ojo ologo julo
T’ o ni ‘mole pipe

Orisun ‘tura ni O
L’ aiye aginju yi
L’ ori Re bi ni Pisga
L’ a nwo ‘le ileri
Ojo ironu didun
Ojo ife mimo
Ojo ajinde, lati
Aiye, si nkan orun

C:
To-day on weary nations
The heavenly manna falls;
To holy convocations
The silver trumpet calls,
Where Gospel-light is glowing
With pure and radiant beams
And living water flowing
With soul-refreshing streams.
D:
L’ oni s’ ilu t’ aare mu
Ni manna t’ orun nbo
Si ipejopo mimo
N’ ipe fadaka ndun
Nibiti Ihin rere
Ntan imole mimo
Omi iye nsan jeje
Ti ntu okan lara

C:
May we, new graces  gaining
From this our day of rest,
Attain the rest remaining
To spirits of the blest.
And there our voice upraising
To Father, and to Son;
And Holy Ghost, be praising
Ever the Three in One
D:
K’ a r’ ore-ofe titun
L’ ojo ‘simi wa yi
K’ a si de ‘simi t’ o ku
F’ awon alabukun
Nibe k’ a gbohun soke
Si Baba at’ Omo
Ati si Emi Mimo
N’ iyin Metalokan

C:
We all love to see Thee,
O thou, good sabbath day
all the days of the week inquire
How long wilt thou tarry?
D:
A be, A fe ri O
Ojo ‘simi rere
Gbogbo ose ama wipe
Iwo o ti pe to?

C:
Thou teacheeth us to know
That Christ rose from the dead
All the days of the week inquire
How long wilt thou tarry?
D:
O ko wa pe Kristi
Jinde ninu oku
Gbogbo ose ama wipe
Iwo o ti pe to?

C:
Thou telleth of Thy power
As Jesus rose from dead,
All the days of the week inquire
How long wilt thou tarry?
D:
O so t’ ajinde wa
Gegebi ti Jesu
Gbogbo ose ama wipe
Iwo o ti pe to?

C:
Thou speak of living rest
In the city of peace;
For all blessed saints in Jesus
How long wilt Thou tarry?
D:
Iwo so ti’ isimi
T’ilu alafia
T’ ibukun enia mimo
Iwo o tip e to?

C:
O mighty Lord of Sabbath day,
Hear us and be with us today;
We all assemble for prayers
And to hear the word Yhou gave us.
D:
Oluwa ojo isimi
Gbo tiwa pelu wa loni
A wa pade fun adura
A fe gb’ oro t’ O fi fun wa

C:
The earthly rest simple to have
But yonder rest more delighting
All our cares shall soon come to end
We shall rest without sin no more.
D:
Isimi t’ aiye yi rorun
Sugbon isimi t’ ohun dun
Lala okan wa fe ‘jo na
T’ a simi lailese da

C:
No more quarrel no commotion,
No anxiety like the world's
That mingle with our glorious song
That come forth from undying lips.
D:
Ko si ‘ja ko si ‘dagiri
Ko s’ aniyan bi t’ aiye yi
T’ y’ o dapo mo ikorin wa
T’ o nt’ ete aiku jade wa

C:
Oh come the day we much expect
Thy dawn shall be a joy to us
These cares we would get rid once all
We sleep in death and rise in joy.
D:
Bere ojo t’ a ti nreti
Afemoju re l’a fe ri
A fe yo lona ise yi
K’ a si de ibi ‘simi na.

C:
Jesus we assembled
On this Thy holy day;
And we surround Thy throne
On this Thy holy day;
Thou our friend in Heavens
Our prayers shall come to Thee
Look after our spirit
On this Thy holy day.
D:
Jesu a fe pade
L’ ojo Re mimo yi
A si y’ ite Re ka
L’ ojo Re mimo yi
‘Wo Ore wa orun
Adura wa mbo wa
Bojuwo emi wa
L’ojo Re mimo yi

C:
We must never backslide,
On this Thy holy day;
In reverence down we kneel,
On this Thy holy day;
Forgive our misconduct,
Teach us that we may know
The right way to serve Thee
On this Thy holy day.
D:
A ko gbodo lora
L’ ojo Re mimo yi
Li eru a kunle
L’ ojo Re mimo yi
Ma taro ise wa
K’ iwo k’ o si ko wa
K’ a sin O b’o ti ye
L’ ojo Re mimo yi

C:
To Thy words we pay heed,
On this Thy holy day;
Bless the word we receive
On this Thy holy day;
Go with us when we go,
Pour gift of salvation
Deep into all our hearts
On this Thy holy day.
D:
A te ‘ti s’oro Re
L’ojo Re mimo yi
Bukun oro t’a gbo
L’ojo Re mimo yi
Ba wa lo ‘gba t’a lo
F’ ore igbala Re
Si aiya wa gbogbo
L’ ojo Re mimo yi

Eyi l‘ojo t‘Oluwa da,
O pe ‘gba na n‘ti Re;
Korun k‘o yo, k‘aye ko yo
K‘iyin yi ‘te na ka.

C:
Today He rose and left the dead,
And Satan’s empire fell;
Today the saints His triumphs spread,
And all His wonders tell.
D:
Loni O jinde n‘nu oku,
Ijoba satan ‘tu
‘Won mimo tan ‘segun Re ka
Won ns‘oro ‘yanu Re.

C:
Hosanna to the anointed king,
To David’s holy Son;
Help us, O Lord; descend and bring
Salvation from Thy throne.
D:
Hosana si Oba t‘a yan
S‘omo mimo Dafid‘,
Oluwa, jo sokale wa
T‘Iwo t‘igbala Re.

C:
Hosanna in the highest strains
The Church on earth can raise;
The highest heavens, in which He reigns,
Shall give Him nobler praise.
D:
Hosana ki ohun goro,
L‘orin ijo t‘aye,
Orin t‘oke orun l‘ohun,
Yio dun ju be lo.

C:
Happy is the sabbath day for me
All all its bells and its sermon,
When deep sorrow I am found,
They changed my sadness into joy
D:
Ayo l’ojo ‘simi fun mi
At’agogo at’iwasu
Gbat’ a ba mi n’nu ‘banuje
Awon l’o nmu inu mi dun

C:
Happy also are all the hours,
Which are spent in the House of God
To Learn lessons of prayer,.
To receive manna of Thy word.
D:
Ayo si ni wakati na
Ti mo lo n’nu agbala Re
Lati mo adun adura
Lati gba manna oro Re

C:
Happy are the answers Amen,
That filled every where in the house,
Intermittently it soundeth,
And pass homeward bound to the Lord
D:
Ayo ni idahun ‘Amin’
T’o gba gbogbo ile na kan
Lekokan l’o ndun t’o nrole
O nkoja lo sodo Baba

C:
if world may wish to cause me delay
And its six- day great commitment,
O Lord I pray Thee break the chain
And set my soul free to praise thee
D:
B’aiye fe f’ agbara de mi
Mo ise ijo mefa re
Oluwa jo tu ide na
K’ O so okan mi d’omnira

C:
When Jesus comes to reward His servants,
Whether it be noon or night,
Faithful to Him will He find us watching,
With our lamps all trimmed and bright?
Chorus:
O can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready for the soul’s bright home?
Say, will He find you and me still watching,
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come?
D:
Gba Jesu de lati fere fun wa,
Yala osan tab‘ale,
Y‘o ha ba wa, ka ma foto sona,
K‘atupa wa si ma jo?
A ha le wipe, a se tan, ara,
Fun ‘le wa didan l‘oke?
Wi, y‘O ha ba ‘WO at‘emi nsona?
Nsona, nsona n‘gb‘Oluwa o de?

C:
If at the dawn of the early morning,
He shall call us one by one,
When to the Lord we restore our talents,
Will He answer thee—“Well done"?
Chorus: O can we say we are ready, brother?
D:
Nje bo ba je oro kutukutu,
T‘O ba pe wa ni kokan,
‘Gbat‘ a ba da Talenti wa pada,
Y'O ha wi fun o, “o seun?”

C:
Have we been true to the trust He left us?
Do we seek to do our best?
If in our hearts there is naught condemns us,
We shall have a glorious rest.
Chorus: O can we say we are ready, brother?
D:
A ha soto s‘eyi t‘O fi fun wa?
Gbogbo ipa wa la nsa?
Ti ko ba si ‘dalebi l‘okan wa
‘Simi ologo lao ni

C:
Blessed are those whom the Lord finds watching,
In His glory they shall share;
If He shall come at the dawn or midnight,
Will He find us watching there?
Chorus: O can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready, Brother?
D:
‘Bukun l‘awon ti Krist‘ ri to nsona,
Won o pin nin‘ogo Re;
Bi l‘aro tabi oganjo oru
Y‘O ha ba wa be nsona?

C:
Jesus is coming with joy in the sky
Oh happy day! Oh, happy day!
Then all who love Him shall heaven-ward fly:
Oh happy day! happy day!
Upward shall fly to the Lord in the air,
Together with Jesus we all shall be there,
Far from the earth and from sorrow and care:
Oh happy day! happy day!
D:
Jesu mbo l‘ofurufu pel‘ayo,
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Awon t‘o fe yo fo lo pade Re,
Ojo ayo! ayo nla.
Won yo pade Oluwa ni sanma,
Gbogbo wa pelu Jesu yo wa nibe,
Ao bo lowo aniyan at‘aro;
Ojo ayo! ayo nla!

C:
Parents and children shall then again meet;
Oh happy day! Oh happy day!
Sisters and brothers oh, it will be sweet!
Oh happy day! happy day!
We miss’d them on earth, to Jesus they went;
We love them as ever their absence lament
Soon we shall meet them and then be content,
Oh happy day! happy day!
D:
Awon obi, omo yo tun pade;
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Arakunrin pelu arabirin,
Ojo ayo! Ojo nla
Won mbe l‘odo Krist‘ a ko ri won mo,
Ibanuje ni lilo won je fun wa;
Sugbon ao pade laipe pel‘ayo,
Ojo ayo! ayo nla!

C:
Are we all ready, should Jesus now call?
Oh happy day! oh happy day!
Would each one answer, the great and the small?
Oh happy day! happy day!
We long to rise up and with thee to be,
Thy face, blessed Jesus Our Saviour to see
Would you then, dear children, sing sweetly with me?
Oh happy day! happy day!
D:
Gbogbo wa ha setan fun bibo Re?
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Omode ati agba ha se tan!
Fojo nla! Ojp ayo!
A nfe lati wa l‘odo Re laelae
K‘a le ma wo oju ati ewa Re,
Eyin ara, e korin nitori
Ojo nla na t‘ao pade.

C:
There's a great day coming,
A great day coming,
There's a great day coming by and by;
When the saints and the sinners shall be parted right and left,
Are you ready for that day to come?
Chorus:
Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
For the judgment day?
D:
Ojo nla kan mbo wa,
Ojo nla kan mbo;
Ojo nla kan mbo wa, nigbose,
T‘awon eniyan mimo at‘elese y‘o pinya,
Iwo ha setan fun ojo na?
O ha setan? O ha se tan?
O setan fun ojo idajo?
O ha setan? O ha setan?
Fun OJO ‘dajo.

C:
There's a bright day coming,
A bright day coming,
There's a bright day coming by and by;
But its brightness shall only come to them that love the Lord,
Are you ready for that day to come?
Chorus: Are you ready, are you ready,
D:
Ojo didan kan mbo
Ojo na mbo wa,
Ojo didan ‘kan mbo, nigbose,
Sugbon didan re je ti awon t‘o fe Oluwa
IWO ha se tan fun ojo na?

C:
There's a sad day coming,
A sad day coming,
There's a sad day coming by and by;
When the sinner shall hear his doom,
"Depart, I know ye not,"Are you ready for that day to come?
Chorus: Are you ready, are you ready,
D:
Ojo ‘banuje mbo,
Ojo na mbo wa,
Ojo ‘banuje mbo nigbose
Ti elese y‘o gbo pe: lo, Emi ko mo yin ri‘
Iwo ha setan fun ojo na?

C:
Hark the glad sound! The Savior comes,
The Savior promised long;
Let every heart prepare a throne
And every voice a song.
D:
Gbo 'gbe ayo! Oluwa de,
Jesu t' a seleri;
Ki gbogbo okan mura de,
K' ohun mura ko ' rin

C:
He comes the prisoners to release,
In Satan's bondage held.
The gates of brass before Him burst,
The iron fetters yield.
D:
O de lati t' onde sile,
L' oko eru Esu;
'Lekun 'de fo niwaju Re,
Sekeseke 'rin da.

C:
He comes from thickest films of vice
To clear the mental ray
And on the eyeballs of the blind
To pour celestial day.
D:
O de larin 'baje aiye
Lati tan 'mole Re,
Lati inu k’awon afoju
Le f’ oju won riran

C:
He comes the broken heart to bind,
The bleeding soul to cure,
And with the treasures of His grace
To enrich the humble poor.
D:
O de! 'Tinu f' okan 'rora,
Iwosan f' agbogbe;
Pelu 'sura or’ ofe Re
Fun awon talaka.

C:
Our glad hosannas, Prince of Peace,
Thy welcome shall proclaim
And heaven's eternal arches ring
With Thy beloved name.
D:
Hosanna, Oba 'lafia
A o kede bibo Re;
Gbogbo orun y'o ma korin
Oruko t' a feran

C:
Thou art coming, O my Savior,
Thou art coming, O my King,
In Thy beauty all-resplendent,
In Thy glory all-transcendent;
Well may we rejoice and sing;
Coming: - In the opening east,
Herald brightness slowly swells:
Coming: - O my glorious Priest,
Hear we not Thy golden bells?
D:
Iwo mbo wa, Oluwa mi,
IWO mbo wa, Qba mi,
Ninu itansan ewa Re,
Ninu titayo ogo Re,
O ye k‘a yo, k‘a korin;
O mbo ni ila orun
Awon akede npo si,
O mbo: Alufa ogo;
A ko ha ngbo ago Re ?.

C:
Thou art coming, Thou art coming;
We shall meet Thee on Thy way;
We shall see Thee, we shall know Thee,
We shall bless Thee, we shall show Thee
All our hearts could never say:
What an anthem that will be,
Music rapturously sweet
Pouring out our love to Thee,
At Thine own all-glorious feet.
D:
IWO mbo wa, IWO mbo wa
A o pade Re l‘ona
A o ri O, a o mo O,
A o yin O: gbogbo okan
L‘a o sipaya fun O;
Orin ki leyi o je
Orin t‘o dun rekoja;
A o tu ‘fe wa jade
Si ese Re. Ologo.

C:
Thou art coming, at Thy Table
We are witnesses for this;
While remembering hearts Thou meetest
In communion clearest, sweetest,
Earnest of our coming bliss,
Showing not Thy death alone,
And Thy love exceeding great,
But Thy coming and Thy throne,
All for which we long and wait.
D:
IWO mbo wa, ni tabil‘ Re,
L‘awa njeri si eyi;
T‘a mo p‘O npade okan wa
Ni idapo mimo julo
Eri ibukun ti mbo
Ko f‘iku Re nikan han,
At‘ife titobi Re;
Sugbon bibo Re pelu
T‘a nfe, t‘a si nduro de.

C:
Oh the joy to see Thee reigning,
Thee my own beloved Lord!
Every tongue Thy Name confessing,
Worship, honor, glory, blessing,
Brought to Thee with one accord;
Thee, my Master and my Friend,
Vindicated and enthroned,
Unto earth’s remotest end
Glorified, adored, and own’d!
D:
Y‘o dun lati ri O njoba,
Oluwa mi, Olufe;
Ki gbogbo ahon jewo Re,
Iyin, Ola, ati ogo,
Ki won jumo fi fun O;
WO Oga mi, Ore mi,
K‘o segun k‘o si gunwa
Titi de opin aye
Ninu ogo at‘ola.

C:
The Church has waited long,
Her absent Lord to see,
And still in loneliness she waits,
A friendless stranger she.
Age after age has gone,
Sun after sun has set,
And still, of her dear Lord bereft,
She weeps a mourner yet.
Come then, Lord Jesus, come.
D:
Ijo ti nduro pe
Lati ri Oluwa
O si wa bakanna sibe
Ko s’ alabaro fun!
Odun nyi lu odun
Ojo ngori ojo
Sibe lairi Oluwa re
O wa ninu ofo
Ma bo Jesu ma bo

Awon mimo l’aiye
Opo won l’ o ti ku
Bi nwon si ti nlo l’okankan
L’ a nte won gbe ‘ra won
A te won lati sun
Ki se l’ ainireti
A te won lati reju ni
K’ ile ogo to mo
Ma bo Jesu ma bo

C:
The serpent’s brood increase,
The powers of hell grow bold,
The conflict thickens, faith is low,
And love is waxing cold.
How long, O Lord our God,
Holy, and true, and good,
Wilt Thou not judge Thy suffering Church,
Her sighs, and tears, and blood?
D:
Awon ota npo si
Agbara Esu nga
Ogun ngbona igbagbo nku
Ife si di tutu
Y’o ti pe to! Baba
Oloto Olore!
‘Wo ki y’o ko ‘ya omije
At’ eje Ijo Re?
Ma bo Jesu ma bo!

C:
We long to hear Thy voice,
To see Thee face to face,
To share Thy crown and glory then,
As now we share Thy grace.
Come, Lord, and wipe away
The curse, the sin, the stain,
And make this blighted world of ours
Thine own fair world again.
Come then, Lord Jesus, come.
D:
A nfe gbo ohun Re
A nfe f’oju kan O
K’ a le gba ade at’ ogo
B’ a ti ngba ore Re
Jo wa m’ ese kuro
At’ egun at’ eri
K’o si so aiye osi yi
D’ aiye rere Tire
Ma bo Jesu, ma bo

C:
The Lord of might, from Sinai’s brow,
Gave forth His voice of thunder;
And Israel lay on earth below,
Outstretch’d in fear and wonder;
Beneath His feet was pitchy night,
And at His left hand and His right,
The rocks were rent asunder.
D:
Oluwa, agbara fo ‘hun
Bi ara l‘oke Sinai,
Awon Israeli gb‘ohun Re,
Won si gbon fun iberu;
Okunkun su biribiri,
Ati l‘otun atil‘osi
Awon apata n faya

C:
The Lord of love, on Calvary,
A meek and suffering stranger,
Upraised to Heaven His languid eye,
In nature’s hour of danger;
For us He bore the weight of woe,
For us He gave His blood to flow,
And met His Father’s anger.
D:
Oluwa ife je irora
Lori oke Kalfari,
O gbe oju soke orun,
L‘akoko wahala Re;
Fun wa lo ru eru egbe
Fun wa l‘o teje Re sile,
T‘o si tu Baba l‘oju.

C:
The Lord of love, the Lord of might,
The King of all created,
Shall back return to claim His right,
On clouds of glory seated;
With trumpet-sound and angel-song,
And Hallelujahs loud and long,
O’er death and hell defeated!
D:
Oba ife at‘agbara
Oluwa eda gbogbo
O npada bo ninu ogo
Lati wa gba ijoba;
Ipe y‘odun, angel‘ y‘o ho,
Aleluya y‘o j‘orin won,
L‘ori esu at‘iku.

Gbo ohun alore,
Ji, ara, ji;
Jesu ma fere de,
Ji, ara, ji,
Omo oru ni sun,
Omo imole l’ eyin,
Ti nyin l’ ogo didan,
Ji, ara, ji.

C:
Call to each waking band,
Watch, brethren, watch!
Clear is our Lord’s command;
Watch, brethren, watch!
Be ye as men that wait
Always at the Master’s gate,
E’en though He tarry late;
Watch, brethren, watch!
D:
So f’ egbe t’ o ti ji,
Ara, sora;
Ase Jesu daju,
Ara, sora;
E se b' Olusona
N’ ilekun Oluwa nyin
Bi O tile pe de,
Ara, sora.

Gbo ohun iriju,
Ara, sise;
Ise na kari wa,
Ara, sise;
Ogba Oluwa wa,
Kun fun 'se nigbagbogbo
Yoo si fun wa lere,
Ara sise.

C:
Hear we the Shepherd’s voice,
Pray, brethren, pray!
Would ye His heart rejoice?
Pray, brethren, pray!
Sin calls for constant fear,
Weakness needs the Strong One near
Long as ye struggle here;
Pray, brethren, pray!

Now sound the final chord,
Praise, brethren, praise!
Thrice holy is our Lord;
Praise, brethren, praise!
What more befits the tongues
Soon to lead the angels’ songs,
While Heav’n the note prolongs,
Praise, brethren, praise!
D:
Ko orin ikehin,
Yin, ara, yin;
Mimo ni Oluwa.
Yin, ara, yin:
Ki lo tun ye ahon,
T’ o fere b' Angel' korin,
T' y' o ro l’ orun titi,
Yin, ara, yin.

C:
The Lord is coming world trembles
All the hills shall shift where they stay
And all the stars of the heavens
Shall cease from bringing forth their light
D:
Oluwa mbo aiye o mi
Oke y’o sidi n’ ipo won
At’ irawo oju orun
Y’o mu imole won kuro

C:
The Lord is coming not as 'efore
When He came in humility
The Lamb of God that was slaughtered
The great sufferer who died to save
D:
