Oluwa mbo bakanna ko
Bi O ti wa n’ irele ri
Odo-aguntan ti a pa
Eni-iya ti o si ku

C:
The Lord is coming in wonder
In fire and in full armour
On the Cherubim wings He flies
To judge the dwellers of the
world
D:
Oluwa mbo li eru nla
L’ owo ina pelu ija
L’ or’ iye apa Kerubu
Mbo onidajo araiye

C:
And this once was the man who
walked
Like the people by the highways
He was persecuted often
Ah this was crucified for us
D:
Eyi ha li eniti nrin
Bi ero l’ opopo aiye?
Ti a se ‘nunibibi si?
A Eniti a pa l’ eyi!

C:
An act like this is wickedness
Fit to be buried in the sand
But the faith that succeeds at last
Rejoicing shall sing “Lord has come
D:
Ika: b’ e wo ‘nu apata
B’ e wo ‘nu iho lasan ni
Sugbon igbagbo t’ o segun
Y’o korin pe Oluwa de

C:
Rejoice, all ye believers,
And let your lights appear;
The evening is advancing
And darker night is near.
The Bridegroom is arising,
And soon will He draw nigh;
Up, pray and watch and wrestle,
At midnight comes the cry.
D:
Yo eyin onigbagbo,
Je k‘imole yin tan;
Igba ale mbo tete,
Oru si fere de,
Oko iyawo dide
“O fere sun mo le,
Dide, gbadura; Sora
L‘oru n‘igbe y‘ota.

C:
See that your lamps are burning,
Replenish them with oil;
Look now for your salvation,
The end of earthly toil.
The watchers on the mountain
Proclaim the Bridegroom near;
Go meet Him as He cometh,
With Hallelujahs clear
D:
E be fitila yin wo,
F‘ororo sinu Won;
E duro de ‘gbala yin
Ipari ‘se aye:
Awon oluso nwipe,
"Oko ‘yawo detan
E pade Re, b‘O ti mbo
Pelu orin iyin.

C:
Ye wise and holy virgins,
Raise your voices higher,
Until in songs of triumph
They meet the angel choir.
The marriage feast is waiting,
The gates wide open stand:
Up up! Ye heirs of glory;
The Bridegroom is at hand
D:
Eyin wundia mimo,
Gbe ohun yin s‘oke
Titi n‘nu orin ayo
Pelu awon Angel‘
Onje iyawo setan,
Lekun na yi sile,
Dide, arole ogo,
Oko iyawo mbo.

C:
Our hope and expectation,
O Jesus, now appear:
Arise, Thou Sun, so long'd for,
O'er this benighted sphere:
With hearts and hands uplifted
We plead, O Lord, to see
The day of our redemption
That brings us unto Thee.
D:
Jesu, ‘Wo ireti wa;
F‘ara Re han fun wa;
‘Wo orun t‘a ti nreti,
Ran s‘ori ile wa,
A gbe oWO wa s‘oke
Oluwa je k‘a ri
Ojo ‘rapada aye
T‘o mu wa d‘odo Re

C:
Come, Thou long-expected Jesus
Born to set Thy people free,
From our fears and sins release us,
Let us find our rest in Thee.
D:
Wa, IWO Jesu t‘a nreti,
T‘a bi lati da nin‘de,
Gba wa l‘owo ‘eru at‘ese,
Je k‘a ri isimi Re

C:
Israel's strength and
consolation,
Hope of all the earth Thou art
Dear Desire of every nation,
Joy of every longing heart.
D:
IWO n‘itunu Israel‘,
Ireti onigbagbo,
Ife gbogb‘orile ede
Ayo okan ti nwona.

C:
Born Thy people to deliver,
Born a child' and yet a king
Born to reign in us for ever
Now Thy gracious kingdom bring.
D:
‘Wo t‘a bi lati gba wa la.
Omo ti a bi l‘Oba,
Ti a bi lati joba lae,
Jeki ijoba Re de.

C:
By Thine own eternal Spirit
Rule in all our hearts alone;
By Thine all-sufficient merit
Raise us to Thy glorious throne.
D:
Emi Mimo Re nikan
Se akoso aya wa;
Nipa ekun itoye Re,
Gbe wa sori ite Re

C:
Draw nigh, draw nigh, Emmanuel,
And ransom captive Israel,
That mourns in lonely exile here,
Until the Son of God appear,
Rejoice, rejoice! Emmanuel
Shall come to thee, O Israel.
D:
Sum‘odo wa Imanuel‘,
Wa ra Israeli pada,
T‘o nsofo li oko eru,
Titi Jesu y‘o tun pada.
Eyo, e yo! Imanuel‘,
Y‘o wa s‘odo wa, Israel

C:
Draw nigh, O Jesse's Rod, draw
nigh
To free us from the enemy;
From hell's infernal pit to save,
And give us victory o'er the grave.
D:
Wa, opa Alade Jese,
K‘o gba wa l‘owo ota wa,
Gba wa l‘ow‘ orun apadi.
Fun wa ni ‘segun l‘ori ‘ku.

C:
Draw nigh, Thou Dayspring, who shalt cheer
And comfort by Thine Advent here,
And banish far the brooding gloom
Of sinful night and endless doom.
D:
Sunmo wa,‘WO ila orun,
Ki bibo Re se ‘tunu wa,
Tu gbogbo isudede ka
M‘ese ati egbe kuro.

C:
Draw nigh, draw nigh, O David's Key,
The heavenly gate will ope'to Thee;
Make safe the way that leads on
high,
And close the path to misery.
D:
Wa, Omo, ‘lekun Dafidi,
‘Lekun orun y‘o si fun O
Tun ona orun se fun wa;
JO se ona osi fun wa.

C:
Draw nigh, draw nigh, O Lord of might,
Who to Thy tribes from Sina's height,
In ancient time didst give the law
In cloud, and majesty, and awe.
D:
Wa Oluwa alagbara,
T‘o f‘ofin fun eniyan Re,
Nigbani, l‘or‘ oke Sinai,
Ninu olanla pel‘ eru.

C:
Great God, what do I see and hear:
The end of things created!
The Judge of Mankind doth appear,
On clouds of Glory seated,
The trumpet sounds, the graves
restore,
The dead which they contain before:
Prepare, my soul, to meet Him.
D:
O lorun! kini mo ri yi!
Opin de f‘ohun gbogbo!
Onidajo araye yo,
O gunwa n‘ite ‘dajo,
Ipe dun, iboji si tu,
Gbogbo awon oku sile,
Mura lo ko emi mi.

C:
The dead in Christ shall first arise,
At the last trumpet's sounding
Caught up to meet, Him in the skies,
With joy their Lord surrounding
No gloomy fears their souls, dismay:
His presence sheds eternal day
On those prepared to meet Him.
D:
Oku‘nu Krist‘ y‘o ko jinde
Nigba ‘pe ‘keyin ba dun,
Won o lo ko l‘awosanma,
Won o fi ayo yi ka;
Ko s‘eru ti y‘o b‘okan won;
Oju Re da impoe bo
Awon ti o mura de.

C:
But sinners, fill'd with guilty fears,
Behold His wrath prevailing,
For they shall rise and find their tears
And sighs are unavailing:
The day of grace is past and gone;
Trembling they stand before the
throne
All unprepared to meet Him.
D:
Sugbpn elese t‘on t‘eru!
Ni gbigbona ‘binu Re,
Won o dide, won o si ri
Pe, o se, won ko ba mo;
Ojo ore ofe koja;
Won ngbon niwaju ‘te ‘dajo,
Awon ti ko mura de.

C:
Great God, what do I see and hear:
The end of things created!
The Judge of mankind doth appear,
On clouds of glory seated.
Low at His cross I view the day
When heaven and earth shall pass away.
And thus prepare to meet Him.
D:
Olorun, kini mo ri yi!
Opin de f ohun gbogbo,
Onidajo araye yo,
O gunwa n‘ite ‘dajo,
L‘ese agbelebu mo nwo,
‘Gbat‘ ohun gbogbo y‘o koja,
Bayi ni mo nmura de.

C:
Lift up your heads, eternal gates;
Ye everlasting doors,
The King, the King of glory comes,
Ascending to His throne
Who is the King?
Who is the King?
It is the Lord of might,
The Victor in the fight,
Triumphant o'er the powers of night.
D:
Gbe ori yin si oke, enyin
‘lekun aiyeraye,
Gba Oba ogo, wo, O mbo,
Pel’ogun orun Re,
Ta l’ Oba ogo yi? Tani?
Oluwa t‘O ni‘pa,
T’olagbara l’or’ota Re,
Asegun, Alade.

C:
Lift up your heads, eternal gates;
Ye gates of pearl and streets
The King, the King of glory comes;
Before His chariot-wheels
Who is the King?
Who is the King?
The Lord of hosts is mi-ghty,
The God of Majesty.
D:
Gbe ori yin si oke, enyin
Ilekun : lati gba
Qba ogo: e wo, O mbo,
Pel’ogun didan Re,
Ta l’ Oba ogo yi? Tani?
Oluwa t‘O ni‘pa,
L’ogo On nikan li Oba,,
Ta f’ogo de l’ade

Oluwa y‘oti peto,
Ti ‘WO o tun pada;
Are fere mu wa tan,
Bi a ti nw‘ona Re;
Oluwa y‘oti peto
Ta o ma reti Re?
Opo ni ko gbagbo mo
Pe ‘Wo o tun pada.

C:
Lord, how long will thou tarry
Till thou shall hail on us?
Until we who expect Thee
Shall see Thee rejoicing
Awake thou sleeping virgin
Go proclaim His coming
That they who've slept already
May wake to welcome Him.
D:
Oluwa y‘o ti pe to
Ti 'Wo o kesi wa!
Ti awa ti nreti Re
Yio ri O l‘ayo
Ji, wundia ti o sun
Lo kede bibo Re
Ki gbogbo awon t‘o sun
Le mo pe O mbo wa

Dide, tan fitila re
Gbe ewu mimo wo,
Mura lati pade Re
‘Tori On fere de
Oluwa y‘o ti pe to
Ti ‘Wo o tun pada?
Ma je ki are mu wa
Tit‘ ao fi ri O.

C:
Christians, awake! salute the happy morn,
whereon the Saviour of the world was born;
rise to adore the mystery of love,
which hosts of angels chanted from above:
with them the joyful tidings first begun
of God incarnate and the Virgin's Son.

Then to the watchful shepherds it was told,
who heard the angelic herald's voice, 'Behold,
I bring good tidings of a Saviour's birth
to you and all the nations upon earth:
this day hath God fulfilled his promised word,
this day is born a Saviour, Christ the Lord.'
D:
‘Gba na l‘a ran akede angeli;
T‘a so f awon olus‘agutan pe,
“Mo mu ‘hinrere Olugbala wa
T‘a bi fun yin ati gbogbo aye,
Olorun mu l‘eri Re se loni
A bi Olugbala, Krist‘ Oluwa.

C:
He spake; and straightway the celestial choir
in hymns of joy, unknown before, conspire;
the praises of redeeming love they sang,
and heaven's whole orb with alleluias rang:
God's highest glory was their anthem still,
peace upon earth, and unto men good-will.
D:
Bi akede angel‘ na ti so tan,
Opolopo ogun orun si de;
Won nkorin ayo t‘eti ko gbo ri,
Orin Aleluya gba orun kan,
Ogo ni f‘Olorun l‘oke orun,
Alafia at‘ife s‘enia.

O ye k’awa k’o ma ro l’okan wa,
Ife nla t’Olorun ni s’araiye,
K‘a sir o t”omo na t’a bi loni,
T’ o wa jiya oro agbelebu;
Ki awa si tele liana Re,
Titi a o fi de ‘bugbe l’oke.

C:
Then may we hope, the angelic hosts among,
to sing, redeemed, a glad triumphal song:
he that was born upon this joyful day
around us all his glory shall display;
saved by his love, incessant we shall sing
eternal praise to heaven's almighty King.

Angels from the realms of glory
Wing your flight o'er all the earth;
Ye, who sang creation's story,
Now proclaim Messaih's birth,
Chorus: Come and worship, Come and worship,
Worship Christ the new-born King.
D:
Eyin Angel  l‘orun ogo,
To yi gbogbo aiye ka;
E ti korin dida aye,
E so t‘ibi Mesaiah
Chorus: E wa josin, E wa josin 
Fun Kristi Oba titun.

C:
Shepherds in the field abiding,
Watching o'er your flocks by night,
God with man is now residing,
Yonder shines the infant light;
[Chorus]
D:
Eyin Oluso-agutan
Ti nso eran yin l‘oru,
Emanueli wa ti de,
Irawo Omo na ntan.
[Chorus]

C:
Saints, before the altar bending
Watching long with hope and fear,
Suddenly the Lord, descending,
In His temple shall appear
[Chorus]
D:
Onigbagbo ti n teriba
Ni ‘beru, at‘ireti,
L‘ojiji l‘Oluwa o de
Ti yio mu yin re ‘le.
[Chorus]

C:
Hark! The herald-angels sing
Glory to the new-born King,
Peace on earth, and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled,
Joyful, all ye nations, rise,
Join the triumph of the skies,
With the angelic host proclaim,
Christ is born in Bethlehem.
D:
Gbo eda orun nko’rin:
“Ogo fun Oba t‘a bi”
“Alafia l‘aiye yi”
Olorun ba wa laja,
Gbogbo eda nde l‘ayo,
Dapo mo hiho orun:
W’ Alade Alafia!
Wo Oorun ododo de.
Chorus: Gbo Eda orun nkorin
Ogo fun Oba t‘a bi.

C:
Hail the heaven-born Prince of Peace!
Hail the Sun of Righteousness!
Light and life to all He brings,
Risen with healing in His wings,
Mild He lays His glory by,
Born that man no more may die,
Born to raise the sons of earth,
Born to give them second birth.
D:
O bo ‘go Re s’apakan
A bi k’enia ma ku!
A bi k’ o gb’enia ro
A bi k’ o le tun wa bi,
Wa, ireti enia,
Se ile Re ninu wa:
N’de, iru Omobinrin,
Bori esu ninu wa.
[Chorus]

C:
Come, Desire of nations, come,
Fix in us Thy humble home,
Rise, the woman's conquering Seed,
Bruise in us the serpent's head.
Adam's likeness now efface,
Stamp Thine image in its place,
Second Adam from above,
Re-in-state us in thy love.
D:
Pa aworan Adam run,
F‘aworan Re dipo re,
Jo, masai f’Emi Re kun,
Okan gbogb’onigbagbo,
Ogo fun Oba t’a bi,
Je ki gbogbo wa gberin,
Alafia l’aiye laja,
Olorun ba wa la ja.
[Chorus]

C:
Joy to the world! the Lord is come!
Let earth receive her King;
Let every heart prepare Him room,
And Heaven and nature sing,
And Heaven and nature sing,
And Heaven, and Heaven, and nature sing.

Joy to the world, the Saviour reigns!
Let men their songs employ;
While fields and floods, rocks,
Hills and plains
Repeat the sounding joy,
Repeat the sounding joy,
Repeat, repeat, the sounding joy.
D:
Ayo b’ aiye! Jesu joba,
E je k’a ho f’ ayo;
Gbogbo igbe, omi, oke
Nwon ngberin ayo na

C:
No more let sins and sorrows grow,
Nor thorns infest the ground;
He comes to make His blessings flow
Far as the curse is found,
Far as the curse is found,
Far as, far as, the curse is found.
D:
K’ ese on ‘yonu pin l’ aiye
K’ egun ye hu n’ ile;
O de lati mu bukun san
De ‘bi t’ egun gbe de

C:
He rules the world with truth and grace,
And makes the nations prove
The glories of His righteousness,
And wonders of His love,
And wonders of His love,
And wonders, wonders, of His love.
D:
O f’ooto at’ ife joba,
O je k' oril 'ede
Mo ododo ijoba Re,
At' ife ‘yanu Re.

C:
Joy fills our inmost heart to-day:
The royal Child is born:
And angel hosts in glad array
His Advent keep this morn.
Chorus: Rejoice, rejoice! The incarnate Word
Has come on earth to dwell;
No sweeter sound than this is
heard-Emmanuel.
D:
Ayo kun okan wa l‘oni,
Abi omo Oba!
Opo awon ogun orun
Nso ibi re loni!
Chorus: E yo, Olorun d‘eniyan!
O wa joko l‘aye!
Oruko wo l‘o dun to yi
Emmanuel.

C:
Low at the cradle throne we bend,
We wonder and adore;
And feel no bless can ours transcend,
No joy was sweet before.
[Chorus]
D:
A wole n‘ibuje eran,
N‘iyanul‘a josin,
Ibukun kan ko ta yi yo,
Ko s‘ayo bi eyi.
[Chorus]

C:
For us the world must lose its charms
Before the manger shrine,
When, folded in Thy mother's arms
We see Thee, Babe divine.
[Chorus]
D:
Aye ko n‘adun fun wa mo
‘Gbati a ba nwo O
L‘OWO wundia iya Re,
‘W o Omo iyanu.
[Chorus]

C:
Thou light of uncreated Light,
Shine on us, Holy Child:
That we may keep Thy birthday bright,
With service undefiled.
[Chorus]
D:
Imole lat‘inu ‘Mole,
Tan ‘mole s‘okun wa!
K‘a le ma fi isin mimo
Se ‘ranti ojo Re.
[Chorus]

Onigbagbo e bu s’ayo!
Ojo nla l’ eyi fun wa
K’ orun f’ ayo korin kikan,
K’ igbo at’ odan gberin
E ho! E yo! E yo! E yo!
Okun at’ odo gbogbo.

C:
Rejoice together, all creatures,
In this world and in heaven;
Let all living things around us
Below, on high praise Jesus,
Give Him Glory, give Him glory,
Mighty King is born today.
D:
E jumo yo, gbogbo eda,
L’alye yi ati l’orun,
Ki gbogbo ohun alaye
N’ile, l’oke, yin Jesu
E f’ ogo fun E f’ ogo fun
Oba nla t’ a bi lon!.

C:
Praise Him, praise Him, praise Him, praise Him
Shout ye! shout ye! and rejoice!
The stronghold of Satan destroyed,
"Seed of the woman" has come!
Hallelujah! Hallelujah:
The Mighty Redeemer, King.
D:
E damuso! E damuso!
E ho ye! Ke si ma yo,
Itegun Esu fo wayi,
"Iru-omobinrin" de.
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Olurapada, Oba.

C:
Raise your voices high, Seraphim,
Cherubim, by the throne near
Angels and ye the holy ones,
With all the hosts of heaven,
Rejoice with us! Rejoice with us!
Year of Redemption has come.
D:
E gb’ ohun nyin ga, Serafu,
Kerubu, l’eba ite;
Angeli at’ eniyan mimo,
Pelu gbogb’ ogun orun.
E ba wa yo! E ba wa yo!
Odun idasile de.

C:
Holy Trinity, Holy One,
Father, the Almighty God!
Holy Spirit, the counsellor,
Jesus Christ, the Redeemer!
Accept our praises, our praises,
Thou art worthy for glory.
D:
Metalokan, Eni Mimo
Baba Olodumare
Emi Mimo, Olutunnu,
Jesu, Olurapada,
Gba iyin wa Gba iyin wa
'Wo nikan l’ ogo ye fun.

C:
Oh come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant!
Oh come ye, Oh come ye to Bethlehem! 
Born upon earth, behold the King of angels;
Oh come, let us adore Him.                                                 
Oh come, let us adore Him,                                              
Oh, come let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.
D:
Wa eyin olooto
L’ ayo ati'segun
Wa k’a lo, wa kalo si Betlehem
Wa k’a lo wo o!
Oba awon Angeli!
E wa k’a lo juba Re
E wa k’a lo juba Re
E wa k’a lo juba Kristi Oluwa

C:
God of God, and Light of Light begotten 
Lo, He abhors not the virgin’s womb.                            
Very God, begotten, not created;                                    
Oh come, let us adore Him. etc.

Sing, choirs of angels, sing in exultation,
Sing, all ye citizens of heaven above: 
“Glory to God, all glory in the highest!”                            
Oh come, let us adore Him. etc.
D:
Angeli, e ko’rin,
Korin itoye Re,
Ki gbogbo eda orun si gberin:
Ogo f' Olorun
L’ oke orun l’ohun,

Nitoto, a wole
F' Oba ta bi loni;
Jesu, Iwo li awa nfi ogo fun,
'Wo Omo Baba,
T'O gbe ara wa wo!

C:
Once in royal Davids city,
Stood a lowly cattle shed,
Where a mother laid her Baby,
In a manger for His bed:
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ, her little Child.
D:
Nigba kan ni Betlehemu
Ile kekere kan wa
Nib' iya kan te ‘mo re si
Lori ibuje eran:
Maria n' iya omo na,
Jesu Kristi l' Omo na.

C:
He came down to earth from heaven,
Who is God and Lord of all,
And His shelter was a stable,
And His cradle was a stall:
With the poor, and mean, and lowly,
Lived on earth our Saviour holy.
D:
O t'orun wa s' ode aiye
On l' Olorun Oluwa;
O f’ ile eran se ile,
'Buje eran fun 'busun.
Lodo awon otosi
Ni Jesu gbe li aiye.

Ni gbogbo igba ewe Re
O ngboran O si mb'ola
O nferan O si nteriba
Fun iya ti ntoju Re:
O ye ki gbogbo' omode
K' o se olugboran be.

C:
And our eyes at last shall see Him,
Through His own redeeming love;
For that Child so dear and gentle,
Is our Lord in heaven above:
And He leads His children on,
To the place where He is gone.
D:
Tori on je awose wa
A ma dagba bi awa
O kere, ko le da nkan se,
A ma sokun bi awa;
O si le ba wa daro,
O le ba wa yo pelu.

C:
Silent night, holy night,
all is calm, all is bright
round you virgin
mother and child.
Holy infant, so tender and mild,
sleep in heavenly peace,
sleep in heavenly peace.
D:
Ni ‘dakeje, oru mimo,
Okun su, ‘mole de,
Awon olus’ agutan nsona,
Omo t’ o wa l’oju orun
Simi n’nu Alafia
Simi n’nu Alafia.

C:
Silent night, holy night,
shepherds quake at the sight;
glories stream from heaven afar,
heavenly hosts sing Alleluia!
Christ the Savior is born,
Christ the Savior is born!
D:
Ni ‘dakeje, oru mimo,
‘Mole de okun sa,
Olus’ agutan gb’ orin Angel,
Kabiyesi alleluia Oba
Jesu Olugbala de
Jesu Olugbala de.

C:
Silent night, holy night,
Son of God, love's pure light;
radiant beams from thy holy face
with the dawn of redeeming grace,
Jesus, Lord, at thy birth,
Jesus, Lord, at thy birth.
D:
Ni ‘dakeje, oru mimo,
‘Rawo oeun tan ‘mole
Wo awon Amoye ila orun,
Mu ore won won wa fun Oba wa,
Jesu Olugbala de
Jesu Olugbala de.

Ni ‘dakeje, oru mimo,
‘Rawo orun tan ‘mole,
K’a pelu awon Angeli korin,
Kabiyesi alleluia Oba
Jesu Olugbala de
Jesu Olugbala de.

C:
Jesus, my Savior, to Bethlehem came,
Laid in a manger to sorrow and shame;
O it was wonderful, blest be His name,
Seeking for me, for me:
Seeking for me, for me,
Seeking for me, for me;
O it was wonderful, blest be His name,
Seeking for me, for me.
D:
Jesu Oluwa mi ni Betlehem’
N’ ibuje eran li a gbe bi si
A! iyanu ni, yin Oruko Re
Eniti’ O wa mi ri.
O wa mi ri, an’emi,
(O wa mi ri, O wa mi ri)
O wa mi ri, an’ emi
A! iyanu ni, yin Oruko Re
Enit’ O wa mi ri.

C:
Jesus, my Savior, on Calvary’s tree
Paid the great debt, and my soul He set free;
O it was wonderful—how could it be?
Dying for me, for me!
Dying for me, for me,
Dying for me, for me;
O it was wonderful—how could it be?
Dying for me, for me!
D:
Jesu Oluwa mi ni kalfari
San ‘gbese ese mo d’ ominira
A! iyanu nip e O ku fun mi
Elese bi emi.
O ku fun mi, fun mi
(O ku fun mi, O ku fun mi)
O ku fun mi, fun mi
A! iyanu nip e O ku fun mi
Elese bi emi.

C:
Jesus, my Savior, the same as of old,
While I was wand’ring in darkness and cold,
Gently and long did He plead with my soul,
Calling for me, for me!
Calling for me, for me,
Calling for me, for me;
Gently and long did He plead with my soul,
Calling for me, for me!
D:
Jesu Oluwa mi bakanna ni,
Enit’ O wa mi gba mo nsako lo:
Jeje l’ O ba mi s’oro t’o pe mi
O pe mi s’odo Re
O nkepe mi, an’ emi,
(O nkepe mi, wa s’ odo mi)
O nkepe mi, an’ emi,
Jeje l’O mba mi s’ oro t’ O pe mi
O pe mi s’ odo Re.

C:
Jesus, my Savior, shall come from on high.
Sweet is the promise as weary years fly:
O I shall see Him descend from the sky,
Coming for me, for me!
Coming for me, for me,
Coming for me, for me;
O I shall see Him descend from the sky,
Coming for me, for me!
D:
Jesu Oluwa mi tun npada bo,
Ileri didun l’ eyi je fun mi;
Oju mi y’ o ri b’ O ti nsokale,
Bo lati wa mu mi.
O npada bo fun mi,
(O npada bo y’o wa mu mi)
O npada bo fun mi,
O ju mi y’o ri b’o to nsokale,
O npada bo fun mi.  Amin

C:
A few more years shall roll,
A few more seasons come,
And we shall be with those that rest
Asleep with- in the tomb.
Chorus: Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that great day;
O wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away.
D:
Leyin odun die,
Leyin lgba die,
A o ko wa jo pel‘awon
Ti o sun n‘iboji
Chorus: Oluwa, mu mi ye
Fun ojo nlanla na;
Jo, we mi ninu eje Re
Siko ese milo.

C:
A few more suns shall set
O'er these dark hills of time,
And we shall be where suns are not
A far serener clime.
[Chorus]
D:
Leyin ojo die
L‘aye okunkun yi,
A o de‘bi orun ko si mo,
Ile dara dara.
[Chorus]

C:
A few more storms shall beat
On this wild rocky shore,
And we shall be where tempests
cease
And surges swell no more.
[Chorus]
D:
Leyin iji die,
L‘ebute giga yi,
A o de b‘iji ko si mo,
T’ okun ki bu s’oke
[Chorus]

C:
A few more struggles here,
A few more partings o'er
A few more toils, a few more tears,
And we shall weep no more.
[Chorus]
D:
Leyin ‘yonu die,
Leyin ‘pinya die,
Leyin ekun ati aro,
A ki o sokun mo.
[Chorus]

C:
‘Tis but a little while
And He shall come again
mf Who died that we might live, who lives
That we with Him may reign.
[Chorus]
D:
Ojo ‘simi die,
L‘a ni tun ri l‘aye,
A o de ibi isimi
Ti ki o pin lailai
[Chorus

C:
My times are in Thy hand, Oh Lord
My God, I wish them there;
My life, my friends, my soul I leave
Entirely to Thy care.
D:
Igba mi mbe li owo Re.
A fe k’ o wa nibe;
A f’ ara wa at’ ore wa
Si abe iso Re.

C:
My times are in Thy hand, Oh Lord
Why should I doubt or fear?
My Father’s hand will never cause
His child a needless tear.
D:
Igba mi mbe li owo Re,
Awa o se beru?
Baba ki y’o je k’ omo Re,
Sokun li ainidi.

C:
My times are in Thy hand, Oh Lord
Whatever they may be;
Pleasing or painful, dark or bright,
As best may seem to Thee.
D:
Igba mi mbe li owo Re,
‘Wo l’ a o gbekele;
Tit’ a o f’ aiye osi ‘le
T’ a o r’ ogo Re.

C:
My times are in Thy hand, Oh Lord
Jesus, the crucified!
Those hands my cruel sins had pierced
Are now my guard and guide.

My times are in Thy hand, Oh Lord
I’ll always trust in Thee;
And, after death, at Thy right hand
I shall forever be.
D:
Igba mi mbe li owo Re;
Ngo ma simi le O,
Lehin iku, low’ otun Re
L’em’ o wa titi lai. Amin

C:
O GOD, the Rock of Ages,
Who evermore hast been,
What time the tempest rages,
Our dwelling place serene
Before Thy first creations,
O Lord, the same as now,
To endless generations
The everlasting Thou!
D:
Apata ayeraye,
Enit‘o mbe laelae
Nigbakugba t‘iji nja,
‘Wo ‘bugbe alafia:
Saju did‘aye wayi Iwo, mbe;
bakanna Ti t‘aye ainipekun
Ayeraye ni ‘Wo.

C:
Our years are like the shadows
On sunny hills that lie,
Or grasses in the meadows
That blossom but to die
A sleep, a dream, a story
By strangers quickly told,
An unremaining glory
Of things that soon are old.
D:
Oj‘ odun wa ri b‘oji
T‘o han l‘ori oke;
Bi koriko ipa‘do,
T‘o ru ti o si ku:
Bi ala tabi b‘itan
T‘ enikan nyara pa:
Ogo ti ko ni si mo,
Ohun t‘o gbo tan ni.

C:
O Thou, who canst not slumber,
Whose light grows never pale,
Teach us aright to number
Our years before they fail,
On us Thy mercy lighten
On us Thy goodness rest,
And let Thy Spirit brighten
The hearts Thyself hast blessed.
D:
Wo eniti ki togbe,
'Mole enit‘itan
Ko wa bi a o ti ka
Ojo wa k‘o to tan;
Je k‘anu Re ba le wa
K‘ ore Re po fun wa;
Si je k‘Emi Mimo Re
Mole si okan wa.

C:
Lord, crown our faith's endeavour
With beauty and with grace,
Till, clothed in light for ever,
We see Thee face to face,
A joy to language measures,
A fountain brimming o'er,
And endless flow of pleasures,
An ocean without shore.
D:
Jesu, f‘ewa at'ore
De ‘gbagbo wa l‘ade
Tit‘ a o fi ri O gbangba
Ninu ‘mole laelae
Ayo t‘enu ko le so,
Orisun akunya;
Alafia ailopin,
Okun ailebute

C:
O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Our shelter from the stormy blast,
And our eternal home.
D:
O lorun t‘odun t‘o koja
Iret‘ eyi ti mbo;
Ib‘isadi wa ni iji
A t‘ile wa laelae.

C:
Under the shadow of Thy throne,
Still may we dwell secure;
Sufficient is Thine arm alone,
And our defence is sure
D:
L‘abe ojiji ite Re
L‘awon eniyan Re ngbe,
Tito l‘apa Re nikanso,
Abo wa si daju.

C:
Before the hills in order stood,
Or earth received her frame,
f From everlasting Thou art God,
To endless years the same
D:
K‘awon oke k‘o to duro,
Tabi k‘a to d‘aye,
Laelae IWO ni Olorun
Bakanna, l‘ailopin!

C:
A thousand ages in Thy sight
Are like an evening gone,
Short as the watch that ends the night
Before the rising sun.
D:
Egberun odun l‘oju Re
Bi ale kan l‘o ri;
B‘iso kan l‘afemojumo
Ki orun k‘o to la.

C:
Time, like an ever-rolling stream,
Bears all its sons away:
They fly forgotten, as a dream
Dies at the opening day.
D:
Ojo wa bi odo sisan,
Opo l‘o si ngbe lo;
Won nlo, won di eni ‘gbagbe
Bi ala ti a nro ‘

C:
O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Be Thou our guard while life shall last,
And our perpetual home.
D:
Olorun t‘odun t‘o koja,
Iret‘ eyi ti mbo,
Ma s‘abo wa ‘gba ‘yonu de
At‘ ile wa laelae.

C:
DAYS and moments quickly flying
Speed us onward to the dead
Oh, how soon shall we be lying
Each within his narrow bed!
D:
Ojo ati akoko nlo;
Won nsun wa s‘eti ‘boji
Awa fere dubule na,
Ninu iho ‘busun wa.

C:
Jesus, merciful Redeemer
Rouse dead souls to hear Thy voice:
Wake, oh wake each idle dreamer
Now to make the eternal choice.
D:
Jesu ‘Wo Olurapada
Ji okan t‘o ku s‘ese:
Ji gbogbo okan ti ntogbe
Lati yan ipo iye.

C:
Mark we whither we are wending;
Ponder how we soon must go
To inherit bliss unending
Or eternity of woe.
D:
Bi akoko ti nsunmole,
Je k‘a ro ‘biti a nlo
Bi lati r‘ayo ailopin,
Tabi egbe ailopin.

C:
As a shadow life is fleeting
As a vapour so it flies
For the bygone years retreating
Pardon grant, and make us wise.
D:
Aye wan koja b‘ojiji
O si nfo lo bi ‘kuku,
Fun gbogbo odun t‘o koja
Dariji wa, mu wa gbon.

C:
Wise that we our days may number
Strive and wrestle with our sin
Stay not in our work, nor slumber
Till Thy holy rest we win
D:
Ko wa lati ka ojo wa,
Lati ba ese wa ja,
K‘a ma s‘are k‘a ma togbe
Tit‘ao fi ri ‘simi.

C:
Soon before the judge all glorious
We with all the dead shall stand
Saviour, over death victorious
Place us then on Thy right hand.
D:
Gbogbo wa fere duro na
Niwaju ite ‘dajo
Jesu ‘w o t‘o segun iku
Fi wa s‘apa Otun Re.

C:
As the sun is moving on,
Unceasingly through past year,
So some have come to their end,
And we shall see them no more
D:
B’ oorun l’ aiduro ti nrin,
La odun ti o lo ja
Be l’ opo ti d’ opin won
A ki o si ri won mo.

C:
They are confined for ever,
Their’s have ended in the world;
We’re waiting a little while,
We know not how long it lasts.
D:
A so won lojo lailai
Tiwon pari li aiye;
Awa duro die na.
Yo tip e to, a ko mo.

C:
Receive thanks for past mercies
Forgive us our trespasses;
Teach us as we are, that we
Rememb’ring the world to come
D:
Gb’ ope f’ anu t’ o koja,
Tun dar’ ese ji wa;
Ko wa b’a ti wa, ki a ma
Se ‘ranti aiye ti mbo.

C:
Bless all both the young and old,
Fill us with thy love, O lord;
When our lives shall come to past
Grant us place above with you.  Amen
D:
Bukun f’ewe at’ agba,
F’ ife Oluwa kun wa:
‘Gba ojo aiye wa pin,
K’ a gne odo re l’ oke.  Amin

C:
O God of Bethel, by whose hand
Thy people still are fed;
Who through this weary pilgrimage
Hast all our fathers led.
D:
Olorun Betel eniti
O mbo awon Tire,
Enit‘ o mu baba wa la
Ojo aiye won ja

C:
Our vows, our prayers, we now present
Before Thy throne of grace;
God of our fathers, be the God
Of their succeeding race.
D:
A mu eje at‘ebe wa
Wa iwaju ‘te Re,
Olorun awon baba wa
Ma je Olorun wa

Ninu idamu aye yi
Ma to isise wa,
Fun wa ni onje ojo wa
At‘aso t‘o ye wa.

C:
O spread Thy covering wings around,
Till all our wanderings cease,
And at our Father's lov'd abode
Our souls arrive in peace.
D:
Na ojiji‘ ye Re bo wa
Tit‘ajo wa opin
Ati ni ‘bugbe Baba wa,
Okan wa o simi.

C:
Such blessings from Thy gracious hand
Our humble pray'rs implore;
And Thou shalt be our chosen God,
And portion evermore.
D:
Iru ibukun bi eyi
L‘a mbere L‘OWO Re,
Iwo o je Olorun wa.
At‘ipin wa lailai

C:
The heavenly controller
The merciful and the wise;
My whole life rest in Thy hand,
end of all lies with thee.
D:
Alakoso ti orun,
Alanu at‘Ologbon;
Igba mi mbe l‘ OWO Re,
Opin gbogbo l‘ase Re.

C:
Thy power created the world
So thou created myself;,
Parents, land, time we have around
All do come from thee.
D:
Ase Re l‘oda aye
Ati ibi mi pelu,
Obi, ile, on igba
Nipa Re ni gbogbo won.

C:
Times of success and of sound health,
Times of poverty and wealth,
Times of temptations and wrath,
Times of victory and of help
D:
Igb‘ aisan on ilera,
Igba ise on oro,
Igba ‘danwo, ibinu,
Igba ‘segun, iranwo.

C:
Times exposing Satan
Times to taste of Jesus love
They do come but still roll by,
As our Heavenly Friend wills
D:
Igba iridi Esu,
Igba ‘to ‘fe Jesu wo,
Won o wa, won o si lo,
B‘ore wa orun ti fe.

C:
Thou The-mercy-giving Lord,
To Thee I commend my soul ,
I confess Thy sweet great love,
I bow down in great worship.
D:
Iwo Olore-ofe,
‘WO ni mo f‘emi mi fun,
Emi jewo ife Re,
Emi teriba fun O

C:
I am so glad that our Father in heav'n
Tells of His love in the Book He has giv'n
Wonderful things in the Bible I see;
This is the dearest, that Jesus loves me.
I am so glad that Jesus loves me,
Jesus loves me, Jesus loves me,
I am so glad that Jesus loves me,
Jesus loves even me.
D:
Mo yo pupo pe Baba wa orun
So t'ife Re ninu 'we t'O fun mi
Mo r'ohun 'yanu ninu Bibeli
Eyi s'owon ju pe Jesu fe mi.
Chorus: Mo yo pupo pe Jesu fe mi
Mo yo pupo pe Jesu fe mi,
Jesu fe mi, Jesu fe mi
Mo yo pupo pe Jesu fe mi
Jesu fe an mi

C:
Tho' I forget Him, and wander away,
Still He doth love me wherever I stray;
Back to His dear loving arms do I flee,
When I remember that Jesus loves me.
Chorus: I am so glad that Jesus loves me.
D:
Gba mo  gbagbe Re, ti e mi sa lo
O fe mi sibe, O wa mi kiri;
Mmo yara pada s’apa anu Re
‘Gbati mo ranti pe Jesu femi
[Chorus]

C:
Oh, if there's only one song I can sing,
When in His beauty I see the great King,
This shall my song in eternity be,
"Oh, what a wonder that Jesus loves me!"Chorus: I am so glad that Jesus loves me.
D:
Bi o se orin kan l’emi le ko
‘Gba mo r’ Oba nla ninu ewa Re
Eyi ni yo ma j’orin mi titi
A! iyanu ni pe jesu fe mi
[Chorus]

Jesu fe mi, mo si mo pe mo f’E
Ife l’ o mu wa r’okan mi pada
Ife l’ o m’U k’O ku l’ori igi
O da mi loju pe jesu fe mi
[Chorus]

C:
If one should ask of me, how can I tell?
Glory to Jesus, I know very well!
God's Holy Spirit with mine doth agree,
Constantly witnessing Jesus loves me.
Chorus: I am so glad that Jesus loves me.
D:
Emi  o ti se dahun b’a bi mi
Ohun ti ogo Oluwa mi je?
Emi Mimo n jeri nin’okan mi
Ni igba gbogbo pe Jesu fe mi

C:
In this assurance I find sweetest rest,
Trusting in Jesus, I know I am blest;
Satan, dismayed from my soul now doth flee,
When I just tell him Jesus loves me.
Chorus: I am so glad that Jesus loves me.
D:
Ni’ gbekele yi ni mo r’isimi
NI’ gbekele Krist, mo d’alabukun
Satan damu sa kuro l’okan mi
Nigba mo so fun pe jesu fe mi.

Jesu, iwo l’a gb’ ohun si,
Mi Emi Mimo Re
Si awon enia wonyi;
Baptis’ won s’ iku Re

C:
Oh let Thine unction on them rest,
Thy grace their souls renew;
And write within their tender breast
Thy name and nature too.
D:
K’O fi agbara Re fun won,
Fun won l’ okan titun!
Ko ‘ruko Re si aiya won,
Fi emi Re kun won.

C:
Thy faithful servants let them prove
Girded with truth divine;
Be sharers in Thy dying love,
And followers of Thine.
D:
Ke kin won ja bi ajagun
L’abe opagun Re,
Mu won f’ otito d’ amure,
Ki nwon rin l’ona Re

C:
Lord, plant us all into Thy death,
That we Thy life may prove;
Partakers of Thy cross beneath,
And of Thy crown above.
D:
Oluwa, gbin wa s’ iku Re
K’ a jogun iye Re
L’aiye k’ a ru agbelebu,
K’ a ni ade Orun.   Amin

C:
Stand, soldier of the cross,
Thy high allegiance claim,
And vow to hold the world but loss
For thy Redeemer's Name.
D:
Duro, omo ogun,
F’ enu re so f’ aiye
Si jeje pe of o l’ aiye;
Nitori Jesu re.

C:
Arise, and be baptized,
And wash thy sins away;
Thy league with God be solemnized,
Thy faith avouched today.
D:
Dide ka baptis’ re,
K’ o we ese re nu,
Wa b’ Olorun da majemu,
So ‘gbagbo re l’oni.

C:
No more thine own, but Christ's
With all the saints of old,
Apostles, seers, evangelists,
And martyr throngs enrolled.
D:
‘Wo k’ ise t’ ara re,
Bikose ti Kristi;
A ko oruko re po mo
Awon mimo ‘gbani.

C:
In God's whole armour strong,
Front hell's embattled powers:
The warfare may be sharp and long,
The victory must be ours.
D:
Ni ‘hamora Jesu,
Koju ‘ja si esu;
B’ o ti wu k’ ogun na le to,
Iwo ni o segun.

C:
Oh, bright the conqueror's crown,
The song of triumph sweet,
When faith casts every trophy down
At our great Captain's feet.
D:
Ade didara ni,
Orin na, didun ni,
‘Gbat a ba ko ikogun jo
S’ ese Olugbala. Amin

C:
SINNERS, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Maker, asks you why:
God, who did your being give
Made you with Himself to live,
He the fatal cause demands,
Asks the work of His own hands;
Why, ye thankless creatures, why
Will you cross His love, and die?
D:
Elese, e yipada,
Ese ti e o fi ku?
Eleda yin ni mbere
Tofeki e ba On gbe;
Oran nla ni O mbi yin,
Ise owo Re ni yin;
A! eyin alailope
Ese t‘ e o ko ‘fe Re?

C:
Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Saviour, asks you why
God, who did your souls retrieve,
Died Himself, that you might live;
Will you let Him die in vain?
Crucify your Lord again?
Why ye ransom'd sinners, why
Will you slight His grace, and die?
D:
Elese e yi pada,
Ese ti o o fi ku?
Olugbala ni mbere;
Eni t‘O gb‘emi yin la;
Iku Re y‘o j‘asan bi?
E o tun kan mo ‘gi bi?
Eni ‘rapada ese
Te o gan or‘ofe Re?

C:
Sinners, turn; why will ye die?
God, the Spirit, asks you why
He who all your lives hath strove,
Wooed you to embrace His love
Will you not His grace receive?
Will you still refuse to live?
Why, ye long-sought sinners, why
Will you grieve your God, and die?
D:
Elese, e yi pada,
Ese ti e o fi ku?
Emi mimo ni mbere
Ti nfojo gbogbo ro yin;
E ki o ha gb‘ore Re?
E o ko iye sibe?
Ati nwa yin pe, ese
T‘ e mbi Olorun ninu?

C:
Can you doubt if God is love,
If to all His yearnings move?
Will you not His word receive
Will you not His oath believe?
See, your dying Lord appears!
pp Jesus weeps believe His tears!
Mingled with His blood they cry
"Why will you resolve to die?"
D:

mf Both words are blending now,

llekun ife, iwo ko pe ju,

jowo ‘ra re;

Come unto Me, ye weary,

Fun wa n’ ipo lodo Re.

C:
On Thy love we rest alone,
And that love will then be known
By the pardon'd round Thy throne.
D:
Ife Re l’a simi le.
N’ ile wa l’oke l’ao mo.
B’ ife na tit obi to.

C:
APPROACH, my soul, the mercy-seat
Where Jesus answers prayer;
There humbly fall before His feet,
For none can perish there.
D:
Okan mi sunmo ‘te anu,
Nibi Jesu ngb’ ebe,
F’ irele wole l’ ese Re,
‘Wo ko le gbe, nibe.

C:
Thy promise is my only plea,
With this I venture nigh;
Thou callest burdened souls to Thee,
And such, O Lord, am I.
D:
ileri Re, ni ebe mi,
Eyi ni mo mu wa;
Iwo npe okan t’ eru npa,
Bi emi, Oluwa.

C:
Bowed down beneath a load of sin,
By Satan sorely pressed,
By wars without and fears within,
I come to Thee for rest.
D:
Eru ese wo mi l’ orun,
Esu nse mi n’ ise;
Ogun l’ ode, eru ninu,
Mo wa isimi mi.

C:
Be Thou my Shield and Hiding-place,
That, sheltered near Thy side,
I may my fierce Accuser face
And tell him Thou hast died.
D:
Se Apata at’ Asa mi,
Ki nfi O se abo;
Ki ndoju ti olufisun,
Ki nso pe Krist ku.

C:
O wondrous Love, to bleed and die,
To bear the cross and shame,
That guilty sinners such as I
Might plead Thy gracious name!
D:
Ife iyanu! Iwo ku,
Iwo ru itiju;
Ki elese b’ iru emi,
Le be l’ oruko Re

C:
Goodness I have none to plead,
Sinfulness in all I see,
I can only bring my need;
God be merciful to me.
D:
Ire kan emi ko ni,
ese sa l’o yi mi ka,
Eyi nikan l’ebe mi,
“Olorun, saanu fun mi”.

C:
Broken heart and downcast eyes
Dare not lift themselves to Thee;
Yet Thou canst interpret sighs:
God be merciful to me.

From this sinful heart of mine
To Thy bosom I would flee;
I am not my own but Thine:
God be merciful to me.
D:
okan ese mi yi n fe,
Sa wa sinmi laya Re;
Lat’ oni, mo di Tire,
“Olorun, saanu fun mi”.

C:
There is One beside the throne,
And my only hope and plea
Are in Him, and Him alone:
God be merciful to me.
D:
Enikan mbe l’or’ ite,
Ninu Re nikansoso,
N’ ireti at’ebe mi;
“Olorun, saanu fun mi”.

C:
He my cause will undertake,
My Interpreter will be;
He's my all; and for His sake
God be merciful to me.

Jesus My Only Strength
Thou Art All I Care For;
With All Faith I Lift Up My Eyes,
Thou Wilt Accept My Prayer,
Let Me Stay Here For Thee
That I May Do Thy Will;
And Think O My Almighty God,
Renew Me With All Strength.
D:
Jesu, agbara mi,
Iwo l’ aniyan mi;
Emi fi igbagbo w’ oke,
Iwo l’ O ngb’ adura.
Je ki nduro de O,
Ki nle se ife Re.
Ki iwo Olodumare,
K’ O sio mi di otun.

C:
Give Me A Humble Heart
That Sacrifices Itself;
That Threats Upon That Ridicules
Satan’s Machinations.
A Heart That Values Much
The Pangs Of Pain And Toil,
That With Patience And All
Boldness
Bear Its Own Cross Alone.

Give Me The Heavenly Care,
A Bold And A Sharp Face,
That Looks To Thee When Sins
Draw Near:
That Drives Away Satan;
O Give Me The Spirit
Which Thou Hast Provided,
Spirit That Stays Steadfast For Aye,
That Watches While Praying.
D:
Fun mi l’ eru orun,
Oju t, o mu hanhan,
T’ y’o wo O n’ gb’ ese sunmole,
K’ o ri b’ esu ti nsa.
Fun mi ni Emi ni,
T’ O pese tele;
Emi t o nduro gangan lai,
T’ o nf’ adura sona.

C:
I Trust Only Thy Word,
Thou Gave Me This Promise
That All My Help And Salvation
Shall Come Only From Thee:
Just Let Me Stand Steadfast,
That My Hope Ht Not Shake
Until Thou Shall Bring My Spirit
To Thy Everlasting Rest.
D:
Mo gbekele l’ oro Re.
‘Wo l’ o leri fun mi;
Iranwo at’ igbala mi;
Y’ o t’ odo Re wa se
Sa je kin le duro,
K’ ireti mi ma ye,
Titi ‘Wo o fi m’ okan mi
Wo ‘nu isimi Re.

C:
O Thou, from whom all goodness flows,
I lift my heart to Thee;
In all my sorrows, conflicts, woes,
Dear Lord, remember me
D:
Iwo low’ Enit ire nsan,
Mo gb’ okan mi si O;
N’ ibanuje, at’ ise mi,
Oluwa, ranti mi.

C:
When on my aching burden'd heart
My sins lie heavily,
Thy pardon grant, Thy peace impart:
In love remember me
D:
‘Gba mo nkerora l’okan mi
T’ ese wo mi l’orun:
Dari gbogbo ese ji mi,
Ni ife ranti mi.

C:
When trials sore obstruct my way
And ills I cannot flee,
Oh let my strength be as my day:
For good remember me
D:
Gba ‘danwo kikan yi mi ka,
Ti ibi le mi ba;
Oluwa, fun mi l’ agbara,
Fun rere, ranti mi.

C:
If on my face for Thy dear name
Shame and reproaches be;
All hail reproach, and welcome shame
If Thou remember me
D:
. Bi ‘tiju at’ egan ba de
“ Tori Oruko Re;
Ngo yo s’egan, ngo gba ‘tiju,
B’ Iwo ba ranti mi.

C:
And oh, when in the hour of death
I own Thy just decree,
Be this the prayer of my last breath,
Dear Lord, remember me
D:
Oluwa, ‘gba iku ba de,
Em’ o sa ku dandan;
K’ eyi j’ adura ‘gbehin mi,
Oluwa, ranti mi.

C:
Far from my heavenly home,
Far from my Father’s breast,
Fainting I cry, blest Spirit, come
And speed me to my rest.
D:
Jina s’ ile orun,
S’ ookan aiya Baba,
Emi ‘bukun, wa, mo ndaku,
M mi  re ‘bi ‘simi.

C:
Upon the willows long,
My harp has silent hung;
How should I sing a cheerful song
Till thou inspire my tongue?
D:
Mo fi duro mi ko
s’ ori igi willlo;
Ngo se korin ayo, ‘gbati
‘Wo koi t’ ahon mi se?

C:
My spirit homeward turns,
And fain would thither flee;
My heart, O Zion, droops and yearns,
When I remember thee.
D:
Emi mi lo s’ ile,
A! mba le fo de ‘be:
Ayun re nyun mi, ‘wo Sion
Gba mob a ranti re.

C:
To thee, to thee I press,
A dark and toilsome road.
When shall I pass the wilderness,
And reach the saint’s abode?
D:
S’odo re mo nt’ ona,
To ku fun isoro;
‘Gbawo ni ngo koj’ aginju,
De ‘le awon mimo?

C:
God of my life, be near!
On thee my hopes I cast:
O guide me through the desert here,
And bring me home at last!
D:
Sunmo mi, Olorun,
‘Wo ni mo gbekele;
Sin mi la aginju aiye
Ki nde ‘le nikehin.

C:
Unworthy I Am Lord.
My Lord, My God, Saviour,
May I Draw Nearer To Thee Lord?
With All My Sinful Load.
D:
Alaimo ni emi,
Olorun Oluwa!
Emi ha gbodo sunmo O,
T’ emi t’ eru ese?

C:
My Sins Do Press On Me
With My Uncleansed Heart,
How Sorrowful This May Be
Lord?
In This Thy Holy Sight.
D:
Eru ese yi npa
Okan buburu mi;
Yio ha si ti buru to,
L’ oju Re mimo ni!

C:
Do I Move To The Grave,
In This My Hopeless State?
I Have Joy In Thy Painful Death
For Me The Miserable.
D:
Emi o ha si ku,
Ni alainireti?
Mo r’ ayo ninu iku Re,
Fun otosi b’ emi.

C:
The Blood Which Thou Has shed
Which Is Free Given Grace
Can Clean Me A Sinner So Bad;
Can Soften Hardened Heart..
D:
Eje ni ti O ta,
T’ ise or’ ofe Re;
Le w’ elese t’ o buruju,
Le m’ okan lile ro.

C:
I Worship At Thy Feet,
Forgive To Me My Sins,
Here I’ll Not Arise On My Knees
Till Thou Shalt Say Arise’.
D:
Mo wole l’ese Re,
Jo k’ O dariji mi;
Nihin l’ emi o wa titi
‘Wo o wipe, “dide”.

C:
Lord Jesus, think on me
And purge away my sin:
From earth born passions set me free
And make me pure within
D:
Jesu, jo ranti mi,
K’ O si we ‘se mi nu;
Gba mi low’ ese ‘binibi,
Si we okan mi mo.

C:
Lord Jesus, think on me
With many a care oppressed
Let me Thy loving servant be,
And taste Thy promised rest
D:
Jesu, jo ranti mi,
Em’ eni ‘nilara;
Ki nse ‘ranse t’ o n’ ife Re,
Ki nto ‘simi Re wo

C:
Lord Jesus, think on me,
Nor let me go astray;
Through darkness and perplexity
Point Thou the heavenly way
D:
Jesu, jo ranti mi,
Ma jeki nsako lo;
N’nu ‘damu on ookun aiye,
F’ ona orun han mi.

C:
Lord Jesus, think on me,
That, when the flood is past,
I may the eternal brightness see
And share Thy joy at last
D:
Jesu, jo ranti mi,
Gba gbogbo re koja,
Ki nle r’ ogo ainipekun,
Ki nsi le ba O yo.

C:
Lord Jesus, think on me,
That I may sing above
To Father, Holy Ghost, and Thee
The songs of praise and love
D:
Jesu, jo ranti mi,
Ki nle ko ‘rin l’oke,
Si Baba, Emi at’ Iwo,
Orin ‘yin at’ ife.

C:
When at Thy footstool, Lord, I bend,
And plead with Thee for mercy there,
Think of the sinner’s dying Friend,
And for His sake receive my prayer.
D:
Bi mo ti kunle, Oluwa,
Ti mo nbe f’ anu l’odo Re,
Wo t’ Ore ‘lese ti nku lo,
Si tori Re gb’ adura mi.

C:
O think not of my shame and guilt,
My thousand stains of deepest dye;
Think of the blood which Jesus spilt,
And let that blood my pardon buy.
D:
Ma ro ‘tiju at’ ebi mi,
At’ aimoye abawon mi,
Ro t’ eje ti Jesu ta ‘le
Fun ‘dariji on iye mi.

C:
Think, Lord, how I am still Thine own,
The trembling creature of Thy hand;
Think how my heart to sin is prone,
And what temptations round me stand.
D:
Ranti bi mo ti je Tire,
Ti mo je eda owo Re;
Ro b’ okan mi ti fa s’ ese,
Bi ‘danwo si ti yi mi ka.

C:
O think upon Thy holy Word,
And every plighted promise there;
How prayer should evermore be heard,
And how Thy glory is to spare.
D:
A! ronu oro mimo Re,
Ati gbogbo ileri Re;
Pe ‘Wo O gbo adura titi,
Ogo Re ni lati da si.

C:
O think not of my doubts and fears,
My strivings with Thy grace divine;
Think upon Jesus’ woes and tears,
And let His merits stand for mine.
D:
A! ma ro ti ‘yemeji mi,
Ati ailo or’ -ofe Re;
Ro ti omije Jesu mi,
Si fi ‘toye Re di t’ emi

Oju on eti Re ko se,
Agbara Re ko le ye lai;
Joo wo mi: okan mi wuwo,
Da mi si, k’ O ran mi lowo.

C:
O Lord, turn not Thy face away
From them that lowly lie,
Lamenting sore their sinful life
With tears and bitter cry.
D:
Baba mi yi oju kuro
Fun emi otosi;
Ti npohunrere ese mi
N’ iwaju ite Re.

C:
Thy mercy-gates are open wide
To them that mourn their sin;
O shut them not against us, Lord,
But let us enter in.
D:
‘Lekun anu t’ o si sile,
F’ akerora ese,
Mase ti mo mi Oluwa
Je ki emi wole.

C:
We need not to confess our fault,
For surely Thou canst tell;
What we have done, and what we are,
Thou knowest very well.
D:
Emi ko ni pe mo njewo
B’ aiye mi ti ri;
Gbogbo re l’ at’ ehin wa, ni
‘Wo mo dajudaju.

C:
Wherefore, to beg and to entreat,
With tears we come to Thee,
As children that have done amiss
Fall at their father's knee.
D:
Mo wa si ‘lekun anu Re,
Nibiti anu po:
Mo fe ‘dariji ese mi,
K’ o mu okan mi da

C:
And need we, then, O Lord, repeat
The blessing which we crave,
When Thou dost know, before we speak,
The thing that we would have?
D:
Emi ko ni ma tenumo
Itunu ti mo nfe:
‘Wo mo, Baba, ki nto bere,
Ibukun t’ emi nwa.

C:
Mercy, O Lord, mercy we seek,
This is the total sum:
For mercy, Lord, is all our prayer;
O let Thy mercy come.
D:
Anu, Oluwa, ni mo nfe
Eyi - yi l’ opin na;
Oluwa, anu l’ o ye mi,
Je ki anu Re wa.

C:
As that publican O my Lord
I Place my heart in Thee
Lord speak to my heart with Thy grace
“Have mercy on me Lord”
D:
Oluwa, b’ agbowode ni,
Mo gb’ okan mi le O;
Oluwa, f’ ore-ofe wi,
K’ O se anu fun mi

C:
My unrest heart I always beat,
From where tears and pains flow
Hear me in this most painful state,
Have mercy on me Lord
D:
Mo lu aiduro aiya mi,
Ekun at’ irora;
K’ O gb’ okan mi n’nu irora,
K’ O se anu fun mi.

C:
In shame, I confess all my sins
strengthen my sincere hope
I plead for sake of Jesus' blood
“Have mercy on me Lord”
D:
N’ itiju mo jew’ ese mi,
Jo fun mi n’ ireti;
Mo be ‘tori eje Jesu,
K’ O se anu fun mi.

C:
Greatest of all sinners I am
Count not my sins O Lord
But for the sake of Jesus’ death
“have Mercy on me Lord”
D:
Olori elese ni mi,
Ese mi p’ apoju;
Nitori iku Jesu wa,
K’ O se anu fun mi.

C:
I stand by the most painful cross
I fear not Thy shadow
Because God of merciful eyes
Forgiven me my sins.
Amen.
D:
Mo duro ti agbelebu,
Nko sa f’ ojiji Re:
Ti Olorun t’ O po l’ anu.
O ti se anu fun mi.

C:
No, not despairingly
Come I to Thee;
No, not distrustingly
Bend I the knee:
Sin hath gone over me,
Yet is this still my plea,
Jesus hath died.
D:
Ki se l’aini ‘reti
Ni mo to o wa;
Ki se l’ aini ‘gbagbo
Ni mo kunle:
Ese ti g’ori mi,
Eyi sa l’ ebe mi, Eyi sa l’ebe mi,
Jesu ti ku.

C:
Ah! Mine iniquity
Crimson has been,
Infinite, infinite,
Sin upon sin;
Sin of not loving Thee,
Sin of not trusting Thee,
Infinite sin.
D:
A! ese mi poju,
O pon koko!
Adale, Adale,
Ni mo nd’ ese!
Ese aiferan Re;
Ese aigba O gbo : Ese aigba O gbo,
Ese nlanla!

C:
Lord, I confess to Thee
Sadly my sin;
All am tell I Thee,
All I have been:
Purge Thou my sin away,
Wash Thou my soul this day;
Lord, make me clean.
D:
Oluwa mo jewo
Ese nla mi;
O mo bi mo ti ri,
Bi mo ti wa;
Jo we ese mi nu!
K’ okan mi mo loni, k’ okan mi mo loni,
Ki ndi mimo.

C:
Faithful and just art Thou,
Forgiving all;
Loving and kind art Thou
When poor ones call:
Lord, let the cleansing blood,
Blood of the Lamb of God,
Pass o'er my soul.
D:
Olododo ni O
O ndariji;
L’ese agbelebu
Ni mo wole;
Je k’ eje iwenu,
Eje Od’ aguntan, eje Od’ aguntan,
We okan mi.

C:
Then all is peace and light
This soul within;
Thus shall I walk with Thee,
The loved Unseen;
Leaning on Thee, my God,
Guided along the road,
Nothing between.
D:
‘Gbana, Alafia
Y’ o d’ okan mi;
‘Gbana, ngo ba O rin,
Ore airi;
Em’ o f’ara ti O,
Jo ma to mi s’ ona, Jo ma to mi s’ ona
Titi aiye.

C:
Jesus, lover of my soul,
Let me to Thy bosom fly,
While the nearer waters roll,
While the tempest still is high.
Hide me, O my Savior, hide,
Till the storm of life is past;
Safe into the haven guide;
Oh, receive my soul at last.
D:
Jesu Oluf’ okan mi
Je ki nsala s’ aiya Re,
Sa t’ Irumi sunmo mi,
Sa ti je iji nfe s’ oke,
Pa mi mo Olugbala,
Tit’ iji aiye y’ opin,
To mi lo s’ ebute Re,
Nikehin gba okan mi.

C:
Other refuge have I none,
Hangs my helpless soul on Thee;
Leave, ah! leave me not alone,
Still support and comfort me.
All my trust on Thee is stayed,
All my help from Thee I bring;
Cover my defenseless head
With the shadow of Thy wing.
D:
Abo mi, emi ko ni,
Iwo l’ okan mi ro mo;
Ma f’ emi nikan sile,
Gba mi, si tu mi ninu
Iwo ni mo gbekele,
Iwo n’ Iranlowo mi;
Masai f’ iye ap Re
D’ abo bori aibo mi.

C:
Thou, O Christ, art all I want,
More than all in Thee I find;
Raise the fallen, cheer the faint,
Heal the sick, and lead the blind.
Just and holy is Thy Name,
i am all unrighteousness
Vile and full of sin I am,
Thou art full of truth and grace.
D:
Krist ‘Wo nikan ni mo fe,
N’ nu Re, mo r’ ohun gbogbo;
Gb’enit t’ o subu dide,
W’ alaisan, to afoju;
Ododo l’ oruko Re,
Alaisododo l’ emi,
Mo kun fun ese pupo,
Iwo kun fun ododo.

‘Wo l’ opo ore-ofe
Lati fi bo ese mi;
Je ki omi iwosan
We inu okan mi mo;
Iwo l’ orison iye,
Je ki mbu n’nu Re l’ofe,
Ru jade n’nu okan mi,
Si iye ainipekun.

C:
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.
Let the water and the blood,
From Thy wounded side which flow'd,
Be of sin the double cure,
Save from wrath and make me pure.
D:
Apata aiyeraye,
Se ibi isadi mi;
Je ki omi on eje
T’ O san lati iha Re,
Se iwosan f’ ese mi,
K’ o si so mi di mimo.

C:
While I draw this fleeting breath,
When my eyelids close in sleep,
When I soar through eternity,
See Thee on Thy mercy throne,
Rock of Ages cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.
D:
‘Gbati emi mi ba lo,
Ti ‘se mi laiye pari,
Ti mba nlo s’ aiye raiye,
Ki nri O n’ ite Anu;
Apata aiyeraiye,
Se ibi isadi mi.

C:
As pants the hart for cooling streams
When heated in the chase,
So longs my soul, O God, for Thee,
And Thy refreshing grace.
D:
Bi agbonrin ti nmi hele,
S’ ipa odo omi;
Beni okan mi nmi si O,
Iwo Olorun mi.

C:
For Thee, my God, the living God,
My thirsty soul doth pine;
Oh, when shall I behold Thy face,
Thou Majesty Divine?
D:
Orungbe Re ngbe okan mi,
Olorun Alaaye;
NIgbawo ni ngo r’ oju Re,
Olorun ola-nla?

C:
Why restless, why cast down, my soul?
Trust God, who will employ
His aid for thee, and change these sighs
To thankful hymns of joy.
D:
Okan mi, o se rewesi?
Gbekele Olorun;
Enit y’o so ekun re
D’ orin ayo fun o.

C:
Why restless, why cast down, my soul?
Hope still, and thou shalt sing
The praise of Him who is thy God,
Thy health’s eternal spring.
D:
Okan mi, o se rewesi?
Gbagbo, ‘wo o si ko,
Orin iyin s’ Olorun re,
Orisun emi re.

C:
Just as I am, without one plea
But that thy blood was shed for me
And that thou bidd’st me come to thee
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
D:
Bi mo ti ri – laisawawi,
Sugbon nitori eje Re;
B’ O si ti pe mi pe ki nwa
Olugba-la mo de.

C:
Just as I am and waiting not
To rid my soul of one dark blot,
To thee, whose blood can cleanse each spot,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
D:
Bi mo ti ri – laiduro pe,
Mo fe k’ okan mi mo toto,
S’ odo Re t’ o le we mi mo,
Olugbala mo de.

C:
Just as I am, though tossed about
With many a conflict, many a doubt,
Fightings and fears within, without,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
D:
Bi mo ti ri b’o tile je,
Ija l’ ode ija ninu;
Eru l’ ode, eru ninu,
Olugbala, mo de.

C:
Just as I am, poor, wretched, blind;
Sight, riches, healing of the mind,
Yea, all I need, in thee to find,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
D:
Bi mo ti ri – osi, are,
Mo si nwa  imularada;
Iwo l’ o le s’ awotan mi.
Olugbala mo de.

C:
Just as I am, thou wilt receive,
Wilt welcome, pardon, cleanse, relieve;
Because thy promise I believe,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
D:
Bi mo ti ri ‘Wo o gba mi,
Wo o gba mi t’ owo t’ ese;
‘Tori mo gba ‘leri Re gbo,
Olugbala, mo de.

C:
Just a I am; thy love unknown
Has broken every barrier down;
Now to be thine, yea, thine alone,
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
D:
Bi mo ti ri – ife Tire,
L’ o sete mi patapata;
Mo di Tire, Tire nikan,
Olugbala, mo de.

C:
Loving Saviour, hear my cry,
Hear my cry, hear my cry;
Trembling to Thine arms I fly:
O save me at the Cross!
I have sinn'd, but Thou hast died,
Thou hast died, Thou hast died;
In Thy mercy let me hide:
O save me at the Cross!
Chorus:
Lord Jesus, receive me,
No more would I grieve Thee,
Now, blessed Redeemer,
O save me at the Cross!
D:
Olugbala gb’ohun mi,
Gb’ohun mi, gbo’ohun mi,
Mo wa s’odo Re, gba mi,
Nibi agbelebu.
Emi se, sugbon  o Ku;
Iwo ku, Iwo ku;
Fi anu Re pa mi mo.
Nibi agbelebu,
Oluwa, jo gba mi,
Nki y’o bi O ninu mo!
Alabukun, gba mi
Nibi agbelebu.

C:
Tho' I perish I will pray,
I will pray, I will pray;
Thou of life the Living Way:
O save me at the Cross!
Thou hast said Thy grace is free,
Grace is free, grace is free:
Have compassion, Lord on me:
O save me at the Cross!
[Chorus]
D:
Ese mi po lapoju,
Ngo bebe! Ngo bebe!
Iwo li Ona iye,
Nibi agbelebu,
Ore-ofe Re t’a gba,
L’ofe ni, lofe ni
F’ oju anu Re wo mi,
Nibi agbelebu.
Oluwa jo, gba mi &c.

C:
Wash me in Thy cleansing blood,
Cleansing blood, cleansing blood;
Plunge me now beneath the flood:
O save me at the Cross!
Only faith will pardon bring,
Pardon bring, pardon bring:
In that faith to Thee I cling:
O save me at the Cross!
[Chorus]
D:
F’ eje mimo Re we mi,
Fi we mi! fi we mi!
Ri mi sinu ibu Re,
Nibi agbelebu.
‘Gbagbo l’ o le fun wa ni
‘Dariji! ‘Dariji!
Mo f’ igbagbo ro mo O,
Nibi agbelebu.
Oluwa jo, gba mi &c.

Ekun ko le gba mi;
Bi mo le f’ ekun we ‘ju:
Ko le mu eru mi tan,
Ko le we ese mi ni;
Ekun ko le gba mi,
Jesu sun O ku fun mi,
O jiya l’ ori igi
Lati so mi d’ ominira,
On na l’ O le gba mi.

C:
Working will not save me
Purest deeds that I can do,
Holiest thoughts and feelings, too,
Can not form my soul anew
Working will not save me. [Refrain]
D:
Ise ko le gba mi;
Ise mi t’ o daraju,
Ero mi t’ o mo ju lo
Ko le so ‘kan mi d’otun,
Ise ko le gba mi.
[Chorus]

C:
Waiting will not save me
Helpless, guilty, lost I lie,
In my ear is mercy's cry;
If I wail I can but die
Waiting will not save me. [Refrain]
D:
‘Duro ko le gba mi,
Enit’ o junu ni mi
L’ eti mi l’ anu nke pe,
Bi mo ba duro ngo ku;
‘Duro ko le gba mi.
[Chorus]

C:
Faith in Christ will save me
Let me trust thy weeping Son,
Trust the work that he has done;
To his arms, Lord, help me run
Faith in Christ will save me. [Refrain]

I am Thine, O Lord, 
I have heard Thy voice,
And it told Thy love to me;
But I long to rise in the arms of faith,
And be closer drawn to Thee.
Chorus:
Draw me nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died;
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.
D:
Oluwa, emi sa ti gb’ohun Re,
O nso ife Re si mi:
Sugbon mo fen de l’ apa igbagbo
Ki nle tubo sunmo O.
Fa mi mora, mora Oluwa,
Sib’ agbelebu t’ O ku,
Fa mi mora, mora, mora, Oluwa
Sib’ eje Re t’ o niye.

C:
Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,
By the power of grace divine;
Let my soul look up with a stead-fast hope,
And my will be lost in Thine.
[Chorus]
D:
Ya mi si mimo fun ise Tire,
Nipa ore - ofe Re:
Jeki nfi okan igbagbo w’ oke,
K’ ife mi te si Tire.
Fa mi mora &c.

C:
O the pure delight of a single hour
That before Thy throne I spend,
When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee, my God,
I commune as friend with friend!
[Chorus]
D:
A! ayo mimo ti wakati kan,
Ti mo lo nib’ ite Re;
‘Gba mo gbadura si O, Olorun,
Ti a s’ oro bi ore,
Fa mi mora &c.

C:
There are depths of love that I can not know
Till I cross the narrow sea;
There are heights of joy that I may not reach
Till I rest in peace with Thee.
[Chorus]
D:
Ijinle ife mbe ti mko le mo,
Titi ngo fi koja odo
Ayo giga tie mi ko le so
Titi ngo fi de ‘Simi
Fa mi mora &c

C:
O Jesus, Thou art standing,
Outside the fast closed door,
In lowly patience waiting
To pass the threshold o’er:
D:
A jesu, Iwo nduro
Lode, lehin ‘lekun,
Iwo fi suru duro
Lati koja s’ile.

C:
Shame on us, Christian brothers,
His name and sign who bear,
O shame, thrice shame upon us,
To keep Him standing there!
D:
Itiju l’ o je fun wa,
Awa ti n j’ Ooko Re;
Itiju gidigidi!
Bi a ba fi s’ ode.

C:
O Jesus, Thou art knocking;
And lo, that hand is scarred,
And thorns Thy brow encircle,
And tears Thy face have marred:
D:
A jesu, Iwo nkannkun,
Owo na si l’ apa;
Egun yi ori Re ka,
Ekun b’ oju Re je.

C:
O love that passeth knowledge,
So patiently to wait!
O sin that hath no equal,
So fast to bar the gate!
D:
A! ife ‘yanu l’ eyi
T’ o nfi suru duro,
A! ese ti ko l’ egbe,
T’ o ha ‘lekun pinpin!.

C:
O Jesus, Thou art pleading
In accents meek and low,
"I died for you, My children,
And will you treat Me so?
D:
A! Jesu, Iwo mbebe
L’ ohun pelepele:
“mo ku f’ eyin omo mi,
Bayi l’ e se mi si?”

C:
O Lord, with shame and sorrow
We open now the door;
Dear Savior, enter, enter,
And leave us nevermore.
D:
Oluwa, a silekun
N’ ikanu on ‘tiju,
Olugbala wa wo’le;
Ma fi wa s’ile lo.

C:
Ride on, ride on in majesty!
Hark! all the tribes Hosanna! cry;
O Saviour meek, pursue Thy road
With palms and scattered garments strowed
D:
Maa g’ esin lo, l’ olanla Re;
Gbo! Gbogb’ aiye nke “Hossana,”
Olugbala, ma lo pele
Lori im’ ope at’ aso.

C:
Ride on, ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
O Christ, Thy triumphs now begin
O'er captive death and conquered sin

Ride on, ride on in majesty!
The winged squadrons of the sky
Look down with sad and wondering eyes
To see the approaching sacrifice
D:
Ma gesin lo l’ olanla Re;
Ogun Angeli lat’ orun
Nf’ iyanu pelu ikanu
Wo ebo to sunmole yi.

C:
Ride on, ride on in majesty!
Thy last and fiercest strife is nigh;
The Father on His sapphire throne
Expects His own annointed Son

Ride on, ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die!
Bow Thy meek head to mortal pain,
Then take, O God, Thy power, and reign
D:
Ma gesin lo l’ olanla Re;
Ma f’ irele gesin lo ku:
F’ ara da Irora f’ eda:
Lehin na, nde k’ O ma joba.

C:
Chorus: All glory, laud, and honor
To Thee, Redeemer, King,
To whom the lips of children
Made sweet hosannas ring!
Thou art the King of Israel,
Thou David’s royal Son,
Who in the Lord’s name comest,
The King and blessed One!
D:
Gbogb’ ogo, iyin ola,
Fun O, Olodumare,
S’ Eni t’ awon omode,
Nko Hosanna didun!
‘Wo l’ Oba Israeli,
Om’ alade Dafidi,
T’ O wa l’ Oko Oluwa,
Oba olubukun.

C:
The company of angels
Are praising Thee on high,
And mortal men and all things
Created make reply:
D:
Egbe awon Angeli,
Nyin O l’ oke giga;
Awa at’ eda gbogbo
Si dapo gberin na.

C:
The people of the Hebrews
With palms before Thee went;
Our praise and prayer and anthems
Before Thee we present.
Chr: All laud & c.
D:
Awon heberu lo saju,
Pelu imo ope:
Iyin, adua, at’ orin,
L’ a mu wa ‘waju Re.
Gbogb’ ogo, iyin, ola &c.

C:
To Thee, before Thy passion,
They sang their hymns of praise;
To Thee, now high exalted,
Our melody we raise:
Chr: All Laud & c.
D:
Si O saju iya Re,
Nwon ko ‘rin iyin won:
“Wo t’ a gbega nisiyi,
L’ a nko’ rin iyin si.
Gbogb’ ogo, iyin, ola. &c.

C:
Thou didst accept their praises—
Accept the praise we bring,
Who in all good delightest,
Thou good and gracious King!
Chr:All laud & c.
D:
“Wo gba orin iyin won:
Gb’ adura t’ a mu wa,
“Wo ti nyo s’ ohun rere,
Oba wa Olore.
Gbogb’ ogo, iyin, ola &c

C:
Hosannah unto David's son
Hosannah, let us sing
Blessed is He that cometh in
In the name of our Lord
D:
“Hosanna s’ Omo Dafidi,”
Hosanna! E ko’ rin !
“ Olubukun l’ Eniti mbo
L’ oruko Oluwa!”

C:
Hosannah unto David's son
Sings the angelic host
All creatures, join in the chorus
Hosannah to our king
D:
“ Hosanna s’ Omo Dafidi,”
L’ egbe Angeli nke;
Gbogb’ eda, e jumo gbe ‘rin,
Hosanna s’ Oba wa.

C:
Hosannah all the Hebrew sing
With palm fronds on the road
Hosannah let us a bring gifts
Make repairs to His road.
D:
Hosanna! Awon Heberu
Ja im’ ope s’ ona;
Hosanna! a mu ebun wa
Fi tun ona Re se.

C:
the old and young shout Hosannah
Before His suffering came
Today we all say Hosannah
As He's reigning above
D:
T’ agba t’ewe nke, Hosanna!
K’ ijiya Re to de;
L’ oni, a si nko Hosanna!
B’ O ti njoba loke.

C:
You recieved their praise on that day
Please, Lord recieve our plea
That we migt sing with he angels
Hosannah to our king
D:
B’ O ti gba ‘yin won nigbana,
Jo, gba ebe wa yi!
L’ orun, k’a le b’Angel ko’rin,
Hosanna s’ Oba awa.

C:
Children of Jerusalem
Sang the praise of Jesus’ Name:
Children, too, of modern days
Join to sing the Savior’s praise.
Refrain:
Hark, hark, hark!
While infant voices sing,
Hark, hark, hark!
While infant voices sing
Loud hosannas, loud hosannas,
Loud hosannas to our King.
D:
Awon ewe Salemu
Ko ‘rin ‘yin oruko Jesu;
Awa ewe ti isiyi,
Jumo yin Olugbala.
Gbo! gbo! gbo! b’awon ewe ti nko,
Gbo! gbo! gbo! b’awon ewe ti nko;
Ho . . . sanna! Ho . . . sanna!
Ho . . . sanna si Oba wa!

C:
We are taught to love the Lord,
We are taught to read His Word;
We are taught the way to Heav’n:
Praise for all to God be giv’n.
[Refrain]
D:
A ko wa k’ a f’ Oluwa,
K’ a si ma ka oro Re,
A f’ ona orun han wa;
Ogo ni fun Olorun!
Gbo! gbo! gbo! b’awon ewe ti nko. Etc.

C:
Parents, teachers, old and young,
All unite to swell the song;
Higher and yet higher rise,
’Til hosannas fill the skies.
[Refrain]
D:
K’ oluko t’ agba – tewe,
Jumo gbe orin na ga;
Loke – loke, k’ o ma ho,
Ki Hosanna de orun.
Gbo! gbo! gbo! b’awon ewe ti nko. Etc

C:
When Jesus left His Father's throne,
He chose an humble birth;
Like us, unhonour'd and unknown,
He came to dwell on earth
D:
‘Gba Jesu f’ ite Re sile,
O mu ‘po irele;
Ni ‘rele O mu awo wa,
O wag be ‘nu aiye.

C:
Like Him may be found below,
In wisdom's path of peace;
Like Him in grace and knowledge grow,
As years and strength increase
D:
A ba le rin bi On ti rin,
Nipa ono ogbon;
K’ a dagba l’ ore at’ ogbon,
Bi odun ti npo si.

C:
Sweet were His words and kind His look,
When mothers round Him press'd;
Their infants in His arms He took,
And on His bosom bless'd
D:
Oro didun ati erin,
Gba ‘won iya to wa,
L’ o fi gbe omo won mora,
T’ o si sure fun won.

C:
Safe from the world's alluring harms,
Beneath His watchful eye,
Thus in the circle of His arms
May we for ever lie
D:
A ba le wa l’ alafia,
L’ apa olugbala,
K’ a bo lowo ‘baje aiye,
Labe itoju Re

C:
When Jesus into Salem rode,
The children sang around;
For joy they pluck'd the palms, and strow'd
Their garments on the ground
D:
‘Gba Jesu gun ketekete
Awon ‘mode nko’ rin;
L’ ayo, nwon ke eka igi,
Nwon te ‘so won sile.

C:
Hosanna our glad voices raise,
Hosanna to our King!
Should we forget our Saviour's praise,
The stones themselves would sing
D:
Hosanna l’ a ba ko l’ orin,
Hosanna s’ Oba wa;
B’ a ba gbagbe iyin Jesu,
Okuta y’ o ko’ rin.

C:
Redemption! oh, wonderful story
Glad message for you and for me
That Jesus has purchased our pardon,
And paid all the debt on the tree.
Chorus
Believe it, O sinner, believe it,
Receive the glad message ? 'tis true,
Trust now in the crucified Saviour
Salvation he offers to you
D:
Irapada! Itan iyanu,
Ihin ayo fun gbogbo wa,
Jesu ti ra ‘dariji fun wa,
O san gbese na l’ ori ‘gi,
A! elese gba ihin na gbo,
Jo gba ihin ooto na gbo,
Gbeke re le Olugbala re,
T’ O mu igbala fun o wa.

O mu wa t’ inu ‘ku bo si ‘ye
O si so wa d’ om’ Olorun:
Orisun kan si fun elese,
We nin’ eje na k’ o si mo.

C:
No longer shall sin have dominion,
Though present to tempt and annoy,
For Christ, in His blessed redemption,
The power of sin shall destroy
[Chorus]
D:
Ese ki y’o le joba wa mo,
B’ o ti wu ko dan wa wo to,
Nitori Kristi fi ‘rapada,
Pa ‘gbara esse run fun wa.

Gba anu t’ Olorun  fi lo o,
Sa wa s’odo Jesu loni;
“Tori y’ o gb’ eni t’ o ba to wa,
Ki yio si da pada lai.

C:
Have you read the story of the Cross,
Where Jesus bled and died;
Where your debt was paid by His precious blood
That flowed from His wounded side?
Chorus
He died of a broken heart for you,
He died of a broken heart;
Upon a tree, for you, for me,
He died of a broken heart

Have you read how they placed the crown of thorn
Upon His brow for you,
When He prayed, ''Forgive them, oh forgive;
They know not what they do?''
[Chorus]
D:
O tii ka b’ ati f’ ade egun
De ori Re fun o,
‘Gbat’ O gb’adura pe ‘Dariji won”
Nwon se l’aimokan sa ni?

C:
Have you read how He saved the dying thief
When hanging on the tree,
When he looked with pleading eyes and said,
''Dear Lord, remember Me?''
[Chorus]
D:
O tii ka b’ O ti gb’ ole ni la,
T’ o nku lo lor’ igi,
Nigbat on fi kaanu wipe
“Oluwa jo ranti mi?”

C:
Have you read that He looked to heaven and said,
'''Tis finished?'' 'Twas for thee!
Have you ever said, ''I thank Thee, Lord,
For giving Thy life for me?''
[Chorus]
D:
O tii ka b’ O ti gboju soke
T’ O wipe “O pari”
O ti so pe “Mo dupe fun Oluwa,
Nitori O ku fun mi?”

C:
Great High Priest, we see Thee stooping,
With our names upon Thy breast;
In the garden groaning, drooping,
To the ground with horrors prest:
Wondering angels stood confounded,
To behold their Maker thus;
And can we remain unwounded,
When we know 'twas all for us?

Nothing but hy blood, O Jesus,
Can our wayward souls convert;
Nothing else from guilt release us,
Nothing else can melt the heart.
Law and terrors do but harden,
All the while they work alone;
But the sense of blood-bought pardon
Can dissolve a heart of stone

Jesus, all our consolations
Flow from Thee, the sovereign good;
Love, and faith, and hope, and patience,
All purchased by Thy blood:
From Thy fullness we receive them;
We have nothing of our own:
Freely Thou deligh'st to give them
To the needy who have none
D:
Jesu, gbogbo itunu wa,
Lat’ odo Re l’ o ti nwa;
Ife, ‘gbagbo, ‘reti, suru,
Gbogbo re l’ eje Re ra:
Lat’ inu ekun Re l’ a ngba,
A ko da ohun kan ni;
L’ ofe n’ Iwo nfi wo tore
Fun awon t’ o s’ alaini.

C:
Glory be to Jesus,
who, in bitter pains,
poured for me the life-blood
from his sacred veins.
D:
Ogo ni fun Jesu,
T’ o f’ irora nla
‘Ta eje Re fun mi;
Lati iha Re.

C:
Grace and life eternal
in that blood I find;
blest be his compassion
infinitely kind.
D:
Mo r’ iye ailopin
Ninu eje na;
Iyonu Re sa po,
Oore Re ki tan.

C:
Blest through endless ages
be the precious stream,
which from endless torments
did the world redeem.
D:
Ope ni titi lai,
F’ eje ‘yebiye,
T’ o ra aiye pada,
Kuro n’nu egbe.

C:
Abel's blood for vengeance
pleaded to the skies;
but the blood of Jesus
for our pardon cries.
D:
Eje Abel’ nkigbe
Si orun f’ esan;
Sugb’ eje Jesu nke
Fun ‘dariji wa.

C:
Oft as it is sprinkled
on our guilty hearts,
Satan in confusion
terror-struck departs.
D:
Nigbat a bu won
Okan ese wa,
Satan, n’ idamu re,
F’ eru sa jade.

C:
Oft as earth exulting
wafts its praise on high,
angel-hosts rejoicing
make their glad reply.
D:
Nigbat’ aiye ba nyo
T’ o ngbe ‘yin Re ga,
Awon ogun Angel’
A ma f’ ayo gbe.

Nje, e gb’ ohun nyin ga,
Ki iron a dun!
Kikan l’ohun goro
Yin Od’aguntan.

C:
There is a green hill far away,
Without a city wall,
Where the dear Lord was crucified
Who died to save us all
D:
Oke kan mbe jina rere,
Lehin odi ilu,
Nibit’ a kan Oluwa mo,
Enit’ O ku fun wa.

C:
We may not know, we cannot tell
What pains He had to bear;
But we believe it was for us
He hung and suffered there
D:
A ko le mo, a ko le so,
B’ irora, Re ti to,
Sugbon a mo pe ‘tori wa
L’ O se jiya nibe.

C:
He died that we might be forgiven,
He died to make us good,
That we might go at last to heaven
Saved by His precious blood
D:
O ku k’ a le ri ‘dariji,
K’ a le huwa rere;
K’ a si le d’ orun nikehin,
N’ itoye eje Re.

C:
There was no other good enough
To pay the price of sin;
He only could unlock the gate
Of heaven, and let us in
D:
Ko tun s’ eni ‘re miran mo,
T’ o le sanwo ese;
On l’ o le silekun orun,
K’ o si gba wa sile.

C:
O dearly, dearly has He loved,
And we must love Him too,
And trust in His redeeming blood,
And try His works to do.
D:
A! b’ ife Re ti s’owon to,
O ye k’ a feran Re!
K’ a si gbekele eje Re,
K’ a si se ife Re.

C:
Must Jesus bear the cross alone,
And all the world go free?
No, there's a cross for ev'ry one,
And there's a cross for me
D:
Ki Jesu ha nikan jiya,
K’ araiye lo l’ofo?
Iya mbe f’ olukuluku;
Iya si mbe fun mi.

C:
The consecrated cross I'll bear,
Till death shall set me free;
And then go home my crown to wear,
For there's a crown for me
D:
Em’ o ru agbelebu mi,
Tit’ iku y’ o gba mi;
‘Gbana, ngo lo’le lo d’ ade,
‘Tor’ ade mbe fun mi..

C:
Upon the crystal pavement, down
At Jesus' pierced feet,
With joy I'll cast my golden crown,
And His dear name repeat
D:
N’ile ita Kristali na
L’ eba ese Jesu,
Ngo f’ ade wura mi le’le;
Ngo yin oruko Re.

C:
O precious cross! O glorious crown!
O resurrection day!
Ye angels, from the stars come down,
And bear my soul away
D:
A! agbelebu! A! ade!
A! ojo ajinde!
Enyin Angel, e sokale,
Wa gbe okan mi lo.

C:
When I survey the wondrous cross
On which the Prince of glory died,
My richest gain I count but loss,
And pour contempt on all my pride.
D:
‘Gbati mo ri agbelebu,
Ti a kan Oba Ogo mo,
Mo ka gbogbo oro s’ ofo,
Mo kegan gbogb ogo mi.

C:
Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ, my God;
All the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to His blood.
D:
K’ a ma se gbo pe, mo nhale,
B’ o ye n’ iku Oluwa mi;
Gbogbo nkan asan ti mo fe,
Mo da sile fun eje Re.

C:
See, from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flow mingled down;
Did e'er such love and sorrow meet,
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were a present far too small;
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my soul, my life, my all.
D:
Gbogbo aiye ‘ba je t’ emi,
Ebun abere ni fun mi;
Ife nla ti nyanilenu
Gba gbogbo okan, emi mi.

C:
O perfect life of love!
All, all is finished now,
All that He left His throne above
To do for us below
D:
Ife l’o to bayi!
Ohun gbogbo pari,
O ti pari gbogbo ise
O ti pari re w’ aiye.

C:
No work is left undone
Of all the Father willed;
His toils and sorrows, one by one,
The Scriptures have fulfilled
D:
Ohun ti Baba fe,
Ni Jesu ti se tan;
Wahala ati iya Re
Mu Iwe Mimo se.

C:
No pain that we can share
But He has felt its smart;
All forms of human grief and care
Have pierced that tender heart
D:
Ko s’ irora wa kan,
Ti Jesu ko je ri;
Gbogbo edun at’ eniyan,
L’ okan Re si ti mo.

C:
And on His thorn-crowned head,
And on His sinless soul,
Our sins in all their guilt were laid,
That He might make us whole
D:
L’ ori t’ a f egun de,
At’ okan Re mimo,
L’ a ko gbogbo ese wa le,
K’ O ba le wow a san.

C:
In perfect love He dies;
For me He dies, for me!
O all-atoning Sacrifice,
I cling by faith to Thee
D:
Ife lo mu k’ zo ku
Fun emi otosi
‘Wo Etutu f’ ese gbogbo
Mo f’ igbagbo rom o

C:
In every time of need,
Before the judgement throne,
Thy work, O Lamb of God, I'll plead,
Thy merits, not my own
D:
Nigba aini gbogbo
Ati n’ ite ‘da jo
Jesu, odod Re nikan,
Ni igbekele mi.

C:
Yet work, O Lord, in me,
As Thou for me hast wrought;
And let my love the answer be
To grace Thy love has brought
D:
Joo sisi ninu mi,
Bi O ti se fun mi,
Si je ki ife mi si O,
Maa fi ore Re han.

C:
Alas, and did my Saviour bleed
And did my Sovereign die?
Would He devote that sacred head,
For such a worm as I?
D:
Olugbala mi ha gbogbe!
Oba ogo ha ku
On ha je f’ ara Re rubo
F’ eni ile b’ emi?

C:
Was it for crimes that I have done,
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!
D:
Iha se ese ti mo da,
L’ o gbe ko s’ or’ igi?
Anu at’ ore yi ma po,
Ife yi rekoja!

C:
Well might the sun in darkness hide
And shut His glories in;
When Christ, the mighty Maker, died
For man the creature's sin.
D:
O ye k’ oorun f’ oju pamo,
K’ o b’ ogo re mole;
‘Gbati Kristi Eleda ku,
Fun ese eda Re.

C:
Thus might I hide my blushing face
While His dear cross appears,
Dissolve my heart in thankfulness,
And melt mine eyes to tears.
D:
Be l’ o ye k’ oju ba ti mi,
‘Gba mo r’ agbelebu;
O ye k’ okan mi kun f’ ope,
Oju mi f’ omije

C:
But drops of grief can ne'er repay,
The debt of love I owe:
Here, Lord, I give myself away,
'Tis all that I can do!
D:
Sugbon omije ko le san
‘Gbese ‘fe ti mo je;
Mo f’ ara mi f’ Oluwa mi,
Eyi ni mo le se… Amin

C:
Alas, and did my Saviour bleed
And did my Sovereign die?
Would He devote that sacred head,
For such a worm as I?
Chorus
At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!
D:
O se! Olugbala mi ta
Je re sile O ku,
Nje o je f’ ori mimo na
Fun kokoro b’ emi.
Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko ri imole
Nibe, eru okan mi si fo lo;
Nibe, nipa igbagbo mo riran,
Nisiyi mo wa l’ Alafia titi.

C:
Was it for crimes that I have done,
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!
[Chorus]
D:
Nje tor’ ese ti mo da,
L’ o se jiya oro,
Anu at’ ore ofe yi
Ko se diwon rara

C:
Well might the sun in darkness hide
And shut His glories in;
When Christ, the mighty Maker, died
For man the creature's sin.
[Chorus]
D:
O to k’oorun k’ o s’ okunkun,
K’ o f’ ogo re pamo;
Nigba kristi’ Eleda nla ku
F’ ese awa eda.

C:
Thus might I hide my blushing face
While His dear cross appears,
Dissolve my heart in thankfulness,
And melt mine eyes to tears.
[Chorus]
D:
Be l’ o ye ki nf’ oju pamo,
Nibi agbelebu;
K; okan mi si yo ni ‘dupe
K’ oju mi s’ omije.

C:
But drops of grief can ne'er repay,
The debt of love I owe:
Here, Lord, I give myself away,
'Tis all that I can do!
[Chorus]
D:
Sugbon ‘banuje ko le san
‘Gbese ‘fe ti mo je,
Kristi mo f’ ara mi fun O.
Eyi ni mo le se.. Amin

C:
I gave my life for thee,
My precious blood I shed,
That thou might'st ransom'd be
And quicken'd from the dead.
I gave my life for thee;
What hast thou given for Me?
D:
Mo f’ ara Mi fun o,
Mo ku nitori re,
Ki nle ra o pada,
Ko le jinde n’n oku;
Mo f’ ara mi fun o,
Kini ‘wo se fun Mi?

C:
I spent long years for thee
In weariness and woe
That an eternity
Of joy thou mightest know.
I spent long years for thee;
Hast thou spent one for Me?

My Father's home of light,
My rainbow circled throne,
I left for earthly night,
For wanderings sad and lone.
I left it all for thee;
Hast thou left aught for Me?
D:
Ile ti Baba Mi,
At’ ite ogo Mi
Mo fi sile w’ aiye:
Mo d’ alarinkiri;
Mo f’ ile tori re,
Ki l’ o file fun Mi?

C:
I suffer'd much for thee,
More than thy tongue may tell,
Of bitterest agony,
To rescue thee from hell.
I suffer'd much for thee;
What canst thou bear for Me?

And I have brought to thee
Down from My home above
Salvation full and free,
My pardon and My love.
Great gifts I brought to thee;
What hast thou brought to Me?
D:
Mo mu igbala nla,
Lat’ ile Baba Mi
Wa, lati fi fun o:
Ati idariji;
Mo m’ ebun wa fun o,
Kil o mu wa fun Mi?

C:
Oh, let thy life be given,
Thy years for Me be spent,
World fetters all be riven,
And joy with suffering blent!
I gave Myself for thee:
Give thou thyself to Me.
D:
Fi ara re fun Mi,
Fi aiye re sin Mi,
Diju si nkan t’ aiye,
Si wo ohun t’ orun;
Mo f’a ara Mi fun o
Si f; ara re fun Mi… Amin

C:
Christ our Redeemer died on the cross,
Died for the sinner, paid all His due;
All who receive Him need never fear,
Yes, He will pass will pass over you.
When I see the blood, When I…see the blood,
When I See the blood, I will pass, 
I will pass over you..
D:
Kristi Olurapada wa ku,
O san gbogbo ‘gbese elese
F’ ej’ Odagutan we okan re,
‘’Emi yio si re o koja’’
‘Gba’ mo . .  . r’ eje na. . .
‘Gba’ mo . .  . r’ eje na. . .
‘Gba’ mo . .  . r’ eje naa. . .
‘’Emi yio si re o koja,’’

Jesu y’o gba olor’ elese,
Y’o se gbogbo’ ohun t’o ti leri,
Wa we n’nu ‘sun t’o si f’ elese
‘’Emi yio si re o koja’’

C:
Judgement is coming, all will be there.
Who have rejected, who have refused
Oh, sinner hasten, let Jesus in
And I will pass, will pass over you.  Amen.
D:
‘Dajo mbo, gbogbo wa y’o pade,
Olukuluku y’o gba ere,
Sa s’abe ‘je t’o gbagbo,
Nitori yio re won koja… Amin

C:
O, the deep, deep love of Jesus,
Vast, unmeasured, boundless, free!
Rolling as a mighty ocean
In its fullness over me!
Underneath me, all around me,
Is the current of thy love -
Leading onward, leading homeward,
To that glorious rest above!

Oh, the deep, deep love of Jesus -
Spread his praise from shore to shore!
How he loveth, ever loveth,
Changeth never, nevermore!
How he watches o'er His loved ones,
Died to call them all his own;
How for them he's intercedeth,
Watcheth o'er them from the throne!
D:
Ijinle ni ife Jesu,
Korin iyin re kiri;
Bi ife Re tit obi to,
Ife ti ki yipada:
O nse ‘toju awon Tire,
T’o ti fi eje Re ra;
O mbebe fun won l ‘ori ‘te
O npa won mo lat’ oke.

C:
Oh, the deep, deep love of Jesus,
Love of every love the best!
'Tis an ocean vast of blessing,
'Tis a haven sweet of rest!
O, the deep, deep love of Jesus -
'Tis heaven of heavens to me;
And it lifts me up to glory,
For it lifts me up to Thee!

On the Resurrection morning
Soul and body meet again;
No more sorrow, no more weeping,
No more pain!
D:
L’ owuro ojo ajinde,
T’ ara t’ okan y’ o pade,
Ekun, ’kanu on irora
Y’ o dopin.

C:
Here a while they must be parted,
And the flesh its Sabbath keep,
Waiting in a holy stillness,
Wrapt in sleep.
D:
Nihin nwon ko le sai pinya
Ki ara ba le simi,
K’ o si fi idake roro
Sun fonfon.

C:
For a while the tired Body
To its resting place is borne;
Till there dawns the last and Brightest
Easter morn.
D:
Fun ’gba die ara are yi
L’ a gbe s’ ibi ’simi re;
Titi di imole oro
Ajinde.

C:
But the soul in contemplation
Utters earnest prayer and strong,
Breaking at the Resurrection
Into song.
D:
Okan t’ o kanu nisisiyi
To si ngabdura kikan,
Y’ o bu s’orin ayo l’ ojo
Ajinde.

C:
Soul and body reunited
Thenceforth nothing shall divide,
Waking up in Christ's own likeness,
Satisfied .
D:
Ara at’ okan y’ o dapo
Ipinya ko ni si mo;
Nwon o ji l’ aworan Kristi’ ni
’Telorun.

C:
Oh! The beauty, oh! The gladness
Of that Resurrection day,
Which shall not through endless ages
Pass away!
D:
A! ewa na at’ ayo na
Y’ o ti po to l’ Ajinde!
Y’ o duro, b’ orun at’ aiye
Ba fo lo.

C:
On that happy Easter morning
All the graves their dead restore:
Father, mother, child, and brethren,
Meet once more.
D:
L’ oro ojo ajinde wa
’Boji y’o m’ oku re wa;
Baba, iya, omo, ara
Y’o pade.

C:
To that brightest of all meetings
Bring us, Jesus Christ, at last;
To Thy Cross, through death and Judgment, 
Holding fast.
Amen.
D:
Si ’dapo ti ofun bayi
Jesu masai ka wa ye
N’nu ‘ku, dajo k’ a le ro
M’abelebu.

C:
The happy Morn is come;
Triumphant o'er the grave
The Saviour leaves the Tomb
Omnipotent to save:
Captivity is captive led,
For Jesus liveth, that was dead.

Who now accuses them
For whom their Surety died!
Who now shall those condemn
Whom God hath justified?
Captivity is captive led,
For Jesus liveth, that was dead.
D:
Onigbowo wa ku,
Tani to fi wa sun?
Baba da wa lare,
Tal’o to da l’ebi?
A d’ igbekun, &c.

C:
Christ hath the ransom paid
The glorious work is done;
On Him our help is laid.
By Him our victory won,
Captivity is captive led,
For Jesus liveth, that was dead.
Amen.

Jesus lives! thy terrors now
can no more, O death, appal us;
Jesus lives! by this we know
thou, O grave, canst not enthrall us. Alleluia!
D:
Jesu ye; titi aiye
Eru iku ko ba ni mo;
Jesu ye; Nitorina
Isa oku ko n 'ipa mo. - Alleluya!

C:
Jesus lives! henceforth is death
but the gate of life immortal;
this shall calm our trembling breath
when we pass its gloomy portal. Alleluia!
D:
Jesu ye; lat' oni lo
Iku je ona si iye;
Eyi y'o je ' tunu wa
'Gbat' akoko iku ba de. - Alleluya!

C:
Jesus lives! for us he died;
then, alone to Jesus living,
pure in heart may we abide,
glory to our Savior giving. Alleluia!

Jesus lives! our hearts know well
nought from us his love shall sever;
life, nor death, nor powers of hell
tear us from his keeping ever. Alleluia!
D:
Jesu ye; eyi daju,
Iku at' ipa okunkun
Ki y' o le ya ni kuro
Ninu ife nla ti Jesu. - Alleluya!

C:
Jesus lives! to him the throne
over all the world is given:
may we go where he has gone,
rest and reign with him in heaven. Alleluia!
D:
Jesu ye; gbogbo 'joba
L' orun, li aiye, di Tire;
E je ki a ma tele
Ki a le joba pelu Re. -Alleluya.

C:
The day of resurrection!
Earth, tell it out abroad;
The Passover of gladness;
The Passover of God!
From death to life eternal
From earth unto sky,
Our Christ hath brought us over
With hymns of victory.
D:
Eyi l’ ojo ajinde,
K’ aiye wi karikari;
Irekoja didun ni,
T’ Olorun  Olore!
Lat’ inu iku s’ iye,
Lat’ aiye si orun,
Ni Krist’ ti mu wa koja,
Pel’ orin isegun.

C:
Our heart be pure from evil,
That we may see aright
The Lord in rays eternal
Of resurrection light,
And, listening to His accents,
May hear, so calm and plain,
His own All hail! And hearing,
May raise the victor-strain.

Now let the heavens be joyful;
Let earth her song begin:
The round world keep high triumph,
And all that is therein;
Invisible and visible
Their notes of gladness blend:
For Christ the Lord hath risen,
Our joy that hath no end.
Amen.
D:
Enyin orun, bu s’ayo,
K’ aiye bere gbe’rin:
Ki gbogbo aiye yika,
Dapo lati gbe’rin,
Eda nla ati wewe,
E gb’ ohun nyin soke,
‘Tori Krist ti jinde,
Ayo wa ki y’o pin.  Amin

C:
Maker and Redeemer, life and health of all,
Thou from heaven beholding human nature's fall,
Of the Father's Godhead, true and only Son.
Manhood to deliver, manhood didst put on.
"Welcome, happy morning!" etc
D:
Eleda, Oluwa, Emi alaye!
Lat’ orun L’ O ti bojuwo ‘sina wa,
Om’ Olorun papa ni ‘Wo tile se,
K’ O ba le gba wa la, O di enia.
“Kabo, ojo rere. &c.

C:
Thou, of life the Author, death didst undergo,
