Tread the path of darkness, saving strength to show.
Come, then, True and Faithful, now fulfil Thy word;
'Tis Thine own third morning; rise, my buried Lord!
"Welcome, happy morning! etc.

Awake, glad soul! Awake, awake!
Thy, Lord hath risen long;
Go to His grave, and with thee take
Both tuneful heart and song;
Where life is waking all around
Where love's sweet voices sing
The first bright blossom may be found
Of an eternal spring.
D:
Ji, ji okan ayo ji, ji.
Oluwa re jinde
LO ‘boji Re, ko si mura
Okan ati korin;
Gbogbo eda lo si ti ji,
Ti nwon nko’ rin didun,
Itanna ‘ kini t’ o ko tan
L’eba odo l’o hu.

C:
The shade and gloom of life are fled
This resurrection day;
Henceforth in Christ are no more dead,
The grave hath no more prey;
In Christ we live, in Christ we sleep,
In Christ we wake and rise,
And the sad tears death makes us weep
He wipes from all our eyes
D:
Isudede aiye y’ o lo
L’ ojo ajinde yi;
Iku ko si mo n’nu Kristi
Iboji ko n‘ ipa
Ninu Kristi l’ a nwa, t’ a nsun,
T‘ a nji, t’ a si ndide;
Omije t‘ iku mu ba wa
Ni Jesu y’ o nu nu.

C:
And every bird and every tree,
And every opening flower,
Proclaim His resurrection take
His resurrection power,
The folds are glad, the fields rejoice
With vernal verdure spread
The little hills lift up their voice
And shout that death is dead..
D:
Ki gbogbo eye at‘ igi
At‘ itanna ti ntan,
Ki won so ti isegun Re
Ati t‘ ajinde Re,
Papa, e gb‘ohun yin s’oke
E bu s’ orin ayo?
Enyin oke, e si gbe’rin
Wipe, “Iku ti ku”

C:
Then wake, glad heart! Awake, Awake,
And seek thy risen Lord,
Joy in His resurrection take
And comfort in His word:
And let thy life through all its ways,
One long thanksgiving be,
Its theme of joy, its song of me""Christ died and rose for me"Amen.
D:
Okan ayo, e ji, e wa
Oluwa t' O jinde.
E yo ninu ajinde Re,
K‘ oro Re tu yin n‘nu;
E gb‘ohun yin s’oke, k‘e yin
Enit' O ji dide;
L‘ ohun kan ni ka gbe’rin pe
“Jesu jinde fun mi”
Amin.

C:
ALLELUIA! ALLELUIA! ALLELUIA                         
The strife is o'er, the battle done:                       
The victory of life is won:                                      
The song triumph has begun.                            
Alleluia!
D:
ALLELUYA! ALLELUYA! ALLELUYA   Ija d’opin oguu si tan
Olugbala jagun m’olu
Orin ayo l’a o ma ko - ALLELUIA!

C:
The power of death have done their worst:   
But Christ their legions hath dispersed:             
Let shouts of holy joy outburst,                          
Alleluia!
D:
Gbogbo ipa n' iku ti lo
Sugbon Kristi f' ogun re ka
Aiye! e ho iho ayo - ALLELUIA!

C:
The Three sad days have quickly sped;        
He rises glorious from the dead;                       
All glory to our risen Head!                                 
Alleluia!
D:
Ojo meta na ti koja
O jinde kuro nin’ oku
E f'ogo fun Oluwa wa - ALLELUIA!

C:
He brake the age-bound chains of hell;        
The bars from heaven's high portals fell;            
Let hymns of praise His triumph tell:                   
Alleluia!
D:
O d' ewon orun apadi
O silekun orun s’ile
E korin yin ‘segun re - ALLELUIA!

C:
Lord, by the stripes which is wounded Thee.
From death's dread sting Thy servants free;     
That we may live, and sing to Thee:                     
Alleluia!
D:
Jesu, nipa iya t' O je
Gba wa lowo oro iku
K' a le ye, k’ a si ma yin O - ALLELUIA!

C:
Christ the Lord is risen to-day Hallelujah!
Sons of men, and, angels, say, Hallelujah!
Raise your joys and triumphs high; Hallelujah!
Sing, ye heavens; thou earth, reply, Hallelujah
D:
Kristi, Oluwa ji loni, - Halleluya
Eda at’ angeli nwi, - Hal
Gb’ayo at’isegun ga - Hal
K’ orun at” aye gberin – Hal

C:
Love's redeeming work is done; Hallelujah!
Fought the fight, the battle won;
Hallelujah!
Lo! Our sun's eclipse is o'er,
Hallelujah!
Lo! He sets in blood no more,
Hallelujah!
D:
Ise ti idande tan; - Hal
O jija, O ti segun; - Hal
Wo, sisu oorun koja-Hal
Ko wo sinu eje mo-Hal

C:
Vain the stone, the watch, the seal; Hallelujah
Christ hath burst the gates of hell; Hallelujah!
Death in vain forbids His rise!
Hallelujah!
Christ hath open'd paradise.
Hallelujah!
D:
Lasan n' Iso at' ami' – Hal.
Kris wo orun apadi; Hal.
Lasan l' agbara iku - Hal.
Kristi si Paradise-Hal.

C:
Lives again our glorious King;
Hallelujah
Where, O death, is now thy sting? Hallelujah!
Once He died our souls to save.
Hallelujah!
Where thy victory, O grave?
Hallelujah!
D:
O tun wa, Oba ogo, Hal
“iku itani re da?” Hal
Lekan l'O ku, k' O gba wa, Hal
“Boji, isegun re da?’’ Hal

C:
Soar we now where Christ hath led Hallelujah!
Following our exalted Head:
Hallelujah!
Made like Him, like Him we rise,
Hallelujah!
Ours the cross, the grave the skies, Hallelujah!
D:
E je k' awa goke lo - Hal
S'odo Kristi Ori wa: - Hal
A sa jinde pelu Re - Hal
Bi a ti ku pelu Re - Hal

C:
Hail the Lord of earth and heaven, Hallelujah!
Praise to Thee by both be given;
Hallelujah!
Thee we greet triumphant now,
Hallelujah!
Hail the Resurrection Thou! Hallelujah!
Amen.
D:
Oluwa t' aiye t' orun - Hal
Tire ni gbogbo iyin - Hal
A wole niwaju Re - Hal
'Wo ajinde at' iye - Alleluyah

C:
Hallelujah, Hallelujah!
Hearts to heaven and voices raise;
Sing to God a hymn of gladness,
Sing to God a hymn of praise!
He who on the cross a victim
For the world' salvation bled,
Jesus Christ, the king of Glory,
Now is risen from the dead,
D:
Halleluya, Halleluyah,
E gbe ohun ayo ga,
E ko orin inu didun,
K’ e si yin Oluwa wa!
Enit’ a kan m’ agbelebu,
T’ O jiya fun ese wa;
Jesu Kristi Oba Ogo
Jinde kuro n’ nu oku.

C:
Now the iron bars are broken
Christ from death to life is born,
Glorious life, and life immortal,
On this holy Easter morn:
Christ has triumph'd, and we
conquer
By His mighty enterprise,
We with Him to life eternal
By His resurrection rise.
D:
Irin idabu  se kuro,
Krist ku O si tun ye,
O mu iye ati aiku
Wa looro ajinde Re.
Krist’ ti segun, awa segun
Nipa agbara nla Re,
Awa o jinde pelu Re,
A o ba wo ‘nu Ogo.

C:
Christ is risen, Christ the first-fruits,
Of the holy harvest-field
Which will all its full abundance
At His second coming yield:
Then the golden ears of harvest
Will their heads before Him wave,
Ripen'd by His glorious sun shine,
From the furrows of the grave.
D:
Krist jinde, Akobi ni
Ninu awon t’ o ti sun,
Awon yi ni y’ o ji dide,
Ni abo Re ekeji;
Ikore ti won ti pon tan,
Nwon nreti Olukore,
Enit’ y’ o mu won kuro
Ninu isa oku won.

C:
Christ is risen; we are risen;
Shed upon us heavenly grace,
Rain and dew and gleams of glory
From the brightness of Thy face
That we, Lord, with hearts in
heaven
Here on earth may fruitful be,
And by angel-hands be gather'd,
And be ever safe with Thee.
D:
Awa jinde, pelu Kristi,
To nfun wa l’ ohun gbogbo,
Ojo , iri ati ogo
To ntan jade l’ oju Re,
Oluwa, b’ a ti w al’ aiye,
Fa okan wa s’odo Re,
K’ awon angeli saw a jo,
Ki nwon ko wa d’ odo Re.

C:
Hallelujah, Hallelujah,
Glory be to God on high;
Hallelujah to the Saviour,
Who has gain'd the victory,
Hallelujah to the Spirit,
Fount of love and sanctity;
Hallelujah , Hallelujah
To the Triune Majesty.
Amen

D:
B’ elese s’ owo po
Ti won nde s’ Oluwa
Dimo si Kristi Re
Lati gan Oba na
B’ aiye sata pelu Esu
Eke ni won, nwon nse lasan

C:
Oh our Saviour Reigneth!
On high mount of Zion,
The Lord’s greater command
Upholdeth His own child;
He resurrected from the grave.
Ascended to bring Salvation
D:
Olugbala joba
Lori oke Sion;
Ase ti Oluwa,
Gbe Omo Tire ro:
Lati ‘boji O ni k’ O nde
K’ O si goke K’ O gba ni la

C:
Worship the Lord in fear,
Obey all His commandment;
Come in jubilation
Be steadfast with the Lord,
Kneel and bow for our King alone
Tell of His might to every soul
D:
F’ eru sin Oluwa
Si bowo f’ ase Re
F’ ayo wa s’odo Re
F’ iwariri duro
E kunle fun. K’ e teriba
So t’ ipa Re Ki Omo na !.

C:
Low in the grave He lay, Jesus my Saviour,                           
Waiting the coming day, Jesus, my Lord!
chorus:Up from the grave He arose;
With a mighty triumph o'er His foes;
He arose a Victor from the dark Domain,
And He lives forever, with His saints to reign.
He arose! He arose!                                                                    
Hallelujah! Christ arose!
D:
O sun n’ isa-oku- Olugbala mi,
Titi ojo keta, Oluwa mi.
O jinde! Lat’ iboji,
Pelu ariwo isegun nla,
O jinde! Asegun lat’ iku s’ iye,
Lati joba pelu awon mimo Re;
O jinde! O jinde Halleluya!
Krist’ jinde.

C:
Vainly they watch His bed,
Jesus my Saviour,
Vainly they seal the dead,                                                    
Jesus my Lord!                                                                           
Chorus: Up from the grave He arose etc.
D:
Lasan li a gbe sin, Olugbala mi,
Lasan l’ a so ‘boji, Oluwa mi.

C:
Death cannot keep his prey,
Jesus my Saviour!
He tore the bars away,                                                       
Jesus my Lord!                                                                         
Chorus: Up from the grave He arose etc.
D:
Iku ko n’ ipa mo – Olugbala mi,
O fa ide won ja – Oluwa mi. Amin

C:
Jesus, stand among us
In Thy risen power,
Let this time of worship
Be a hallowed hour.
D:
Jesu wa s‘aarin wa,
L‘ agbar‘ ajinde,
Je k‘ isin wa nihin
Je isin owo.

C:
Breathe Thy Holy Spirit
Into every heart:
Bid the fears and sorrows
From each soul depart.
D:
Mi Emi Mimo Re
S’ inu okan wa,
Mu ‘foiya at‘ aro
Kuro l’ okan wa.

C:
Thus with quickened footsteps
We'll pursue our way:
Watching for the dawning
Of eternal day.
Amen.
D:
Bi a ti nyara lo,
L‘ ona ajo wa,
K‘ a ma s’ ona f‘ ooro
T‘ oj’ aiyeraiye.’’
AMIN

C:
This is the day of light:
Let there be light to-day;
O Day spring, rise upon our night
And chase its gloom away.

This is the day of rest:
Our failing strength renew;
On weary brain and troubled breast
Shed thou Thy freshening dew.
D:
Ojo simi l’ eyi:
S’ agbara wa d’ otun;
S’ ori aibale aiya wa,
Se ‘ri itura Re.

C:
This is the day of peace:
Thy peace our spirits fill;
Bid Thou the blasts of discord cease,
The waves of strife be still.
D:
Ojo Alafia:
F’ Alafia fun wa;
Da iyapa gbogbo duro,
Si mu ija kuro.

C:
This is the day of prayer:
Let earth to heaven draw near!
Lift up our hearts to seek Thee there;
Come down to meet us here.

This is the first of days:
Send forth Thy quickening breath
And wake dead souls to love and praise,
O Vanquisher of death.
D:
Oba ojo l’ eyi:
Fun wa ni isoji;
Ji oku okan wa s’ ife,
‘Wo asegun iku. Amin.

C:
Welcome, sweet day of rest
That saw the Lord arise;
Welcome to this reviving breast,
And these rejoicing eyes.
D:
K’ abo! Ojo ‘simi,
T’ oo r’ ajinde Jesu;
Ma bow a m’ okan yi soji
Si mu inu mi dun.

C:
The king Himself comes near,
And feast His saints to-day,
Here we may seek, and see Him here;
And love, and praise and pray.
D:
Oba tikare wa
Bo Ijo Re loni;
Nihinyi l’ a wa t’ a si ri
A nyin, a ngbadura.

C:
One day of prayer and praise
His sacred courts within,
Is sweeter than ten thousand days
Of pleasurable sin.
D:
Ojo kan f’ adura
N’ nu ile mimo Re,
O san j’ egberun ojo lo
T’ a lo f’ adun ese.

C:
My willing soul would stay
In such a frame as this;
And was to hail the brighter day
Of everlasting bliss.
Amen.
D:
Okan mi y’o f’ ayo
Wa n’ iru ipo yi;
Y’ osi ma duro de ojo
Ibukun ailopin. Amin

C:
Pleasant are Thy courts above,                                                           
In the land of light and love;                                             
Pleasant are Thy courts below,                                               
In this land of sin and woe.                                                         
Oh, my spirit longs and faints                                                        
For the converse of Thy saints,                                                  
For the brightness of Thy face,                                          
For Thy fullness, God of grace.
D:
‘Bugbe Re ti l’ ewa to!
N’ ile ‘mole at’ ife;
Bugbe Re ti l’ ewa to!
L’ aiye ese at’ osi;
Okan mi nfa nitoto
Fun idapo enia Re,
Fun imole oju Re,
Fun ekun Re, Olorun.

C:
Happy birds that sing and fly
Round Thy altars, O most High;
Happier souls that find a rest
In a heavenly Father's breast.
Like the wandering dove that found
No repose on earth around,
They can to their ark repair
And enjoy it ever there.
D:
Ayo baa won eleye,
Ti nfo yi pepe re ka;
Ayo okan t’ o simi
L’ aiya Baba l’ o poju!
Gege b’ adaba Noa,
Ti ko r’ ibi ‘simi le,
Nwon pada sodo Baba
Nwon si nyo titi aiye.

C:
Happy souls! Their praises flow
Even in this vale of woe;
Waters in the desert rise,
Manna feeds them from the skies:
On they go from strength to strength
Till they reach Thy throne at length,
At Thy feet adoring fall,
Who hast led them safe through all.

Lord of the worlds above,
How pleasant and how fair
The dwellings of thy love,
Thine earthly temples, are:
To thine abode
My heart aspires,
With warm desires
To see my God.
D:
Oluwa wa orun!
Ago Re l’ aiye yi,
Ibugbe ife Re,
Ewa Re tip o to!
Okan mi nfa
Lati goke
S’ ibugbe Re,
Olorun mi

C:
O happy souls that pray
where God delights to hear!
O happy men that pay
Their constant service there!
They praise thee still;
And happy they
that love the way
To Zion's hill.
D:
Ayo b’ awon ti nsin,
Nibit’ Olorun yan;
Ti nwon npara ibe,
Lati maa josin won;
Nwon nyin O – sa:
Ayo b’ awon
T’ o fe ona
Oke Sion.

C:
They go from strength to strength,
Through this dark vale of tears,
Till each arrives at length,
Till each in heaven appears:
O glorious seat!
When God, our King,
Shall thither bring
Our willing feet!
God is our sun and shield,
D:
Lati ipa de ‘pa
Laiye osi wa yi:
Titi won fi goke,
Ti nwon fi yo s’ orun:
‘Bugbe ogo!
‘Gbat’ Olorun
Ba m’ ese wa
De ibe na.

C:
Our light and our shield
With gifts his hands are filled;
We draw our blessings thence.
He shall bestow
Upon our race
His saving grace
And glory too.
D:
Olorun l’ asa wa,
Imole at’ odi;
Owo re kun f’ ebun,
A ngba ‘bukun nibe:
Ayo pupo
Ni fun awon
T’ gbekele
Olorun Wa.

C:
The Lord His people loves;
His hand no good withholds
From those His heart approves,
From holy, humble souls
Thrice happy be,
O lord of Hosts,
Whose spirit trusts
Alone in Thee1.  Amen
D:
Olorun l’ asa wa,
Imole at’ odi;
Owo re kun f’ ebun,
A ngba ‘bukun nibe:
Ayo pupo
Ni fun awon
T’ gbekele
Olorun Wa. Amin

C:
What are those Sabbaths of joy without end,
Angels in light and the glorified spend?
Rest for the weary; for victors reward;
There God Himself all and in all adored?
D:
Kini ‘simi ayo ailopin
T’ awon angel at’ awon mimo ni?
‘Simi f’ alare; f’ awon asegun,
Nibe l’ Olorun je ohun gbogbo,

C:
Who is the Monarch? Who circle His throne?
What is the calm restful bliss of His own?
Tell us, ye blessed ones worshipping there,
Tell us, if words can your rapture declare
D:
‘Tal’ Oba na! Tani yi ‘te Re ka?
Irora itura Re ha ti ri?
So funni, enyin ti njosin n’ ibe:
So funni, b’ oro to t’ ayo nyin so.

C:
Oh true Jerusalem, city most bright,
Whose perfect peace is eternal delight:
Longings in thee are fulfill'd ere express'd;
More than was long'd for embraced and possess
D:
Jerusalem toot, ilu mimo,
Alafia eyi t’ o je kik’ ayo;
A r’ ohun t’a nfe n’nu re k’a to wi,
A si ri gba ju eyi t’ a nfe lo.

C:
Troubles all past, in the courts of our King
We without fear Zion's anthems shall sing
Off'ring Thee, Lord, in Thy presence above
Love's pure responses for gifts of Thy love
D:
L’ agbala Oba wa, wahala tan,
Lai beru l’ ao ma ko ‘rin Sion;
Oluwa, niwaju Re l’ a o ma fi
Idahun ‘fe han f’ ebun ife Re.

C:
There never Sabbath to Sabbath gives place;
One is their Sabbath who gaze on Thy face.
There never cease heaven's jubilee songs,
Chanted by saints and sweet angel tongues
D:
‘Simi ko le tele ‘simi nibe;
Enikan ni ‘simi ti nwoju Re,
Nibe orin jubeli ko le tan,
T’ awon mimo at’ angeli y’o ko

C:
Meantime in heart and with faith-winged prayers
Seek we our Fatherland yonder and theirs;
While to Jerusalem bounden we roam,
Exiles returning from Babylon home
D:
L’ aiye yi, pelu gbagbo at’ adua,
L’ a o ma saferi ‘le Baba ohun;
Si Salem l’ awon ti a si nipo
Npada lo; lat’ ilu Babiloni.

C:
Now before Him we adoringly fall,
Of whom and through whom and in whom are all;
Of whom the Father, and through whom the Son,
In whom the Spirit of Both, ever One
D:
Nje awa teriba niwaju Re,
T’ Enit ohun gbogbo ja si;
Ninu Eniti Baba at’ Omo,
T’ Eniti Emi je Okanso lai.  Amin

C:
I know that my Redeemer lives;                                  
On the sweet joy this sentence gives!                                
He lives, He lives, who once was dead:                            
He lives, my everlasting Head.
D:
Mo mo p’Oludande mi mbe
Itunu nla l’ eyi fun mi !
O mbe, Eni t’ O ku l’ekan
O mbe, Ori iye mi lai.

C:
He lives to bless me with His love,                               
And still He pleads for me above;                                     
He lives to raise me from the grave,                                
And me eternally to save.
D:
O mbe lati ma bukun mi
O si mbebe fun mi l’ oke
O mbe lati ji mi n’ boji
Lati gba mi la titi lai.

C:
He lives, my kind, wise, constant Friend;                       
Who still will keep me to the end;                                    
He lives and while He lives I'II sing,                                
Jesus, my Prophet, Priest and King.
D:
O mbe, Ore korikosun
Ti y’ o pa mi mo de opin
O mbe, emi o ma ko ’rin
Woli, Alufa, Oba mi

C:
He lives my mansion to prepare,                                     
And He will bring me safely there                                    
He lives, all glory to His name,                                        
Jesus, unchangeably the same.
D:
O mbe lati pese aye
Y’ o si mu mi de be l’ayo
O mbe, ogo l’ oruko Re
Jesu okanna titi lai.

C:
Thy golden gates are lifted up,
The doors are opened wide;
The king of Glory is gone in
Unto His Father's side.
D:
A gbe ilekun wura ro,
A si si won paya;
Oba Ogo si ti wole
Lo s’odo Baba Re.

C:
Thou art gone up before us, Lord,
To make for us a place,
That we may be where now Thou art,
And see Thee face to face.
D:
Oluwa ‘Wo ti saju lo
Pese aye fun wa,
Ki a ba le wa l’odo Re
Lati w’oj’ Olorun.

C:
And ever on our earthly path
A gleam of glory lies;
A light still breaks behind the cloud
That veiled Thee from our eyes.
D:
Imole t’ o l’ogo ntan lai
Li ona aiye wa;
Imole t’ o tan s’okunkun
Ti ko je k’ a ri O.

C:
Lift up our hearts, lift up our minds;
Let Thy dear grace be given,
That, while we wander here below,
Our treasure be in Heaven.
D:
Jowo gbe okan wa s’ oke;
F’ ore-ofe fun wa,
B’ a ti nri kiri l’ aiye yi,
K’ a ni ‘sura l’ orun.

C:
That where Thou art, at God's right hand
Our hope, our love may be
Dwell Thou in us, that we may dwell
For evermore in Thee.
Amen.
D:
Ki  ireti at’ ife wa
Le wa li odo Re,
Maa gbe ‘nu wa ki a le wa
Ninu Re tit lai. Amin.

C:
See the conqueror mounts in triumph,
See the king in royal state,
Riding on the cloud His chariot,
To the heavenly palace gate;
Hark, the choirs of angel voices
Joyful Hallelujahs sing,
And the portals high are lifted,
To receive, their heavenly king.
D:
Wo asegun b’ O ti goke,
Wo oba n’nu ola Re;
O gun keke ofurufu,
Lo s’ orun agbala Re;
Gbo orin awon Angeli,
Halleluyah ni nwon nko,
Awon ‘lekun si si sile,
Lati gba Oba orun.

C:
Who is this that comes in glory?
With the trump of jubilee?
Lord of battles, God of armies,
He has gain'd the victory;
He who on the cross did suffer,
He who from the grave arose,
He has vanquish'd sin and Satan,
He by death has spoil'd His foes.
D:
Tani Ologo ti mbo yi,
T’ On ti ipe Jubeli?
Oluwa awon ‘mo-ogun,
On to ti segun fun wa,
On jiya lor’ agbelebu,
O jinde ninu oku,
O segun esu at’ ese,
Ati gbogbo ota Re.

C:
While He raised His hands in blessing,
He was parted from His friends,
While their eager eyes behold Him,
He upon the clouds ascends;
He who walk'd with God and pleased Him,
Preaching truth and doom to come,
He, our Enoch, is translate
To His everlasting home.
D:
B’ o ti mbuk’ awon ore Re,
A gba kuro lowo won;
Bi oju won si ti nwo lo.
O nu nin’ awosanma:
Enit’ o ba Olorun rin,
T’ o si nwasu otito,
On, Enoku wa, l’ a gbe lo
S’ ile Re l’ oke orun.

C:
Now our heavenly Aaron enters,
With His blood within the veil;
Joshua now is come to Canaan,
And the kings before Him quail:
Now He plants the tribes of Israel
In their promised resting-place;
Now our great Elijah offers
Double portion of His grace.
D:
On, Aaron wa, gbe eje Re
Wo inu ikele lo,
Joshua wa, ti wo kennan,
Awon Oba nwariri;
A fi ‘di eya Israel
Mule nibi ‘simi won;
Elijah wa si fe fun wa
N’ ilopo meji Emi.

Iwo ti gbe  ara wa wo
Lo s’ ow’ otun Olorun,
A si joko nibi giga;
Pelu Re ninu ogo:
Awon Angeli mbo Jesu,
Enia joko lor’ ite,
Oluwa, b’ Iwo ti goke,
Jo, je k’ a le goke be. Amin

C:
HAIL the day that sees Him rise,
Hallelujah!
Ravish’d from our wistful eyes!
Hallelujah!
Christ, awhile to mortals given,
Hallelujah!
Re-ascends His native heaven.
Hallelujah!
D:
Alafia f’ ojo na  Aleluya!
T‘ o pada s‘ite l’ orun  Aleluya
Od’ aguntan elese, -Aleluya
Goke orun giga lo -Aleluya

C:
There the glorious triumph waits
Hallelujah!
Lift your heads, eternal gates;
Hallelujah!
Wide unfold the radiant scene;
Hallelujah!
Take the king of Glory in
Hallelujah!
D:
Iyin nduro de nibe Aleluya
Gb‘ ori nyin entin, ‘lekun  Aleluya
Gba Oba Ogo s’ile Aleluya
Enit’ o segun iku  Aleluya

C:
Him though highest heaven receives,
Hallelujah!
Still He loves the earth He leaves;
Hallelujah!
Though returning to His throne
Hallelujah!
Still He calls mankind His own
Hallelujah!
D:
Orun, gba Oluwa re - Aleluya
Sibe On feran aiye - Aleluya
B’ o ti pada s‘ ori ‘te - Aleluya
O np’ eda ni t’ On sibe - Aleluya

C:
See! He lifts His hands above;
Hallelujah!
See! He shows the prints of love;
Hallelujah!
Hark! His gracious lips bestow
Hallelujah!
Blessings on His church below.
Hallelujah!
D:
Wo, O gb’ owo Re so’ke - Aleluya
Wo O f apa ife han - Aleluya
Gbo, bi O ti nsure fun - Aleluya
Ijo Re l‘ aiye nihin - Aleluya

C:
Still for us His death He pleads;
Hallelujah!
Prevalent He intercedes;
Hallelujah!
Near Himself prepares our place,
Hallelujah!.
Harbinger of human race.
Hallelujah!
D:
Sibe O mbebe fun wa - Aleluya
Iku Re l’ O fi mbebe - Aleluya
O npese aye fun wa - Aleluya
On l‘ Akobi iran wa - Aleluya

C:
Lord, though parted from our sight,
Hallelujah!
High above you azure height,
Hallelujah!
Grant our hearts may thither rise,
Hallelujah!
Following Thee beyond the skies.
Hallelujah!
D:
Oluwa b’ ati gba O,- Aleluya
jina kuro lodo wa - Aleluya
m’ okan wa lo sibe na - Aleluya
k’ a wa O l’ oke orun - Aleluya

C:
Thou art gone up on high
To mansions in the skies,
And round Thy throne unceasingly
The songs of praise arise:
But we are lingering here,
With sin and care oppressed;
Lord, send Thy promised Comforter
And lead us to our rest.
D:
Iwo ti g’oke lo
S‘ ile ayo orun
Lojojumo y‘ ite Re ka
L‘ a ngbo orin iyin;
Sugbon awa nduro
L’ abe eru ese
Jo ran Olutunu Re wa,
K’O si mu wa lo ‘le

C:
Thou art gone up on high;
But Thou didst first came down,
Through earth's most bitter agony
To pass unto Thy crown:
And girt with grief's and fears
Our onward course must be;
But only let that path of tears
Leads us at last to Thee.
D:
Iwo ti g’oke lo;
Sugbon s’aju eyi,
O koja ‘rora kikoro
Ko to le de ade;
Larin ibanuje
L‘ao ma te siwaju
K‘ ona wa to kun f‘ omije
To wa si odo Re

C:
Thou art gone up on high;
But Thou shalt come again,
With all the bright ones of the sky
Attendant in Thy train.
O by Thy saving power
So make us live and die
That we may stand, in that dread hour,
At Thy right hand on high.
Amen.
D:
Iwo ti goke lo
Iwo O tun pada;
Awon egbe mimo l’ oke
Ni y’ o ba O pada
Nipa agbara Re,
K‘ a wa, k‘ a ku n‘nu Re,
Gbat‘ a ba ji l’ ojo ‘anu
Fi wa si otun Re.
Amin

O ti lo, Awosanmo
Ti gba kuro loju wa
S’oke orun, nibiti
Oju wa ko le tele;
O ti kuro l‘ aiye yi,
O ti de ibi mimo,
Laala ati ‘rora tan,
Ija tan, O si segun.

C:
He is gone. And we remain
In this world of sin and pain:
In the void which He has left
On this earth, of Him bereft,
We have still His work to do,
We can still His path pursue,
Seek Him both in friend and foe,
In ourselves His image show.
D:
O ti lo, awa si wa
L‘ aiye ese at‘  iku,
A ni ‘se lati se fun u
L‘ aiye t’ O ti fi sile
K’ a si tele ona Re;
K’ a tele t’ okantokan,
K’ a s‘ ota Re di ore,
K’ a fi Krist‘ han n‘iwa wa.

C:
He is gone. We heard Him say
"Good that I should go away"Gone is that dear form and face,
But not gone His present grace;
Though Himself no more we see,
Comfortless we cannot be:
No, His Spirit still is ours,
Quickening, freshening all our powers.
D:
O ti lo, On ti wipe,
“O dara ki Emi lo”
Ni ara sa l’ o ya wa,
Sugbon or‘ ofe Re wa,
On ni awa ko ri mo
A ni olutunu Re;
Emi Re si je tiwa,
O ns‘ agbara wa d‘otun.

C:
He is gone. Towards the goal
World and church must onward roll:
Far behind we leave the past;
Forward are our glances cast:
Still His words before us range
Through the ages, as they change;
Wheresoe'er the truth shall lead,
He will give whate'er we need.
D:
O ti lo, l‘ona kanna
Lo ye k‘Ijo Re ma LO
Ka gbagbe ohun ehin
Kasi mate siwaju,
Oro Re ni ‘mole wa
Titi de opin aye
Nibiti oto Re wa
Yo pese fun aini wa.

C:
He is gone. But we once more
Shall behold Him as before;
In the heaven of heavens the same,
As on earth He went and came.
In the many mansions there,
Place for us He will prepare:
In that world unseen, unknown,
He and we may yet be one.

He is gone. But not in vain
Wait until He comes again:
He is risen, He is not here,
Far above this earthly sphere;
Evermore in heart and mind
Where our peace in Him we find,
To our own eternal Friend,
Thither ward let us ascend.
Amen.
D:
O ti lo fun ire wa,
E je ki a duro de E
O jinde ko si nihin,
Oti goke re orun,
Je ka gb‘ okan wa s’oke
S’ibiti Jesu ti lo,
Si odo Olorun wa.
Nibe l‘ alafia wa.
Amin.

C:
My heart is open to Thee, dear Lord,
Come in, Come in,
My faith is clinging to Thy dear word,
Come in, Come in:
Come not to tarry, but stay, dear Lord,
All shall be Thine love can afford
Here in my heart ever make Thine abode
Come in, Come in.
D:
Okan mi sipaya, Oluwa,
Wole, Wole,
Igbagbo mi ro mo oro Re
Wole, Wole.
Ma ba mi gbe titi Oluwa,
Ohun ti O fe ni ngo fe
Fi okan mi se ‘bugbe Re lailai
Wole, Wole.

Beni aye mbe fun Oluwa
Wole, Wole,
Dide Re mu mi sunmo O si
Wole, Wole.

C:
I kept Thee standing outside so long,
Come in, Come in,
I pray Thee pardon this shameful wrong
Come in, Come in.
D:
Mo da O duro s‘ode pe ju
Wole, Wole,
Dari eyi ji mi Oluwa
Wole, Wole.

C:
I hear Thee knocking at my heart's door.
Come in, Come in,
I'll keep Thee waiting outside no more
Come in, Come in.
Amen.
D:
Mo gbo, O nkan ‘lekun, Oluwa
Wole, Wole
Nko ni da O duro s‘ode mo
Wole, Wole.
Amin.

C:
When the pow'r of God descended
On the day of Pentecost,
All the days of waiting ended,
They received the Holy Ghost.
O Lord, send the pow'r just now,
O Lord, send the pow'r just now,
O Lord, send the pow'r just now,
And baptize, every one.
D:
Gbat' agbara Olorun de
Li ojo Pentikosti
Sa if ojusona pari
‘Tori nwon ri Emi gba
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ki O si baptis’ wa

C:
Tongues of flame came down upon them,
And they preached the word in pow'r,
Listening multitudes awakened
Turn’d to God that very hour.
D:
Ela 'han ina be le won
Nwon si wasu oro na
Opolopo enia gbagbo
Nwon yi pada s' Olorun

C:
We are waiting Holy Spirit
We are all of one accord,
Lord fulfil just now the promise
That is given in Thy Word
D:
A nw’ ona fun Emi Mimo
Gbogbo wa f' ohun s’okan
Mu 'leri na se, Oluwa
Ti a se nin' oro Re

C:
Fill and thrill us with Thy presence,
Grant the blessing that we need
Flood our souls with wondrous glory,
While the pray'r of faith we plead.
Amen.
D:
Jo fi agbara Re kun wa
Fun wa ni 'bukun t'a nfe
Fi ogo Re kun oka wa
B'a ti nfi ‘gbagbo bebe
Ran agbara Oluwa.

C:
Our blest Redeemer, ere He breathed
His tender last farewell,
A Guide, a Comforter bequeathed
With us to dwell.
D:
Olurapada wa, k’ On to
Da gbere ikehin,
O fi Olutunu fun ni,
Ti mba wa  gbe.

C:
he came in semblance of a dove,
With sheltering wings outspread
The holy balm of peace and love
On earth to shed
D:
O wa ni awo adaba
O ni iye bo wa;
O tan ‘fe on alafia
Sori aiye.

C:
He came sweet influence to impart,
A gracious, willing Guest,
While He can find one humble heart
Wherein to rest.
D:
O de. O mu ‘wa rere wa,
Alejo olore;
Gbat’ o ba r’okan irele
Lati ma gbe

C:
And His that gentle voice we hear,
Soft as the breath of even,
That checks each thought, that calms each fear,
And speaks of heaven.
D:
Tire l’ohun jeje t’a ngbo,
Ohun kelekele;
Ti nbaniwi, ti nl’eru lo,
Ti nso t’orun.

C:
And every virtue we possess,
And every victory won,
And every thought of holiness,
Are His alone.
D:
Gbogbo iwa-rere t’ a nhu,
Gbogbo isegun wa;
Gbogbo iwa-mimo
Tire ni nwon.

C:
Spirit of purity and grace,
Our weakness, pitying, see:
O make our hearts Thy dwelling place,
And worthier Thee.
Amen.
D:
Emi Mimo olutunu,
F’ iyonu be wa wo;
Jo s’okan wa n’ ibugbe Re,
K’ oye fun o.  Amin.

C:
Come, gracious Spirit, heavenly Dove
With light and comfort from above;
Be Thou our Guardian, Thou our Guide,
O'er every thought and step preside.
D:
Emi Mimo ‘Daba orun,
Wa mu itunu sokale;
Se Oga at‘ Oluto wa,
Ma pelu gbogbo ero wa.

C:
The light of truth to us display,
And make us know and love Thy way;
Plant holy fear in every heart,
That we from God may ne'er depart.
D:
Jo fi otito Re han wa,
K’ a le fe, k’a si m‘ ona Re,
Gbin ife toto s‘ okan wa,
K’ a ma le pada lehin Re.

C:
Lead us to Christ, the Living Way,
Nor let us from His pastures stray;
Lead us to holiness, the road,
That we must take to dwell with God.
D:
Mu wa k’ a to ona mimo;
T’ a le gba d‘ odo Olorun:
Mu wa to Krist‘ Ona Iye,
M aje ki awa sina lo.

C:
Lead us to heaven, its bliss to share
Fullness of joy for ever there;
Lead us to God, our final rest,
To be with Him for ever bless’d.
Amen.
D:
Mu wa t‘ Olorun ‘simi wa,
K’ a le ma ba gbe titi lai;
To wa s‘ orun, k’ a le n‘ ipin
L‘ owo otun Olorun wa.
Amin.

C:
Heavenly father we assemble
We are Thy helpless children
Fill us with Thy Holy Spirit
And revive us with Thy power;
Come to us oh Holy Spirit
Fill our heart with Thy new power,
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day.
D:
Baba wa orun, awa de,
Awa alailagbara
Fi emi mimo re kun wa,
K’ o so gbogbo d’ otun.
Wa! Emi Mimo jare wa!
f’ ede titun s’ okan wa.
Ebun nla Re ni l’ a ntoro,
T’ ojo nla pentikosti.

C:
Remember thy promise Jesus
Pour Thy Spirit on us all
Give to us the coveted peace
Which all the world cannot give
Come to us Oh Holy Spirit
Take away sins from our hearts
Thy great   gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day.
D:
Ranti ileri Re, Jesu
Tu Emi Re s’ ara wa;
Fi Alafia Re fun wa,
T’ aiye ko le fi fun ni.
Wa! Emi Mimo,jare wa!
Pa ese run l’ okan wa.
Ebu nla re ni l’ ntoro.
T’ojo nla pentikosti

C:
Heav’nly Dove come down upon us
Fill us with thy mighty power
That the whole nation of the earth
May honour Jesus Our Lord,
Let thy name spread through the corners
Of this our very dark world
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day. Amen
D:
Adaba orun! Ba le wa,
Fun agbara Re fun wa;
Ki gbogbo orile ede
Teriba f’Olugbala.
K’ a gburo Re jake jado
Ile okunkun wa yi,
Ebun nla Re ni l’ atoro,
T’ ojo nla pentikosti

C:
Spirit divine, attend our prayers,
and make this house thy home;
descend with all thy gracious powers,
O come, great Spirit, come!
D:
Emi orun, gb’ adura wa,
Wa gbe ‘nu ile yi
Sokale pel' agbara Re,
Wa, Emi Mimo wa.

C:
Come as the light; to us reveal
our emptiness and woe,
and lead us in those paths of life
whereon the righteous go.
D:
Wa bi ‘mole, si fihan wa
B’ aini wa ti po to;
Wa, to wa si ona iye,
Ti olododo nrin.

C:
Come as the fire and purge our hearts
like sacrificial flame;
let our whole soul an offering be
to our Redeemer's Name.
D:
Wa bi ina ebo mimo:
S’ okan wa di mimo;
Je ki okan wa je ore,
F’ oruko Oluwa.

C:
Come as the dove, and spread thy wings,
the wings of peaceful love;
and let thy Church on earth become
blest as the Church above.
D:
Wa bi iri, si wa bukun
Akoko mimo yi:
Ki okan alaileso wa
Le yo l' agbara Re.

C:
Come as the dew and sweetly bless
this consecrated hour;
may barrenness rejoice to own
thy fertilizing power.
D:
Wa bi adaba, n' apa Re,
Apa ife mimo;
Wa je ki ijo Re l’aiye
Dabi ijo t’ orun.

Emi orun, gb’ adura wa,
S a’iye yi d’ ile Re;
Sokale pel' agbara Re,
Wa, Emi Mimo wa.

C:
There's a stranger at the door,
Let Him in;
He has been there oft before,
Let Him in;
Let Him in, ere He is gone,
Let Him in, the Holy One,
Jesus Christ the Father's son
Let Him in.

D:
Si okan re paya fun,
Pe wole
B‘ o ba pe y‘o pada lo,
Pe wole
Pe wole, Ore re ni;
Y’o dabobo okan re,
Y’o pa o mo de opin;
Pe wole.

C:
Hear you now His loving voice?
Let Him in;
Now, oh, now make Him your
choice,
Let Him in;
He is standing at your door,
Joy to you He will restore,
And His name you will adore,
Let Him in.
D:
O ko ha gbo ohun Re?
Pe wole
Se l‘ ayanfe re loni,
Pe wole,
O duro lehin ‘lekun
Yio fun o li ayo
‘Wo o yin oruko Re
Pe wole

C:
Now admit the heavenly Guest,
Let Him in;
He will make for you a feast,
Let Him in;
He will speak your sins forgiven,
And when earth ties all are riven,
He will take you home to heaven,
Let Him in.
Amen.
D:
Pe alejo na wole,
Pe wole
Yio se ase fun o
Pe wole
Y‘ o dari ese ji o
‘Gbati ipinya ba de,
Y‘ o mu o de ‘le orun,
Pe wole.
Amin.

C:
Come holy ghost descend from high
Baptizer of our spirits Thou,
The sacramental seal apply,
And witness with the water now.
D:
Wa Emi Mimo sokale
Onibaptisi okan wa;
M‘edidi majemu Re wa,
K‘O si se eri omi yi.

C:
Pour faith thy energy divine
And sprinkle the atoning blood,
May Father, Son and Spirit join
To seal this child, a child of God.
Amen.
D:
Tu agbara nla Re jade,
K‘o si won eje etutu;
Ki Baba, Omo at‘Emi,
Jo so won d‘omo Olorun.
Amin

C:
O Spirit of the living God,
In all Thy plenitude of grace,
Where'er the foot of man hath trod,
Descend on our apostate race.
D:
Emi Olorun alaye
N’nu ekun ore-ofe Re
Nibit’ ese enia tit e
Sokale sori iran wa

C:
Give tongue of fire and hearts of love,
To preach the reconciling word:
Give power and unction from above
Whene'er the joyful sound is heard.
D:
F’ ebun ahon okan ife
Fun wa lati soro ‘fe Re
K’ ibukun at’ agbara Re
Ba l’ awon t’o ngbo oro na

K’ okun kase ni bibo Re
Ki darudapo di tito
F’ ilera f’ okan ailera
Je ki anu bori ‘binu

C:
O spirit of the Lord, prepare
All the round earth her God to meet;
Breathe Thou abroad, like morning air,
Till hearts of stone begin to beat.
D:
Emi Olorun jo pese
Gbogbo aiye fun Oluwa
Mi si won b’ afefe oro
K’ okan okuta le soji

C:
Baptize the nations; far and nigh
The triumphs of the cross record;
The name of Jesus glorify,
Till every kindred call Him Lord.
Amen.
D:
Baptis’ gbogb’ orile ede
Rohin ‘segun Jesu yika
Yin oruko Jesu logo
Tit’ araiye yio jewo Re

C:
Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave;
Weep o’er the erring one, lift up the fallen,
Tell them of Jesus, the mighty to save.
Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Jesus is merciful, Jesus will save.
D:
Yo awon ti n segbe, s’ajo eni n ku
F’anu ja won kuro ninu ese
Ke f’awon ti n sina, gb’eni n subu ro
So fun won pe Jesu le gba won la
Yo awon ti n segbe, sajo eni n ku
Alaanu ni Jesu, Yio gbala.

Bi won o tile gan An, sibe O n duro
Lati gb'omo to ronupiwada
Sa fitara ro won, si ro won jeje
On o dariji, bi won ba gbagbo

Yo awon ti n segbe,--ise tire ni
Oluwa yio f'agbara fun o;
Fi suuru ro won, pada sona tooro
So fasako p'Olugbala ti ku.

C:
Rejoice Jesus Reigneth
Amongst The Sons Of Men,
He Doned All The Prisoners,
And Set Them Free For Aye;
If Satan Stands ’gainst Son OfGod,
Still His Work Goes On Unhindered.
D:
E yo jesu joba
‘Nu omo enia,
O da ara tubu
O so won d’ ominira:
K’ esu koju s’ Om’Olorun.
Lai f’ ota pe, ise Re nlo

C:
Mission Of Righteousness,
Justice And Peace Combined,
For Life, To Make Easy,
Shall Spread Over The Earth,
All Pagans, Jews Shall Bow Their Heads:
And Confess His Holy Worship
D:
Ise ti ododo
Ooto, alafia
Fun ‘rorun aiye wa,
Yio tan ka kiri,
Keferi, Ju, nwon o wole.
Nwon o jeje isin yiye.

C:
The Power At His Command,
For His Own Be Preserved;
His High Authority,
Will Many Pay Respect:
The Joyful Heavens Note His Works,
Distant Islands Obey His Laws.

This Heavenly Seedlings
Shall Form A Mighty Tree,
As All The Blessed Bread;
Were Made To Feed Mankind
Until Son Of God Shall Come Back;
We Will Wait Proclaiming The News.
Amen!

Arm of the Lord! awake, awake!
Put on Thy strength, the nations shake:
And let the world, adoring, see
Triumphs of mercy wrought by Thee.
D:
Ji, apa Olorun, k’ o ji,
Gbe ‘pa Re wo, mi orile
Ni sisin Re, je k‘ aiye ri
Isegun ise anu Re.

C:
Say to the heathen, from Thy Throne,
"I am Jehovah, God alone!"Thy voice their idols shall confound,
And cast their altars to the ground.
D:
T‘ ite Re wi fun keferi,
“Emi Jehofa Olorun”
Ohun Re y’ o d‘ ere won ru,
Yio wo pepe won lule.

C:
Let Zion's time of favour come;
Oh, bring the tribes of Israel home:
And let our wondering eyes behold
Gentiles and Jews in Jesus' fold!
D:
Ki ‘gb‘oju rere Sion‘ de,
K’ a m‘ eya Israel‘ wa ‘le;
N‘iyanu k’ a f’ oju wa ri
Keferi, Ju, l‘ agbo Jesu.

C:
Almighty God! Thy grace proclaim
In every clime, of every name;
Let adverse powers before Thee fall,
And crown the Saviour Lord of all.
Amen.
D:
Olugbala lo ‘fe Re
Lor’ oruko ile gbogbo;
Ki gbogb‘ ota wole fun O
Ki nwon gba Jesu l‘ Oluwa.
Amin.

C:
Work on and never be weary
Do thy father’s duty in faith
So Jesus did while on this earth,
Should we not emulate our Christ?
D:
Ma sise lo, mase s’aare,
Fi ayo sise Baba re,
Bayi ni Jesu se l‘ aiye:
Ko ha ye k‘ awa ko se be?

C:
Work on and do it everyday
The world’s darkness shall soon come in,
Work on and avoid indolence,
That he may save Thy soul at last.
D:
Ma sise lo, lojojumo,
Okunkun aiye fere de;
Mura si ‘se, mase s‘ ole,
K’o ba le gba okan re la.

C:
Many are those that remaineth
Who do not have heavenly hope;
Light on the light of the Gospel,
Sink it not in the world’s darkness.
D:
Pupo, pupo l‘ awon t’ o ku,
Ti won ko n‘ ireti orun,
Gbe ina ‘gbagbo re, maa fi;
Ma fi si okunkun aiye.

C:
Work on and be joyous in it
After the labour comes the rest
Soon the voice of jesus you’ll hear
That would declare “I have arrived”
Amen .

Art thou weary, art thou languid?
Art thou sore distressed?
‘Come to Me, saith One; and coming,
Be at rest!”
D:
Aare mu o, aiye su o,
Lala po fun o?
Jesu ni “Wa si odo Mi,
Ko simi”

C:
Hath He marks to lead me to Him,
If He be my guide?
“In His feet and hands are wound prints,
And His side.
D:
Ami wo l‘emi o fi mo
Pe On lo npe mi?
Am‘iso wa lowo ati
Ese Re.

C:
Is there diadem as Monarch
That His brow adorns?
“Yea, a crown in very surety,
But of thorns.
D:
O ha ni ade bi Oba
Ti mo le fi mo?
Tooto, ade wa l‘ori Re,
T‘ egun ni.

C:
If I find Him, if I follow,
What His guerdon here?
Many a sorrow, many a labour,
Many a tear”.
D:
Bi mo ba ri, bi mo tele,
Kini ere mi?
Opolopo iya ati
‘Banuje

C:
If I still hold closely to Him,
What hath He at last?
Sorrow vanquished, labour ended,
Jordan past.
D:
Bi mo tele tit‘ aiye mi
Kini ngo ri gba?
Ekun a d‘opin ngo simi
Tit‘ aiye.

C:
If I ask Him to receive me,
Will He say me nay?
Not till earth and not till heaven
Pass away.
D:
Bi mo bere pe k‘O gba mi
Y‘o ko fun mi bi?
B‘ orun at‘aiye nkoja lo
Ko je ko.

C:
Finding, following, keeping, struggling,
Is He sure to bless?
Saints, Apostles, Prophets, Martyrs,
Answer, Yes!
Amen.
D:
Bi mo ba ri bi mo tele,
Y‘O ha bukun mi?
Awon ogun orun nwipe,
Yio se
Amin.

C:
Thou whose almighty word
Chaos and darkness heard
And took their flight,
Hear us, we humbly pray,
And, where the Gospel’s day
Sheds not its glorious ray
Let there be light.
D:
Iwo ti okunkun
Gb‘ oro agbara Re,
T’ o si fo lo:
Gbo ti wa, a nbe O,
Nibit‘ ihinrere
Ko ti tan ‘mole re,
K‘ imole wa.

C:
Thou who didst come to bring
On Thy redeeming wing
Healing and sight,
Health to the sick in mind,
Sight to the inly blind,
Oh now, to all mankind
Let there be light!
D:
‘Wo t‘ iye apa Re
Mu iriran w‘ aiye,
At‘ ilera:
Ilera ti inu;
Iriran ti okan;
Fun gbogbo enia
K‘ imole wa.

C:
Spirit of truth and love,
Life-giving, holy Dove,
Speed forth Thy flight:
Move on the water's face,
Bearing the lamp of grace,
And in earth's darkest place
Let there be light!
D:
Iwo Emi ooto,
Ti O nf‘ iye fun wa,
Fo kakiri:
Gbe fitila anu
Fo ka oju omi,
Ni ‘bi okunkun nla,
K‘ imole wa

C:
Blessed and holy Three,
Glorious Trinity,
Wisdom, Love, and Might,
Boundless as ocean's tide,
Rolling in fullest pride,
Through the world, far and wide
Let there be light!
Amen.
D:
Metalokan Mimo,
Ogbon, ife, Ipa,
Alabukun!
B‘ igbi omi okun
Ti nyini ipa re,
Be ka gbogbo aiye,
K‘ imole wa
Amin.

C:
Go forth and preach my Gospel,
Make all the world know my kindness
He who receives my word shall live
Who-ever shuns it shall perish
D:
Lo wasu ihinrere Mi
Mu gbogbo aye gb‘ ore mi;
Enit‘ o gb‘ oro Mi y‘ o la,
Enit‘ o ko yio segbe.

C:
I will show you my great wisdom,
And ye shall reveal my true word
In all these works which I have done
In all the works ye choose to do
D:
Emi o f‘ oye nla han yin,
E o f‘ oro oto Mi han;
Ni gbogbo ise ti mo se,
Ni gbogbo ise t‘ e o se.

C:
Heal the sick, and raise up the dead,
Satan in my name drive ye out,
My prophets, O, be not afraid
Even if Greeks, Jews mock at you
D:
Lo wo arun, lo j‘ oku nde,
F‘ oruko Mi l‘ esu jade;
Ki woli Mi mase beru,
Bi Griki ati Ju k’ egan.

C:
Teach the whole world all my orders
Lo, I am with you till the end
Reserve of power, I have with Me
I can destroy and also save. Amen.
D:
Ko gbogbo aiye l‘ ase Mi,
Mo wa lehin nyin de opin;
Lowo Mi ni gbogbo ipa,
Mo le pa, mo si le gbala.
Amin.

C:
Thy kingdom come, O God!
Thy rule, O Christ begin!
Break with thine iron rod
the tyrannies of sin!
D:
Krist' ki 'joba Re de,
Ki ase Re bere;
F' opa-rin Re fo
Gbogbo ipa ese.

C:
Where is thy reign of peace,
and purity and love?
When shall all hatred cease,
as in the realms above?
D:
Ijoba ife da,
Ati t' Alafia?
Gbawo ni irira
Yio tan bi t'orun?

C:
When comes the promised time
that war shall be no more,
oppression, lust, and crime
shall flee thy face before?
D:
Akoko na ha da,
T' ote yio pari,
Ika at' ireje,
Pelu ifekufe?

C:
We pray thee, Lord, arise,
and come in thy great might;
revive our longing eyes,
which languish for thy sight.
D:
Oluwa joo, dide,
Wa n'nu agbara Re;
Fi ayo fun awa
Ti o nsaferi Re

C:
Men scorn thy sacred Name,
and wolves devour thy fold;
by many deeds of shame we
learn that love grows cold.
D:
Eda ngan ooko Re,
'Koko nje agbo Re;
Iwa 'tiju pupo
Nfihan pe 'fe tutu.

C:
O'er heathen lands afar thick
darkness broodeth yet: arise, O Morning Star, arise, and never set!
D:
Ookun bole sibe,
Ni ile keferi:
Dide 'Rawo ooro,
Dide, mase wo mo.

C:
For my sake and the Gospel's go
And tell Redemption's story;
His heralds answer, "Be it so,
And Thine, Lord, all the glory!"They preach His Birth, His Life, His Cross,
The love of His atonement
For whom they count the world but loss,
His Easter, His Enthronement.
D:
‘Tori Mi at‘ Ihinrere,
E lo so t‘ Irapada,
Awon onse Re nke, Amin’!
Tire ni gbogbo ogo;
Nwon nso t‘ ibi, t‘ iya, t‘ iku,
Ife etutu nla Re;
Nwon ka ohun aiye s‘ ofo
T‘ ajinde on 'joba Re

C:
Hark, hark the trump of jubilee
Proclaims to every nation,
From pole to pole, by land and sea,
Glad tidings of salvation:
As nearer draws the day of doom,
While still the battle rages,
The Heavenly Dayspring through the gloom
Breaks on the night of ages.
D:
Gbo, gbo, ipe ti Jubeli,
O ndun yi gbogb‘ aiye ka,
N‘ ile ati l‘oju okun,
A ntan ihin igbala;
Bi ojo na ti nsunmo’le,
T‘ Ogun si ngbona janjan,
Imole ila-orun na
Y’ o mo larin okunkun.

C:
Still on and on the anthems spread
Of Hallelujah voices,
In concert with the holy Dead
The warrior Church rejoices;
Their snow-white robes are wash’ed in Blood,
Their golden harps are ringing;
Earth and the paradise of God
One triumph-song are singing.
D:
Siwaju ati siwaju
Lao ma gbo, Halleluya,
Ijo Ajagun y’ o ma yo
Pel‘ awon oku mimo,
A fo aso won n‘nu eje,
Duru wura nwon si ndun,
Aiye at‘ orun d‘ ohun po,
Nwon nko orin isegun.

C:
He comes, Whose Advent Trumpet drowns
The last of Time's evangels,
Emmanuel crowned with many crowns,
The Lord of Saints and Angels:
O Life, Light, Love, the great I AM,
Triune, who changest never,
The Throne of God and of the Lamb
Is Thine, and Thine for ever!
Amen.
D:
O de Enit‘a nw’ ona Re,
Eni ikehin na de.
Immanueli t‘O d‘ ade,
Oluwa awon mimo,
lye, Imole at‘ ife,
Metalokan titi lai;
Tire ni ite Olorun
Ati t‘ Odo-agutan.
Amin.

C:
Jesus shall reign where e'er the sun
doth his successive journeys run;
his kingdom stretch from shore to shore,
till moons shall wax and wane no more.
D:
Jesu y'o joba ni gbogbo
Ibi ta ba le ri orun;
'Joba Re yo tan kakiri,
'Joba Re ki yo n'ipekun

C:
To him shall endless prayer be made,
and praises throng to crown his head;
his Name like sweet perfume shall rise
with every morning sacrifice.
D:
O'n la o ma gbadura si,
Awon oba yo se l'Oba;
Oruko Re b'orun didun,
Yo ba ebo ooro goke.

C:
People and realms of every tongue
dwell on his love with sweetest song;
and infant voices shall proclaim
their early blessings on his Name.
D:
Gbogbo oniruru ede,
Y'o f'ife Re ko'rin didun:
Awon omode yoo jewo
Pe 'bukun won todo Re wa.

C:
Blessings abound where e'er he reigns:
the prisoner leaps to lose his chains,
the weary find eternal rest,
and all the sons of want are blest.
D:
Bukun po nibit'O n joba:
A tu awon onde sile
Awon alare si simi
Alaini si ribukun gba

C:
Let every creature rise and bring
peculiar honors to our King;
angels descend with songs again,
and earth repeat the loud.
D:
Ki gbogbo eda ko dide,
Ki won f'ola fun Oba won:
K'Angel' tun wa t'awon t'orin
Ki gbogb'aye jumo gbe'rin.

C:
Blow ye the trumpet blow,
The gladly solemn sound
Let all the nations know,
To earth's remotest bound,
The year of jubilee is come!
Return, ye ransom’d sinners, home.
D:
E funpe na kikan
Ipe ihinrere
K’ o dun jake jado
L’ eti gbogbo eda
Odun idasile ti de
Pada elese e pada

C:
Extol the Lamb of God,
The all-atoning Lamb;
Redemption by His blood
Throughout the world proclaim.
The year of jubilee is come!
Return, ye ransom’d sinners, home.
D:
Fun ‘pe t’ Odagutan
T’ a ti pa s’ etutu
Je ki agbaiye mo
Agbara eje Re
Odun idasile ti de
Pada elese e pada

C:
Ye, who have sold for nought
Your heritage above,
Receive it back unbought,
The gift of Jesus' love
The year of jubilee is come!
Return, ye ransom’d sinners, home.
D:
Enyin eru ese
E so ‘ra nyin d’ omo
Lowo Kristi Jesu
E gba omnira nyin
Odun idasile ti de
Pada elese e pada

C:
Jesus our great High Priest,
Has full atonement made;
Ye weary spirits, rest;
Ye mournful souls, be glad.
The year of jubilee is come!
Return, ye ransom’d sinners, home.
Amen.
D:
Olori Alufa
L’ Olugbala ise
O fi ‘ra Re rubo
Arukun aruda
Odun idasile ti de
Pada elese e pada

C:
Awake, and in His strength renewed,
The battle cry take up again;
All enemies shall be subdued,
And Christ the Lord shall reign.
For Christ must reign,
For Christ must reign,
Our hope in Him is not in vain;
For Christ must reign,
For Christ must reign,
For Christ must reign,
Our hope in Him is not in vain;
For Christ must reign.
D:
Ji, so agbara Re d‘ otun
Gbe ‘hamora ogun re wo;
Ao segun gbogbo ota,
Kristi yo si joba.
Krist‘ y‘o joba
Krist‘ y‘o joba,
Ireti wa n‘nu Re ko ye;
Krist‘ y‘o joba,
Krist‘ y‘o joba,
Krist‘ y‘o joba,
Ireti wan‘nu Re ko ye
Krist‘ y‘o joba.

C:
Tool long His followers idly stood
By selfish creed and doctrine rent;
Nor knew that for one Brotherhood,
His own short life was spent.
D:
O ti pe t‘ awon omo Re
Ti nse ‘yapa lori eko;
nwon gbagbe pe l‘ ori ‘sokan
Ni On lo aiye Re.

C:
Unite and in His strength go on,
Nor count a life as lost, but gain;
And soon the victory shall be won,
For Jesus Christ must reign.
D:
E papo li agbara Re,
Aiye nyin yio ,si je ere;
Laipe e o ni isegun,
‘Tori Krist‘ y'o joba.

C:
To dare and do for Him is meet,
The struggle shall not be in vain,
The Trumpet shall not call "Retreat,"For Jesus Christ must reign.
Amen.
D:
O ye ka sise f‘ Oluwa,
Ise wa ko ni je lasan;
A ko gbodo pada s'ehin,
‘Tori Krist‘ y‘o joba.
Amin.

C:
I love to tell the story
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory,
Of Jesus and His love.
I love to tell the story,
Because I know it’s true;
It satisfies my longings
As nothing else would do.
D:
Mo fe maa so itan na
Itan ohun t’orun;
Ti Jesu at’ ogo Re
Ati ife nla Re
Mo maa so itan na,
Mo mo pe ooto ni;
Itan ti fun ni l’ ayo,
Ju ohun gbogbo lo.

C:
I love to tell the story;
More wonderful it seems
Than all the golden fancies
Of all the golden dreams,
I love to tell the story,
It did so much for me;
And that is just the reason
I tell it now to thee
D:
Mo fe maa so itan na,
Itan ‘yanu julo,
O ga ju ero wa lo,
O jin ju okun lo
Mo fe maa so itan na,
O seun pupo fun mi;
Eyi lo mu ki nma so
Fun gbogbo enia.

C:
I love to tell the story;
’Tis pleasant to repeat
What seems each time I tell it,
More wonderfully sweet.
I love to tell the story;
For some have never heard
The message of salvation
From God’s own holy Word.
D:
Mo fe maa so itan na,
Ngo tun itan na so;
Didun ni lojojumo,
O nya mi l’ enu si
Mo fe ma so itan na
Pupo ni ko ti gbo:
Itan igbala kikun,
Lat’ inu oro re.

C:
I love to tell the story;
For those who know it best
Seem hungering and thirsting
To hear it like the rest.
And when, in scenes of glory,
I sing the new, new song,
’Twill be the old, old story,
That I have loved so long. Amen
D:
Mo fe maa so itan na,
Opo li ongbe ngbe:
Won saferi lati gbo
Itan iyanu yi
Gba mob a de ‘nu ogo,
Ngo ko orin titun:
Orin itan ‘yanu yi,
Ni ngo maa ko titi.    Amin.

C:
The Gospel bells are ringing
Over land, from sea to sea
Blessed news of free salvation
Do they offer you and me
‘For God so loved the world
That His only Son He gave!
Whosoe'er believeth in Him
Everlasting life shall have”
chorus:    Gospel bells! how they ring
Over land from sea to sea
Gospel bells freely bring
Blessed news to you and me
D:
1 Agogo ‘hinrere nlu
lati ilu de ilu,
Ihinrere ‘gbala ofe
L’ a fi nlo gbogbo’ enia;
Olorun f‘ araoye
T‘ O fi Omo Re fun wa;
Pe enikeni t’ o gbagbo
Y‘ o r’ iye ainipekun.
Agogo ‘hinrere nlu
Ti n polowo igbala,
Agogo ‘hinrere
Ti o nmu igbala wa

C:
The Gospel bells invite us
To a feast prepared for all
Do not slight the invitation
Nor reject the gracious call
“I am the Bread of life
Eat of Me, thou hungry soul
Though your sins be red as crimson
They shall be as white as wool”
D:
Agogo ihinrere nlu
O npe wa si ase na,
Mase ko ipe ife yi,
Ma kegan or‘ofe Re,
‘Emi l’ onje iye’’
Wa Je ninu onje na,
B‘ ese re pon bi ododo
Nwon y‘o funfun bi owu.

C:
The Gospel bells give warning
As they sound from day to day
Of the fate which doth await them
Who for ever will delay
“Escape thou for thy life!
Tarry not in all the plain
Nor behind thee look, oh never,
Lest thou be consumed in plain"
D:
Agogo na nma nkilo
B‘o ti ndun lojojumo
Ewu ti nduro de awon
T’o ba se aiya won le;
S‘ asala f‘ emi re,
Ma duro, ma si lora,
Mase bojuwo ehin re,
Ki iwo ma ba segbe..

C:
The Gospel bells are joyful
As they echo far and wide
Bearing notes of perfect pardon
Through a Saviour crucified
“Good tidings of great joy
To all people do I bring
Unto you is born a Saviour
Which is Christ the Lord and King."Amen.
D:
Agogo ayo l’ eyi,
O npolowo ayo nla,
O nso t’ idariji kikun
Ti Jesu y‘o fi fun wa
Mo mu ‘hin ayo wa,
Fun t’ okunrin t’ obirin
A bi Olugbala fun wa,
On l’ Oluwa at’ Oba.
Amin.

C:
There’s a call comes ringing o’er the restless wave:
Send the light!  Send the light!
There are souls to rescue there are souls to save,
Send the light!  Send the light!
Chorus: Send the light, the blessed Gospel light;
Let it shine from shore to shore!
Send the light, and let its radiant beams
Light the world for ever more.
D:
Ipe na ndun l’ otun ati l’ osi pe,
Tan ‘mole, tan ‘mole
Opo l’ o nku laini ireti orun,
Tan ‘mole, tan ‘mole.
Tan ‘mole ihinrere na,
Je k’ o tan yi ayie ka;
Tan ‘mole ihinrere na,
Je k’o tan  yi aiye ka.

C:
We have heard the Macedonian call today
Send the light!  Send the light!
And a golden offering at the cross we lay
Send the light!  Send the light!
D:
Awon t’ o wa l’ okunkun nke tantan pe,
Tan ‘mole, tan mole;
Mu won wa jeje s’ ibi agbelebu,
Tan ‘mole, tan ‘mole.

C:
Let us pray that grace may everywhere abound
Send the light!  Send the light!
And a Christ-like spirit everywhere be found,
Send the light!  Send the light!
D:
Je k’ a gbadura k’ or ofe le joba,
Tan ‘mole, tan ‘mole
Ki Emi krist’ joba ni ibi gbogbo
Tan ‘mole, tan ‘mole.

C:
Let us not grow weary in the work of love:
Send the light!  Send the light!
Let us gather jewels for a crown above:
Send the light!  Send the light!
Chr: Send the light, the blessed
Gospel light! Amen
D:
Je k’ a te ‘ra mo ise t’ o l’ ere yi,
Tan ‘mole, tan ‘mole;
A o gb’ ade nikehin bi a foriti
Tan ‘mole, tan ’mole.  Amin.

C:
O God, my God, my all thou art;
Ere shines the dawn of rising day,
Thy sovereign light within my heart
Thine all-enlivening power display.
D:
Olorun mi ‘Wo l’ Emi mi!
K’ imole ooro to mo de,
F’ agbara Re han l’ okan mi
Ki O si mu mi laraya.

C:
For Thee my thirsty soul doth pant
While in this desert land I live;
And hungry as I am, and faint,
Thy love alone can comfort give
D:
Ongbe Re l’ o ngbe okan mi,
N’ ile aginju gbigbe yi:
Ebi npa ni, mo si daku,
‘Fe Re nikan lo le yo mi

C:
In a dry land, behold, I place
My whole desire on Thee, O lord;
And more I joy to gain Thy grace,
Than all earth’s treasures can afford.
D:
Iwo nikan l’ okan mi nfe,
N’ ile gbigbe yi’Olorun;
Mo fe ni ore-ofe Re,
Ju gbogbo oro aiye lo.

C:
More dear than life itself, Thy love
My heart and tongue shall still employ;
And to declare Thy praise will prove
My peace, my glory, and my joy.
D:
Ife Re to s’owon  julo,
Y’ o kun okan at’ahon mi;
Ogo, ayo Alafia mi,
Y’ o je lati so iyin Re

C:
In blessing Thee with grateful songs,
My happy life shall glide away,
The praise, that to Thy Name belong,
Hourly with lifted hands I'll pay
D:
Gbogbo aiye mi ni ngo ma
F’ orin ope bukun fun O;
Iyin ‘t’ o ye oruko Re
Ni ngo ma gbe s’ oke si o.

C:
Thy name, O Lord, upon my bed
Dwells on my lips and fires my thought.
With trembling awe in midnight shade,
I muse on all Thy hands have wrought.
D:
Oruko Re wa l’ enu mi
At’ ero mi, lor’ eni mi;
Mo nse asaro ise Re,
Pelu ‘wariri, l’ oganjo.

C:
In all I do I feel Thine aid.
Therefore Thy greatness will I sing,
O God, who bidd’st my heart be glad,
Beneath the shadow of Thy wing.
D:
Mo nri owo Re n’nu ‘se mi;
Nje ngo ko ‘rin titobi Re,
Olorun, ‘wo t’ o mu mi yo
L’abe  ojiji iye Re.

C:
My soul draws nigh and cleaves to Thee:
Then let or earth or hell assail,
Thy mighty hand shall set me free;
For whom Thou sav’st, he ne’er shall fail. Amen
D:
Mo sunmo O timotimo;
Agbara Re ni y’o gba mi
Low’ aiye at’ orun –egbe:
Igbala Re ki tase lai.   Amin.

C:
Hear the foot-steps of Jesus,
He is now passing by,
Bearing balm for the wounded,
Healing all who apply;
As He spake to the suff-rer
Who lay at the pool.
He is saying this moment
‘Wilt thou be made whole.
Wilt thou be made whole,
Wilt thou be made whole,
Oh, come weary suff’rer,
Oh, come, sin sick soul;
See the life-steam is flowing
See the cleansing waves roll;
Step into the current and thou shalt be whole.
D:
Gbo iro ese Jesu, O nkoja lo bayi,
O ni ‘tura f‘ agbogbe, O ns‘awotan arun;
B’ o ti so f‘ alaisan ni l’eti adagun,
O nwi be nisisiyi, “O nfe ‘wosan bi?”
O nfe ‘wosan bi?
O nfe ‘wosan bi?
Wa, alailera, wa;
Wa, elese wa;
Wo omi iye ti nsan,
Omi iwenumo,
Wo inu Re, iwo y’ o si ri ‘wosan

C:
‘Tis the voice of that Saviour
whose merciful call,
Freely offers salvation to one and to all
He is now beck’ning to Him,
Each sin tainted soul,
And lovingly asking wilt thou be made whole?.
D:
Ohun Olugbala ni, ipe anu Re,
Mu igbala ofe wa fun gbogbo enia;
O npe gbogbo okan ti eru ese npa,
O nfi ife bere pe: “O nfe ‘wosan bi?”

C:
Are you halting and struggling,
O’ erpow’rd by your sin,
While the waters are troubled,
Can you not enter in?
Lo, the Saviour stands
Waiting to strengthen your soul,
He is earnestly pleading,
"Wilt thou be made whole?
D:
Ara nni o, eru ese nwo o l‘orun,
O ko ha le wo’ nu omi ni bi o ti nru;
Wo Oluwa nduro lati fun o l‘ okun,
O si nfi ‘fe bere pe: “O nfe ‘wosan bi’’?

C:
Blessed Saviour, assist us,
to rest on Thy word,
Let the soul healing power,
on us now be out-poured;
Wash away every sin spot,
take perfect control
Say to each trusting spirit,
"Wilt thou be made whole?"Amen.
D:
Ran wa lowo Jesu k’ a gbeke l‘ oro Re,
Jeki emi iwosan be le wa loni yi,
We abawon ese nu, si sakoso wa,
So f‘ okan to nwa o pe:
“O nfe ‘wosan bi?”

C:
O my God, on Thee I call
Painful I am my prayer hear,
When I am drowned in sinful deeds
Let all my hearts remain unchanged.
D:
. Olorun mi, ‘Wo l‘ em‘ o pe;
Ara nni mi, gbo igbe mi:
‘Gba ‘san omi ba b’ ori mi,
Ma je k‘ okan mi fa s’ehin

C:
Thou who ask friend to a weakling
Who is ready to hear my cry
Except Thee O and Thee alone,
Who invites the poor to His side.
D:
Iwo Ore alailera,
Tani mba s’ aroye mi fun?
Bikose ‘Wo nikansoso,
T‘ O npe otosi w‘ odo Re?

C:
Who has once poured unfruitful tears
That was rejected to Thee Lord?
For Thou hast given the promised Lord:
That no one shall find Thee in vain
D:
Tal‘ o sokun to O lasan ri?
‘Wo ko igbe enikeni ri?
Se Iwo ni O ti so pe,
Enikan k‘ yo wa O lasan?

C:
This would have been my great sorrow;
That Thou doth not answer prayer
But Thou the prayer answering God
Has always been helping me through.
D:
Eyi ‘ba  je ‘binuje mi
Pe, O ko ndahun adura;
Sugbon ‘Wo ti ngbo adura,
Iwo l‘ O nse iranwo mi

C:
I know that I am very poor
But God would never forget me
when the Saviour Lord pleadeth for
cometh safely not of sorrow
Amen.
D:
Mo mo pe alaini l‘ emi,
Olorun ko ni gbagbe mi;
Eniti Jesu mbebe fun,
O bo lowo gbogbo ‘yonu

C:
Wonderful story of love
Tell it to me again
Wonderful story of love
Wake the immortal strain,
Angels with rapture announce it
Shepherd with wonder receive it,
Sinner, O won't you believe it?
Wonderful story of love.
Wonderful! Wonderful!  Wonderful!
Wonderful story of love.
D:
Itan iyanu t’ife! So fun mi lekan si
Itan iyanu tífe! Ti dun leti kikan
Awon Angeli rohin re, awon oluso si gbagbo
Elese, iwo ki yó gbo? Itan iyanu tífe!
Iyanu! Iyanu!
Iyanu! Itan iyanu t’ife

C:
Wonderful story of love
Tho’ you are far away
Wonderful story of love
Still He doth call today
Calling from Calvary's mountain
Down from the crystal bright fountain
E'en from the dawn of creation
Wonderful story of love.
D:
Itan iyanu t’ife ! B’iwo tile sako
Itan iyanu t’ife! Sibe o npe loni
Lat’o oke kalfari, lati orisun didan ni
Lati ise-dale aiye ;itan iyanu t’ife.

C:
Wonderful story of love
Jesus provides a rest
Wonderful story of love;
For all the pure and bless
Rest in those mansions above us
With those who've gone on before us
Singing the rapturous chorus
Wonderful story of love.
Amen.
D:
Itan iyanu t’ife! Jesu ni isimi
Itan iyanu t’ife! Fun awon oloto
T’o simi n’ilu nla orun, Pel’awon to saju wa lo
Nwon nko orin ayo orun, itan iyanu t’ife.

Jesu y’o gba elese
Kede re fun gbogb’eda
Awon ti won sako lo
Awon ti won ti subu
Ko l’orin, ko si tun ko
Kristi ngba’awon elese
Fi oto na ye won pe
Kristi ngb’awon elese

Wa, y’o fun o ni ‘simi
Gbagbo, oro Re daju
Y’o gba eni buru ju
Kristi ngb’awon elese

C:
Now my heart condemns me not,
Pure before the law I stand;
He who cleansed me from all spot,
Satisfied its last demand.
D:
Okan mi da mi lare
Mo mo niwaju ofin
Eni t’O ti we mi mo
Ti san gbogbo gbese mi

C:
Christ receiveth sinful men,
Even me with all my sin;
Purged from every spot and stain,
Heaven with Him I enter in.
D:
Kristi ngb’awon elese
An’emi to kun f’ese
O ti so mi di mimo
Mo ba wo ‘joba orun.

C:
God is here and that to bless us
With the spirit's quick'ning power,
See, the cloud already bending
Waits to drop the grateful shower,
Let it come, O lord we pray Thee!
Let the shower of blessing fall;
We are waiting, we are waiting;
Oh receive the hearts of all!
D:
Olorun wa mbe l’arin wa,
Lati bukun gbogbo wa,
Wo oju orun b‘o ti su
Yio r’ ojo ibukun;
K‘ O de Oluwa, a be O
Je k‘ ojo Ibukun de;
Awa nduro, awa nduro,
M‘ okan gbogbo wa soji

C:
God is here! We feel His presence
In this consecrated place;
But we need the soul refreshing
Of His free, unbounded grace,
D:
Olorun wa mbe l’arin wa
Ninu ile mimo yi,
Sugbon a nfe ‘tura okan
At‘ opo or‘ ofe Re
K‘ O de Oluwa, a be O. etc.

C:
God is here! Oh, then believing,
Bring to Him our one desire,
That His love may now be kindled,
Till is flame each heart inspire.
D:
Olorun wa mbe larin wa,
K‘ a mu ebe wa too wa;
Ki ife Re ba le gberan
Lati m‘ okan wa gbona.
K‘ O de Oluwa, a be O. etc.

C:
Saviour, grant the prayer we offer,
While in simple faith we bow;
From the windows of Thy mercy
Pour us out a blessing now.
Amen.
D:
Jesu fi ‘bere wa fun wa,
B‘ a ti fi ‘gbagbo kunle,
Joo si ferese anu Re
K‘ O tu ‘bukun sori wa.
K‘ O de Oluwa, a be O
Amin.

C:
Are you weary, are you heavy hearted?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
Are you grieving over joys departed?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus,
He is a friend that's well known;
You have no other such a friend or brother,
Tell it to Jesus alone.
D:
Aare mu O, okan re poruru?
So fun Jesu, So fun Jesu;
Ibanuje dipo ayo fun o?
So fun Jesu nikan.
So fun Jesu, So fun Jesu,
On l‘ore ti o mo;
Ko si ore
Tabi ‘yekan bi Re
So fun Jesu nikan.

C:
Do the tears flow down your cheeks unbidden?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
Have you sins that to men's eyes are hidden?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
D:
Asun-dekun omije l’o nsun bi?
So fun Jesu, So fun Jesu,
Iwo l‘ ese ti enikan ko mo?
So fun Jesu nikan.

C:
Do you fear the gathering clouds of sorrow?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
Are you anxious what shall be tomorrow?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
D:
Iwo nfoiya ‘banuje ti mbe bi?
So fun Jesu, So fun Jesu:
Iwo ns‘ aniyan ojo ola bi?
So fun Jesu nikan.

C:
Are you troubled at the thought of dying?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
For Christ's coming kingdom are you singing?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
Amen.
D:
‘Ronu iku nda o li amu bi?
So fun Jesu, So fun Jesu:
O ns’ aferi ijoba Jesu bi?
So fun Jesu nikan.
Amin.

C:
Once more, my soul, thy Saviour,
Thro' the word
Is offer'd full and free;
And now, O Lord, I must, I must decide:
Shall I accept of Thee?
I will! I will!
I will, God helping me, I will,
O Lord be Thine
Thy precious blood was shed to
Purchase me
I will be wholly Thine!
D:
Okan mi, a tun fi Jesu lo o
Lekan si n‘n’oro Re,
Nisisiyi, Oluwa, ngo pinnu
Nki o ha gba Tire?
Mo fe, mo fe
Olorun se ‘ranwo
Emi fe je tire
Eje Re ‘yebiye t’O fi ra mi,
Emi y’ o je Tire

C:
By grace I will Thy mercy now receive,
Thy love my heart hath won;
On Thee, O Christ, I will, I will believe,
And trust in Thee alone!
D:
Nipa or‘ofe l‘ em‘o r‘ anu gba,
Ife Re segun mi
Kristi Iwo li emi o gbagbo,
Ngo si gbekele O.

C:
Thou knowest, Lord, how very weak I am
And how I fear to stray;
For strength to serve I look to Thee alone
The strength Thou must supply!
D:
Oluwa, Iwo mo ailera mi
Bi nko ti fe sako,
‘Wo nikan l’ o le fun mi l‘agbara
Lati josin fun O.

Oluwa f’or‘ofe fun wa loni
K’ a le jumo' ko ‘rin:
Ki gbogbo wa SO tokan-tokan pe,
Emi y’o je ti Krist‘.

C:
To all who came, when Thou wast here below
And said, "O Lord, wilt Thou?"To them, "I will!" was ever Thy reply:
We rest upon it now.
Amen.
D:
Awon t‘o wa nigba aiye Re
Lati toro ‘bukun,
“Mo fe ni idahun ti nwon ri gba:
On na l’ a gbokanle.
Amin.

C:
Come every soul by sin oppressed
There's mercy with the Lord
And He will surely give you rest
By trusting in His word
Only trust Him! Only trust Him
Only trust Him now!
He will save you! He will save you!
He will save you now!
D:
Wa, okan t‘ eru ese npa;
Alanu l‘Oluwa;
Oun y’o si fun o n‘isimi
Bi o ba gbeke le.
Sa gbeke le (2ce)
Gbeke le loni,
Y’o gba o la  (2ce)
Y’o gba o loni.

C:
For Jesus shed His precious blood
Rich blessings to bestow
Plunge now into the crimson flood
That washes white as snow.
D:
N‘tori Jesu ta eje Re
Lati fun O l‘ ayo:
Wa mookun ninu eje na
Ti nsoni di mimo.

C:
Yes, Jesus is the Truth the Way
That leads you into rest
Believe in Him without delay
And you are fully blest.

Come then, and join this holy band
And on to glory go
To dwell in that celestial land
Where joys immortal flow.
Amen.
D:
Wa, Wo ‘nu egbe mimo yi,
Kalo sinu ogo,
Lati gbe ilu mimo na
Nibit‘ ayo ki tan.

C:
Jesus, my Lord, to Thee I cry;
Unless Thou help me, I must die;
Oh, bring Thy free salvation nigh,
And take me as I am.
Chr: And take me as I am!
And take me as I am!
My only plea Christ died for me!
Oh, take me as I am!
D:
Oluwa mi, mo ke pe O;
Ngo ku, b‘O ko ran mi lowo
Mu igbala Re to mi wa,
Gba mi bi mo ti ri,
Chr: Gba mi bi mo ti ri (2ce)
Kristi ku fun mi l‘ebe mi
Gba mi bi mo ti ri.

C:
Helpless I am, and full of guilt;
But yet for me Thy blood was split,
And Thou canst make me what
Thou wilt,
And take me as I am.

No preparation can I make,
My best resolves I only break
Yet save me for Thine own
Name’s sake,
And take me as I am!

Behold me, Saviour, at Thy feet
Deal with me as Thou seest meet;
Thy work begin, Thy work
Complete
But take me as I am!

Sing them over again to me,
Wonderful words of life;
Let me more of their beauty see,
Wonderful words of life;
Words of life and beauty,
Teach me faith and duty:
Refrain: Beautiful words,
wonderful words,
Wonderful words of life;
Beautiful words, wonderful words,
wonderful words of life.
D:
E tun won ko fun mi ki ngbo
Oro 'yanu t' Iye!
Je ki ntubo gbadun won si
Oro 'yanu t' Iye,
Ti nko ni n’igbagbo
Oro didun! Oro 'yanu
Oro 'yanu t' Iye (2ce)

C:
Christ, the blessed One, gives to all
Wonderful words of life;
Sinner, list to the loving call,
Wonderful words of life;
All so freely given,
Wooing us to heaven:
Refrain
D:
Krist’ Olubukun, fi fun wa
Oro 'yanu t' Iye!
Elese gbo 'pe ife na
Oro 'yanu t' Iye,
L' ofe l’a fifun wa,
O si nto wa s’orun
Oro didun! Oro 'yanu
Oro 'yanu t' Iye (2ce)

C:
Sweetly echo the gospel call,
Wonderful words of life;
Offer pardon and peace to all,
Wonderful words of life;
Jesus, only Savior,
Sanctify forever,
Refrain
D:
Gbo ohun ihinrere na,
Oro 'yanu t' Iye!
Fi' dariji lo gbogb’ eda
Oro 'yanu t' Iye,
Jesu Olugbala,
So wa mo titi lai!
Oro didun! Oro 'yanu
Oro 'yanu t' Iye (2ce)

C:
The Great Physician now is near,
The sympathizing Jesus;
He speaks the drooping heart to
Cheer, Oh, hear the voice of Jesus!
Chr: Sweetest note in seraph song,
Sweetest name on mortal tongue,
Sweetest carol ever sung:
Jesus! blessed Jesus!
D:
Onisegun nla wa nihin
Jesu abanidaro
Oro Re mu ni l'ara da
Agbo ohu ti Jesu
Chorus
Iro didun lorin Seraf
Oruko didun n'nu enia
Orin t'o dun julo ni
Jesu, Jesu, Jesu

C:
Your many sins are all forgiven,
Oh, hear the voice of Jesus!
Go on your way in peace to heaven,
And wear a crown with Jesus.
D:
A fi gbogb' ese re ji o
A gbo ohun ti Jesu
Rin lo s'orun l'alafia
Si ba Jesu de ade

C:
All glory to the risen Lamb!
I now believe in Jesus,
I love the blessed Saviour's name,
I love the name of Jesus.
D:
Gbogb' ogo fun Krist' t'O jinde
Mo gbagbo nisisiyi
Mo f'oruko Olugbala
Mo fe oruko Jesu

C:
His name dispels my guilt and fear,
No other name but Jesus;
Oh, how my soul delights to hear
The precious name of Jesus.
D:
Oruko Re l' eru mi lo
Ko si oruko miran
B' okan mi ti nfe lati gbo
Oruko Re 'yebiye

C:
Come, brethren, help me sing His praise,
Oh, praise the name of Jesus!
Come, sisters, all your voices raise!
Oh, bless the name of Jesus
D:
Arakunrin e ba mi yin
A yin oruko Jesu
Arabirin, gb'ohun s'oke
A yin oruko Jesu

C:
The children too, both great and small,
Who love the name of Jesus.
May now accept the gracious call
To work and live for Jesus.
D:
Omode at'agbalagba
T'o fe oruko Jesu
Le gba 'pe 'fe nisisiyi
Lati sise fun Jesu

C:
And when to the bright world above
We rise to see our Jesus,
We'll sing around the throne of love
His name, the name of Jesus.
D:
Nigbat’a ba si d orun,
Ti a ba si ri Jesu,
A o ko ‘rin y’ ite ife ka,
Orin oruko Jesu
Iro didun etc.. Amin

C:
There shall be showers of blessing,"This is the promise of love;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
Sent from the Saviour above
Chr: Showers of blessing
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are
falling
But for the showers we plead.
D:
Ojo ibukun y’o si ro'!
Ileri ife l’ eyi
A o ni itura didun
Lat’ odo Olugbala
Ojo ibukun ! 
Ojo ibukun l’ a nfe
Iri anu nse yi wa ka
sugbon ojo l’ a ntoro

C:
"There shall be showers of
blessing:"Precious reviving again;
Over the hills and the valleys
Sound of abundance of rain.
D:
Ojo ibukun y’ o si ro
Isoji iyebiye
Lori oke on petele
Iro opo ojo mbo

C:
"There shall be showers of blessinig."Sent them upon us, O Lord!
Grant to us now a refreshing;
Come, and now honour Thy
word.
D:
Ojo ibukun y’ o si ro
Ran won si wa Oluwa
Fun wa ni itura didun
Wa f’ola fun oro Re

C:
"There shall be showers of blessing:"Oh that today they might fall,
Now as to God we're confessing,
Now as on Jesus we call.
D:
Ojo ibukun y’o si ro
Didan y'o si ro loni!
B’ a ti njewo f’ Olorun wa
T’ a npe oruko Jesu

C:
In tenderness He sought me,
Weary and sick with sin,
And on His shoulders brought me
Back to His fold again.
While angels in His presence
sang,
Until the courts of heaven rang.
Oh, the love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that brought me!
Oh, the grace that brought me to
the fold.
Wondrous grace that brought
me to the fold!
D:
Ife l‘O fi wa emi
Ti eru ese npa,
O gbe mi s‘ejika Re
Pada bowa s‘agbo
Angeli nfi ayo ko ‘rin
Pelu awon ogun orun
A! Ife t‘ o wa mi,
A! Eje t‘o ra mi
Suru pelu ore-ofe Re
T‘o fa mi pada bo wa
S‘agbo!

C:
He found me bruised and dying, 
And pour’d in oil and wine;
He whisper’d to assure me
"I've found thee, thou art Mine."I never heard a sweeter voice,
It made my aching heart rejoice!
D:
Mo gbogbe, mo feree ku
O tu ororo si;
O so fun mi jeje pe:
"Temi ni iwo se!
Nko gb‘ ohun t‘o dun to ‘yi ri
O mu okan are mi yo.
A! Ife t‘ o wa mi, etc

C:
He pointed to the nail-prints,
For me His blood was shed,
A mocking crown so thorny,
Was placed upon His head:
I wondered what He saw in me,
To suffer such deep agony.
D:
O f‘ apa iso han mi,
N‘ tori mi l‘ O jiya;
A de li ade egun
Lati fi se esin;
Nko m‘ohun t‘O ri l‘ ara mi
T‘o fi jiya po be fun mi.
A! Ife t‘ o wa mi, etc

C:
I'm sitting in His presence,
The sunshine of His face,
While with adoring wonder
His blessings I retrace.
It seems as if eternal days
Are far too short to sound His
praise.
D:
Mo joko niwaju Re,
N‘nu ‘mole oju Re;
Mo si nfi iyanu nla
Ranti ibukun Re;
Ayeraye fere ma to
Lati fi korin iyin Re.
A! Ife t‘ o wa mi, etc

C:
So while the hours are passing,
All now is perfect rest;
I'm waiting for the morning,
The brightest and the best,
When He will call us to His side,
To be with Him, His spotless bride.
D:
B‘akoko ti nkpja lo
N‘isimi pipe de;
Mo nreti owuro ni
Ti o dara julo,
‘Gba‘ On y‘o pe wa sodo Re
B‘iyawo Re, lailaba won.
A! Ife t‘ o wa mi, etc
Amin.

C:
Shine Thou upon us, Lord,
True Light of men, to-day;
And through the written word
Thy very self display;
That so, from hearts which burn
With gazing on Thy face,
The little ones may learn
The wonders of Thy grace.
D:
Tan ‘mole Re si wa
Loni yi, Oluwa
Fi ara Re han wa
N‘nu oro mimo Re:
Jo m‘okan wa gbona,
K’ a ma wo oju Re
K‘awon ‘mode le ko
Iyanu ore Re

C:
Breathe Thou upon us, Lord,
Thy Spirit's living flame,
That so with one accord
Our lips may tell Thy name;
Give Thou the hearing ear,
Fix Thou the wandering
thought,
That those we teach may hear
The great things Thou has wrought.
D:
Mi si wa, Oluwa
Ina emi mimo;
Ka le fi okan kan
Gbe oruko Re ga;
Jo fi eti igbo,
At‘ okan ironu,
Fun awon ti a nko
L‘ ohun nla t‘ O ti se.

C:
Speak Thou for us, O Lord,
In all we say of Thee;
According to Thy word
Let all our teaching be;
That so Thy lambs may know
Their own true shepherd's voice,
Where'er He leads them go
And in His love rejoice.

D:
Gbe ‘nu wa Oluwa,
K‘ ife Re je tiwa;
Iwo nikan lao fi
Ipa wa gbogbo sin;
K‘ iwa wa je eko,
Fun awon omo Re,
K’ o si ma kede Re
Ninu gbogbo okan.
Amin.

C:
Wonderful Bible! Book of God;
Guide and counsel to mortals given;
Lamp to the path by the ransomed trod,
Lighting the way from earth to heav'n.
Shine, O wonderful light divine,
Lamp of Truth, in this dark
world shine
Shine thr'o the night of doubt,
and fears,
Shine till the morn of God appears.
D:
Bibeli iwe iyanu
Ti o nf‘ ona han araiye,
Fitila ti ntan si ona wa,
Lat‘aye yi Il'oke orun.
chr: Tan ‘wo ‘mole at‘ oke wa.
Tan si okunkun aiye yi,
Tan ninu oru ‘yeme ji
Titi ooro titun yo fi de.

C:
Wonderful Bible! Law of the Lord;
All its precepts in grace abound
And in their keeping is great reward,
Life everlasting there is found.
D:
Bibeli, ofin Oluwa
Ti o kun fun ore-ofe;
Ni pipamo re, ere nla mbe,
N‘nu re la ri 'ye ailopin.

C:
Wonderful Bible! radiance bright;
Ray service from the world above,
Fairest of stars in humanity's night,
Fill now our hearts with light and
love.
D:
Bibeli, iwe imole,
Ti o tan lati oke wa;
Iranwo ti o l‘ ogo julo,
Da ‘na ife si okan wa.
Amin

C:
Break Thou the bread of life,
Dear Lord, to me,
As Thou didst break the loaves
Beside the sea:
Beyond the sacred page
I seek thee, Lord;
My spirit pants for Thee,
O living word!
D:
B ‘onje lye fun mi
Oluwa mi,
B‘ o ti bu akara
L’eba odo;
Ninu iwe mimo
Ni mo nwa O,
Okan mi nfa si O.
Oro iye!

C:
Break thou the bread of life,
O Lord, to me,
That hid within my heart
Thy word may be;
Mould Thou each inward thought
From self set free,
And let my steps be all
Controlled by thee.
D:
Wo li onje iye,
Oluwa mi,
Otito oro Re
Ni y’ o gba mi,
Jeki nje ninu Re,
Ki mba O gbe;
Jeki nfe ooto Re
Ife ni O!

C:
Open thy word of Truth
That I may see,
Thy message written clear
And plain for me;
Then in sweet fellowship
Walking with thee,
Thine image on my life
Engraved will be.
D:
Ran Emi Re simi,
Oluwa mi,
Ki O si la ‘ju mi,
Ki nle riran,
Otito oro Re
Fi han fun mi;
Ki nri O, Oluwa
N‘nu iwe Re
Amin.

Bibeli mimo t‘orun,
Owon itura temi!
‘Wo ti nwi bi mo ti ri
‘Wo li imo bi mo ti wa.

‘Wo nko mi bi mo sina,
‘Wo nfi ‘fe Oluwa han;
‘Wo l‘ O si nto ese mi,
‘Wo l‘ O nd ‘are, at‘ ebi.

C:
Mine, to comfort in distress,
If the Holy Spirit bless;
Mine, to show by living faith
Man can triumph over death.
D:
‘Wo ni nma tu wa ninu
Ninu wahala aiye;
‘Wo nko ni nipa ‘gbagbo
Pe, a le segun iku.

C:
Mine, to tell of joys to come,
Light and life beyond the tomb;
Holy Bible, book divine,
Precious treasure, thou art mine
D:
‘Wo l‘O nso t‘ayo ti mbo
At‘ iparun elese;
Bibeli mimo t‘orun,
Owon isura temi.  Amin.

C:
LORD, Thy word abideth,
And our footsteps guideth;
Who its truth believeth
Light and joy receiveth.
D:
Jesu oro Re ye,
O si nto ‘sise wa,
Enit‘o ba gba gbo,
Y‘ o l‘ ayo on ‘mole.

C:
When our foes are near us,
Then Thy word doth cheer us,
Word of consolation,
Message of salvation.
D:
Nigb‘ ota sunmo wa,
Oro Re l‘ odi wa;
Oro itunu ni,
Iko igbala ni.

C:
When the storms are o'er us,
And dark clouds before us,
Then its light directeth.
And our way protecteth.
D:
B‘igbi at‘ okunkun
Tile bo wa mole;
‘Mole Re y’ o to wa,
Y‘o si dabo bo wa.

C:
Who can tell the pleasure
Who recount the treasure
By Thy word imparted
To the simple-hearted?
D:
Tani le so ayo,
To le ka isura
Ti oro Re nfi fun
Okan onirele

C:
Word of mercy, giving
Succour to the living;
Word of life, supplying
Comfort to the dying!
D:
Oro aanu o nfi
‘Lera fun alaiye;
Oro iye o nfi
Itunu f’ eni nku.

C:
O that we discerning
Its most holy learning,
Lord, may love and fear Thee,
Evermore be near Thee!
D:
Awa iba le mo
Eko ti O nkoni;
Ki a ba le fe O.
K‘a si le sunmo O.
Amin.

C:
O Thou holy word of God
Thou Wisdom from above,
The Truth that never changeth
Our only light of life;
We praise Thee for the light
From the holy gospel,
A light to lighten our feet
That shine for evermore.
D:
Iwo Oro Olorun,
Ogbon at‘ oke wa;
Ooto ti ki yipada,
Imole aiye wa:
Awa nyin O fun 'mole,
T‘ inu iwe mimo;
Fitila fun ese wa
Ti ntan titi aiye.

C:
The Lord has given the gift                                                                                                           To his church on the earth,
The light is held up above
To light the world over;
It is a box of treasure 
Full of all righteousness
Tis the resemblance of Christ
The true and living word.
D:
Oluwa l‘O f‘ebun yi
Fun Ijo Re l‘ aiye,
A ngbe ‘mole na soke
Lati tan y‘ aiye ka,
Apoti wura n‘ise,
O kun fun otito,
Aworan Kristi si ni,
Oro iye, tooto

C:
It fileth high as a flag
That files high in the sky,
Like an Evangelist light
Shines in the world’s darkness,
It is a guide to all men
Amidst all ups and downs
Amidst water of trouble
It come to Christ the Lord.
D:
O nfe lele b‘ asia
T' a ta loju ogun;
O ton b' ina alore,
Si okunkun aiye;
Amonu enia ni,
Ni wahala gbogbo,
Nin‘arin omi aiye,
O nto wa s’odo Krist‘.

C:
O saviour transform Thy church
Into a golden light,
To shed Thy light all over
Just like the olden days;
Teach people who are misled
To make use of the light,
Till world’s darkness disappear
And all have seen Thy face.
D:
Olugbala se‘jo Re
Ni fitila wura;
Lati tan Imole Re
Bi aiye igbani;
Ko awon ti o sako,
Lati lo‘mole yi
Tit‘ookun aiye y‘o  pin,
Ti nwon o r‘ oju Re.
Amin.

C:
There is a book, who runs may read,
Which heavenly truth imparts;
And all the lore its scholars need,
Pure eyes and Christian hearts.
D:
Iwe kan wa ti kika re
Ko soro fun enia;
Ogbon ti awon t’ o ka nfe
Ni Okan ti o mo.

C:
The works of God above, below,
Within us and around,
Are pages in that book to show
How God Himself is found.
D:
Ise gbogbo t‘ Olorun se
L‘oke, n’ ile, n‘ nu wa;
Nwon j’ okan sinu iwe na
Lati f‘ Olorun han.

C:
The moon above the church below,
Within us and around,
Are pages in that book to show
How god Himself is found.
D:
Ise gbogbo t’ Olorun se,,
Lat’ ode orun ni;
Be l’ ogo ijo Olorun,
T’ odo Olorun wa.

C:
Thou who hast given me eyes to see
And love this sight so fair,
Give me a heart to find out Thee
And read Thee everywhere.
D:
Iwo ti O je ki a ri
Ohun t’ o dara yi;
Fun wa l‘okan lati wa O,
K‘a ri O nibi gbogbo.
Amin.

C:
Father of mercies, in Thy word
What endless glory shines!
For ever be Thy name adored
For these celestial lines.
D:
Baba orun nin‘ oro Re
Ni ogo ailopin ntan;
Titi lai l’ a o ma yin O
Fun Bibeli Mimo.

C:
Here springs of consolation rise
To cheer the fainting mind:
And thirsty souls receive supplies,
And sweet refreshing find.
D:
Opo ‘tunu wa ninu re
Fun okan alaare;
Gbogbo okan ti ongbe ngbe
Nri omi iye mu.

C:
Here the Redeemer's welcome
voice
Spreads heavenly peace around:
And life and everlasting joys
Attend the blissful sound.
D:
Ninu re l’ Alafia wa
Ti Jesu fifun wa;:
Iye ainipekun si wa,
N’ nu re fun gbogbo wa.

C:
Oh may these heav'nly pages be
My ever dear delight:
And still new beauties may I see,
And still increasing light.
D:
Iba le ma je ayo mi,
Lati ma kaa titi;
Ki nma ri ogbon titun ko
N‘ nu re lojojumo.

C:
Divine Instructor, gracious Lord,
Be Thou for ever near;
Teach me to love Thy sacred word,
And view my Saviour there.
D:
Oluwa Oluko orun,
Mase jina si mi:
Ko mi lati fe oro Re .
Ki nri Jesu nibe.
Amin.

C:
The Bible everliving book!
Thou start is never known?
No body know thy origin?
No one will know Thy end?
D:
Bibel‘ iwe aiyeraiye!
Tani le r‘idi re?
Tani le so idide re?
Tani le r‘opin re?

C:
Thou art the Almighty’s secret
Thou came from heavenly king
Thou hath the sword that kill death pains,
The true picture of God.

Thou art the chief amongst all those
Book of the ancient times;
Thou point the way to salvation
To all saints on the earth.
D:
Okan ni O larin opo
Iwe aiye ‘gbani,
Iwo l‘o s‘ona igbala
Di mimo f‘ araiye.

C:
The treasure of the trinity!
Of Great king to the throne!                                                                                                                                            Please make thyself known unto me
So that I doubt no more.
D:
Isura ti Metalokan,
Oba nla t ‘O gunwa;
Jo, tumo ara Re fun mi,
Ki ‘nye siyemeji.

C:
I want to read thee and then pray,
I want to learn from thee;
Thou great book of the ancient times!
Reveal me Jesus' love.
D:
Ki ‘m‘ si O pelu adura,
Ki‘m‘ k‘eko n’nu re;
Iwo iwe aiyeraiye
F‘ ife Jesu han mi.
Amin

Ro mo Bibeli bi a gba nkan ‘yoku,
Ma so ilana Re to s‘owon nu;
Ihin re nji gbogbo okan ti ntogbe
