Ileri re nso oku d’ alaye
Ro mo Bibeli (3ce)
‘Mole f’ ese wa.

C:
Cling to the Bib-le! This jew-el and
treasure.
Brings life eternal, and saves
fallen man;
Surely its value no mortal can
measure;
Seek for its blessing, O soul, while
you can!

Lamp for the feet that in by-ways have wandered,
Guide for the youth that would
other wise fall
Hope for the sin-ner whose life has been squander'd
Staff for the a-ged, and best book of all.
D:
Fitila f’ eni ti o ti sako lo,
Amona fun odo t‘iba subu;
‘Reti elese t‘ aiye re ti sonu,
Opa f‘agba, iwe t’ o da julo.
Ro mo Bibeli (3ce)
‘Mole f’ ese wa.
Amin.

C:
There is a fountain filled with blood
Drawn from Immanuel's veins;
And sinners, plung'd beneath that flood,
Lose all their guilty stains:
Chorus: He was wounded for our transgressions,
He was bruised for our iniquities;
The chastisement of our peace was upon Him,
And with His stripes we are heal'd
He was wounded for our transgressions; (2ce)
And with His stripes we are heal'd
With His stripes we are heal'd.
D:
Isun kan wa t’ o kun f’ eje,
To ti‘ha Jesu yo;
Elese mokun ninu re,
O bo ninu ebi.
chr; A sa l‘ ogbe, ‘tori ‘rekoja,
A si pa lara, n‘tori ese wa,
Ina ala fia wa mbe lara Re
Ina Re lo nwo wa san;
A sa l‘ ogbe ‘tori ‘rekoja,
A sa l‘ogbe ‘tori ‘rekoja,
Ina Re lo nwo wa san,
Ina Re nwo wa san.

C:
The dying thief rejoice'd to see
That fountain in his day;
And there may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away.
D:
Ole ni lor‘agbelebu,
Yo lati ri ‘sun na,
Bi mo kun f’ ese bi tire,
Mo le we n‘n‘eje na.

C:
E'er since by faith I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die.
D:
Gba mo fi ‘gbagbo r‘isun na
Ti nsan fun eje Re
Irapada d‘orin fun mi,
Ti un o ma ko titi.

C:
Thou dying Lamb, Thy precious blood
Shall never loose its pow'r,
Till all the ransom'd Church of God
Be saved, to sin no more.
D:
Agbara t’ o wa n‘n‘eje yi
Yo wa titi lailai,
Tit‘awon eni ‘rapada,
Y o bo sinu ogo.
Amin.

C:
I know there is power in Jesus' blood
For He wash'd my sins away;
And I know there is joy in serving Him
For He turn’d my night to day.
Chr: There is pow-er, pow-er, wonder working pow-er
There is pow-er, pow-er, purifying pow-er,
There is pow-er in Jesus’ blood.
D:
Agbara mbe n‘nu Eje Jesu,
‘Tori o w‘ ese mi nu;
Mo si mo pe isin Re li ayo,
O s‘ okun mi di mole
chr: Agbara mbe, agbara t‘ o sise ‘yanu
Agbara mbe; agbara ti o nwe wa mo
Mbe ninu Eje Jesu.

C:
I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood,
From my guilt He set me free;
When I came unto Him with all my
sins
And His blood avail’d for me.
D:
Agbara mbe n‘nu Eje Jesu
O gba mi lowo ebi,
‘Gbati mo k‘ eru ese mi t’O wa
Eje Re si we mi mo

C:
I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood,
For all things have been made new;
Since His own precious blood has been applied
And has cleans’d me thro’ and thro’
D:
Emi mo ire t‘Eje na nje,
O ti so wa di titun
Nipa Eje Re iyebiye na,
Mo di mimo titi lai.
Amin.

C:
According to thy gracious word,
In meek humility,
This will I do, my dying Lord,
I will remember Thee.
D:
Gegebi oro oore Re,
Ninu irele nla;
Emi o se yi Oluwa,
Emi o ranti Re.

C:
Thy body, broken for my sake,
My bread from heaven shall be;
Thy cup of blessing I will take,
And thus remember Thee.
D:
Ara Re ti a bu fun mi
Yio o je onje mi;
Mo gba ago Majemu Re
Lati se ranti Re

C:
Can I Gethsemane forget?
Or there Thy conflict see,
Thine agony and bloody sweat,
And not remember Thee?
D:
Mo le gbagbo Gethsemane,
Ti mo r‘ idamu Re,
Iya on oogun eje Re,
Ki nma si ranti Re?

C:
Remember thee, and all thy pains,
And all thy love to me;
Yea, while a breath, a pulse remains,
Will I remember Thee.
D:
Ngo ranti gbogbo ‘rora Re,
At‘ ife Re si mi,
Bi o ku emi kan fun mi,
Emi o ranti Re.

C:
And when these failing lips grow dumb,
And mind and memory flee,
When thou shalt in thy Kingdom come,
Jesus, remember me.
D:
Gbati enu mi ba pamo,
Ti aiye mi buse;
Ti O ba de n‘ijoba Re,
Jesu jo ranti mi.
Amin.

Mo nkebi on ongbe,
Jesu, se onje mi;
Tu jade om‘iye,
Lat‘ inu apata.

C:
Thou bruised and broken Bread,
My life-long wants supply;
As living souls are fed
O feed me, or I die.
D:
‘Wo akara t‘abu
Te okan mi l‘orun,
B‘a ti b‘okan iye,
Bo mi, ma je ki nku.

C:
Thou true life-giving Vine,
Let me Thy sweetness prove;
Renew my life with Thine,
Refresh my soul with love.
D:
‘Wo Ajara iye,
Je ki nmo adun Re;
Jo, tun okan mi se,
Fi ife s‘aiya mi.

Ona aikunna po,
Ti mo ti rin koja:
Bo mi onje Orun,
Gba mi, Om‘Olorun.

C:
For still the desert lies
My thirsting soul before;
O living waters rise
Within me evermore.
D:
Aginju wa sibe,
Ti y‘o m‘ ongbe gbe mi;
Enyin omi iye,
E maa sun ninu mi

C:
The day is come this is the feast
I gave my flesh for you,
And I offer my blood to all
For redemption of sins.
D:
Ojo ko;ase na l’eyi,
Mo f’ara Mi fun nyin,
E wo, Mo f’eje Mi fun nyin,
Lati ran yin pada.

C:
The next in my father’s kingdom
I shall take same with you;
Then all tears shall be wiped away
Our joys shall know no end.
D:
O di ‘nu joba Baba Mi,
Ki Nto tun ba nyin mu,
‘gbana ekun ko ni si mo
A o ma yo titi

C:
We partake of this for ever,
But however till then
Throughout the whole world shall many
Eat, drink and be merry.
D:
Titi l’ao ma je onje yi,
K’o to di igba na;
Ka gbogb’ aiye l’ opolopo
Y’ o ma je,y’o ma mu

C:
The blessing of Heaven remain
On all participants
From the great throne of my father
Shall provide room for them.
D:
‘Bukun atorunwa y’ o ma
Wa lor’ awon t’ o nje;
Ngo gbe or’ite Baba Mi
Maa pes’ aye fun won .

C:
Yet this bitter cup I shall drink,
For the safety of life
I shall partake this for your sake
Cup of pain unto death.
D:
Sugbon nisisiyi, ago
Kikoro l’em’ o mu,
Emi o mu nitori nyin
Ago ‘rora iku.

C:
Yet you won’t know all my sorrow,
And how great my glory:
But continue and admin’ster this
In   remembrance of Me.
D:
E ko le mo ‘banuje Mi,
E ko ti r’ogo Mi,
Sugbo e ma s’eyi titi
K’emaa fi ranti Mi.

C:
What can wash a-way my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
What can make me whole a-gain?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
Oh! precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow!
No other fount I know;
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
D:
Ki lo le w’ ese mi nu,
Ko so, lehin eje Jesu;
Ki l’o tun le wo mi san,
ko si, leyin eje Jesu.
Chr: A! eje 'yebiye
T’ o mu mi fun bi Sno
Ko s’ isun miran mo,
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

C:
What can wash a-way my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
What can make me whole a-gain?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
Oh! precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow!
No other fount I know;
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
D:
Ki lo le w’ ese mi nu,
Ko so, lehin eje Jesu;
Ki l’o tun le wo mi san,
ko si, leyin eje Jesu.
Chr: A! eje 'yebiye
T’ o mu mi fun bi Sno
Ko s’ isun miran mo,
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

C:
What can wash a-way my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
What can make me whole a-gain?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
Oh! precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow!
No other fount I know;
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
D:
Ki lo le w’ ese mi nu,
Ko so, lehin eje Jesu;
Ki l’o tun le wo mi san,
ko si, leyin eje Jesu.
Chr: A! eje 'yebiye
T’ o mu mi fun bi Sno
Ko s’ isun miran mo,
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

C:
What can wash a-way my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
What can make me whole a-gain?
Nothing but the blood of Je-sus!
Oh! precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow!
No other fount I know;
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
D:
Ki lo le w’ ese mi nu,
Ko so, lehin eje Jesu;
Ki l’o tun le wo mi san,
ko si, leyin eje Jesu.
Chr: A! eje 'yebiye
T’ o mu mi fun bi Sno
Ko s’ isun miran mo,
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

C:
Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Chr: Are you washed in the blood –
In the soul-cleansing blood of the Lamb?
Are your garments spotless?
Are they? white as snow?
Are you washed in the blood of
the Lamb?
D:
O ti to Jesu f’ agbara ‘wenumo?
A we O n‘n‘ eje Od‘agutan?
Iwo ha gbekele ore-ofe Re?
A we o n‘nu eje Od‘agutan?
Chr: A we O n‘nu eje
Ninu eje Od’ aguntan fun okan
Aso re ha funfun, o si mo laulau?
A we o n‘nu eje Od‘agutan

C:
Are you walking daily by the Saviour's side?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
D:
O mba Olugbala rin l‘ojojumo?
A we'o n‘nu eje Od‘agutan?
O ha gbekele Enit‘a kan mo ‘gi?
A we o n‘nu eje Od‘agutan?

C:
When the Bridegroom cometh will
your robes be white?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?
D:
Aso re ha mo lati pade Jesu?
A fo mo n‘nu eje Od‘ agutan
Iwo  re ha mura fun ‘le didan ni?
K‘a we o n‘nu eje Od‘agutan?

C:
Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin.
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb!
There's a fountain flowing for the
soul unclean
O be washed in the blood of the Lamb!
D:
Bo ewu eri-ese si apakan,
K‘ a we o n‘nu eje Od‘ agutan?
Isun kan nsan fun gbogbo okan aimo,
Jo lo we n‘nu eje Od‘agutan.
Amin.

C:
O perfect Love, all human thought
transcending,
Lowly we kneel in prayer before Thy throne,
That theirs may be the love which knows no ending
Whom Thou for evermore dost join in one.
D:
Ife pipe, t‘o tayo ero eda,
Niwaju Re l‘a wole l‘ adura
Pe, ki ife ailopin le je t‘awon
Ti iwo so d‘okan titi aiye.

C:
O perfect Life, be Thou their full assurance,
Of tender charity and steadfast faith,
Of patient hope, and quiet brave endurance
With childlike trust that fears nor pain nor death
D:
Iye pipe, maa je igbekele won
Fun ife on igbagbo ododo;
Fun ireti on emi ifarada,
Pelu ‘fokantan l’ aiberu iku.

C:
Grant them the joy which brightens earthly sorrow,
Grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife,
And to life's day the glorious unknown morrow
That dawns upon eternal love and life.
D:
Fun won l‘ayo ti nbori ibanuje
Fun won l‘ alafia ti n m‘aiye dun,
Titi owuro ologo y‘o fi mo;
Ojo ife on iye ailopin.
Amin

C:
The voice that breathed o'er Eden
That earliest wedding day,
The primal marriage blessing,
It hath not pass’d away.
D:
Ire t‘a su ni Eden
N‘igbeyawo ‘kini;
Ibukun t‘abukun won
O wa sibe-sibe

C:
Still in the pure espousal
Of Christian man and maid
The Holy Three are with us,
The threefold grace is said.
D:
Sibe titi di oni
N‘ igbeyawo Kristiani;
Olorun wa larin wa,
Lati sure fun wa.

C:
For dower of blessed children,
For love and faith's sweet sake,
For high mysterious union
Which nought on earth may break.
D:
Ire ki won le ma bi
Ki nwon k’ o si ma re;
Ki won ni ‘dapo mimo
T‘enikan k‘y’o le tu.

C:
Be present, Heavenly Father,
To give away this bride,
As Eve Thou gav'st to Adam
Out of his own pierced side.
D:
Ba ni pe, Baba si fa,
F‘obirin yi f‘ oko;
Bi O ti fi Efa fun
Adam l‘ojo ‘kini.

C:
Be present here, Emmanuel,
To join their loving hands,
As Thou didst bind two natures
In Thine eternal bands.
D:
Ba wa pe, Imanueli
Si so owo won po;
B‘eda meji ti papo
L‘ara ijinle Re

C:
Be present, Holiest Spirit,
To bless them as they kneel,
As Thou for Christ the Bridegroom
The heavenly spouse dost seal.

O spread Thy pure wings o'er them!
Thy overshadowing love,
While one in Thee for ever
They seek Thy rest above.
D:
Fi won s‘abe abo Re
K‘ibi kan ma ba won;
‘Gba nwon npara ile Re
Maa toju okan won.

C:
Till to the home of gladness,
With Christ’s own bride they rise,
And cast their crows before Thee
In perfect sacrifice
D:
Pelu won l’ oj‘aiye won
At‘ oko at‘aya;
Titi nwon o d‘ odo Re
N‘ile ayo l‘orun.
Amin.

C:
Rest in the Lord from harps above
The music seems to thrill
Rest in His everlasting love
Rest and be still.

Rest thou, who claimest for thine own
Thy chosen bride today,
Affianced in His faith alone
Thy bride for aye.
D:
Simi, Iwo oko t‘o gba
Iyawo re loni;
Ninu Jesu, ‘yawo re ni
Titi aiye.

C:
And thou, whose trustful hand is given
Avouching here thy spouse,
Rest, for a Father seals in heaven
His children's vows.
D:
Iwo ti a fa owo re
F‘oko n‘nu ile yi;
Simi, Baba f‘edidi Re
S’ ileri nyin.

C:
Rest ye, who cluster round them both
To mingle praise and prayers;
Your God affirms the plighted troth,
Your God and theirs.
D:
E simi enyin ore won,
T‘e wa ba won pejo;
Olorun won ati ti nyin
Gba ohun nyin.

C:
Rest, for the Heavenly bridegroom here
Is standing by your side,
And in this union draws more near
His mystic bride.
D:
Simi; Jesu Oko Ijo
Duroti nyin nihin;
Ninu idapo nyin, O nfa
Ijo mora.

C:
Rest in the Lord thrice Holy Dove,
In us Thy word fulfil
Rest in His everlasting love,
Rest and be still.
D:
E simi Adaba mimo,
M‘oro Re se:- n'nu wa,
Simi le‘Ife Re ailopin;
Si duro Je.
Amin

C:
O Father, all-creating,
Whose wisdom and Whose power
First bound two lives together
In Eden's primal hour;
Today to these Thy children
Thine earliest gift renew;-
A home by Thee made blessed,
A love by Thee kept true.

O Saviour, Guest most bounteous
Of old in Galilee,
Vouchsafe to-day Thy presence,
With these who wait on Thee;
Their store of earthly gladness
Transform to heavenly wine,
And teach them, in the tasting,
To know the gift is Thine.
D:
N‘igbeyawo Galili,
Iwo ba won pejo
Jo, sokale s‘arin wa,
Bukun oko, aya;
So ikoro di adun,
So ekun di erin;
Ko won lati mo O li
Onise iyanu.

C:
O Spirit of the Father,
Breathe on them from above,-
So searching in Thy pureness,
So tender in Thy love;
That guarded by Thy presence,
From sin and strife kept free,
Their lives may own Thy guidance
Their hearts be ruled by Thee.
D:
Emi Orun alaaye,
Mi si won lat‘ oke;
Fun won ni iwa-mimo,
Fun won n‘ ife pipe,
Jo, maa se amona won,
Ki nwon le sa fese
Se akoso aiye won,
Ki nwon le dabi Re.

C:
Except Thou build it, Father,
The house is built in vain;
Except Thou, Lord, sustain it,
The joy will turn to pain:
But nought can break the union
Of hearts in Thee made one,
And love which Thou hast hallowed,
Is endless love begun.

He is not a disappointment!
Jesus is far more to me
Than in all my glowing day dreams
I had fancied He could be;
And the more I get to know Him,
So the more I find Him true,
And the more I long that others
Should be led to know Him too.
D:
Ijatile ko si n’nu Re,
Jesu ju be lo fun mi;
O le se li opolopo
Ju gbogbo ero wa lo,
Bi mo ti npongbe lati mo,
Be l’ o nje Olooto si;
Be ni mo sin se aniyan
Ki gbogbo aiye le mo.

C:
He is not a disappointment!
He has saved my soul from sin;
All the guilt and all the anguish
Which oppress’d my heart within,
He has banished by His presence,
And His blessed kiss of peace
Has assured my heart for ever
That His love will never cease.
D:
Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
P ti gba mi n’nu ese;
Idalebi at’iponju
Ti nda okan mi l’amu,
O ti le gbogbo won jade;
Gbat’ o wole to mi wa,
O si mu ko da mi loju
Pe ife Re ko le ye

C:
He is not a disappointment
He has healed my body too
What a tender, mighty Saviour
There is naught He cannot do!
When on earth He heal’d diseases
As they touch’d Him heart of pity?
Is the Risen Christ less strong?

He is not a disappointment!
He is all in all to me
Savior, Sanctifier, Keeper;
The unchanging Christ is He!
He has won my heart’s affections,
And He meets my every need;
He is not a disappointment,
For He satisfies indeed.

Children of the heavenly King,
As ye journey, sweetly sing;
Sing your Saviour's worthy praise
Glorious in His works and way.
D:
Ewe ti Oba orun
Korin didun b‘e ti nlo;
Korin ‘yin Olugbala,
Ologo n‘nu ise Re

C:
We are travelling home to God
In the way the fathers trod;
They are happy now, and we
Soon they happiness shall see.
D:
A nlo sodo Olorun
L‘ ona t‘awon baba rin;
Nwon si nyo nisisiyi,
Ayo won l‘awa o ri.

Korin agbo kekere,
E o simi n‘ite Re;
Ib‘a pese ‘joko nyin,
Ibe si n‘Ijoba nyin.

Woke, Omo imole
Ilu Sion wa l’ookan;
Ibe n‘ile wa titi,
Ibe l'a o r‘Oluwa.

C:
Fear not, brethren, joyful stand
On the borders of your land;
Christ, the everlasting Son
Bids you undismay’d go on.
D:
Ma sa, e duro l‘ayo,
Ni eti ile ti nyin;
Kristi Omo Baba nwi
Pe, Laifoya k‘a ma lo

C:
Lord, obediently we go,
Gladly leaving all below;
Only Thou our Leader be,
And we still will follow Thee.
D:
Jesu, a nlo l‘ase Re,
A ko ‘hun gbogbo sile
Iwo ma j‘ Amona wa
A o si ma ba O lo.

C:
By cool Siloam's shady rill
How sweet the lily grows!
How sweet the breath, beneath the hill,
Of Sharon's dewy rose!
D:
Bi osun gbege eti ‘do,
Tutu mini-mini;
B‘igbo dudu eti omi,
B‘itanna ipado.

C:
Lo! Such the child whose early feet
The paths of peace have trod,
Whose secret heart with influence sweet
Is upward drawn to God.
D:
Be l‘omo na yoo dagba
Ti nrin l‘ona rere;
T‘okan re nfa si Olorun
Lat‘ igba ewe re.

C:
By cool Siloam's shady rill
The lily must decay,
The rose that blooms beneath the hill
Must shortly fade away;
D:
Ewe tutu l‘ eba odo
B‘o pe, a re danu;
Be n‘itanna ipa omi
Si nre l‘akoko re.

C:
O Thou whose infant feet were found
Within Thy Father's shrine,
Whose years, with changeless virtue crown’d,
Were all alike divine;
D:
Ibukun ni fun omo na
Ti nrin l‘ona Baba;
Oba ti ki pa ipo da,
Eni mimo lailai.

C:
Dependent on Thy bounteous breath,
We seek Thy grace alone,
In childhood, manhood, age, and death,
To keep us still Thine own.
D:
Oluwa, ‘Wo l‘a gbekele,
Fun wa l’ ore-ofe;
L‘ewe l‘agba ati n‘ iku,
Pa wa mo b‘ omo Re.

C:
Little drops of water,
Little grains of sand,
Make the mighty ocean
And the beauteous land.
D:
Opo ikan omi,
‘Yanrin kekeke,
‘Wonyi l‘o d‘ okun nla
At‘ile aiye

C:
And the little moments,
Humble though they be,
Make they mighty ages
Of eternity
D:
Iseju wa kokan
Ti a ko ka si
L‘o nd‘odun aimoye
Ti ainipekun.

C:
Little deeds of kindness
Little words of love,
Make our earth an Eden
Like the heav'n above.
D:
Iwa ore die,
Oro‘fe die,
L‘o ns‘ aiye di Eden
Bi oke orun.

C:
So our little errors
Lead the soul astray
From the paths of virtue
Into sin to stray.
D:
Isise kekeke
L‘o nm‘okan sina,
Kuro l‘ona rere
Si ipa ese.

C:
Little seeds of mercy
Sown by youthful hands
Grow to bless the nations
Far in heathen lands.
D:
Ise aanu die
T‘a se l‘omode
Di ‘bukun forile
T‘o jinna rere.

C:
Little ones in glory
Swell the angels' song;
Make us meet, dear Saviour,
For their holy throng.
D:
Awon ewe l‘ogo
Ngberin Angeli;
Se wa ye, Oluwa
F‘egbe mimo won.

C:
Jesus is our Shepherd, wiping ev’ry tear;
Folded in His bosom, what have we to fear?
Only let us follow whither He doth lead,
To the thirsty desert, or the dewy mead.
D:
Oluso-agutan l‘Olugbala wa,
B‘a ba wa l‘aiya Re ki l‘ a o beru?
Sa je k‘a lo s‘ib iti O nto wa si,
Iba je asale tab‘oko tutu.

C:
Jesus is our Shepherd: Well we know His voice,
How its gentlest whisper Makes our heart rejoice;
Even when He chideth, Tender is His tone:
None but He shall guide us; we are His alone.
D:
Oluso-agutan awa m‘ohun Re
Wo b‘oro kele Re ti nmokan wa dun;
B‘O tile mba wa wi jeje l‘ ohun Re,
Laisi Re lehin wa awa o segbe.

C:
Jesus is our Shepherd, for the sheep He bled;
Ev’ry lamb is sprinkled with the blood He shed:
Then on each He seateth His own secret sign:
They that have My Spirit, These saith He, are Mine.
D:
Oluso-agutan ku f‘agutan Re,
O f’ eje Re won awon agutan Re,
O si fi ami Re s‘ara won, O ni;
“Awon t‘o l‘Emi Mi, awon ni t‘Emi”

C:
Jesus is our Shepherds; Guarded by His arm,
Though the wolves may ravin,
None can do us harm:
When we tread death's valley, Dark
with fearful gloom,
We will fear no evil Victors o'er the tomb.
D:
Oluso-agutan, l‘abe iso Re,
Bi koriko ba wa, ki y‘o le se nkan;
Bi awa tile nrin l‘ojiji iku,
Awa ki y‘o beru, awa o segun.

C:
Jesus, meek and gentle,
Son of God most High
Pitying, loving Saviour,
Hear Thy children's cry.
D:
Jesu Onirele,
Omo Olorun,
Alanu, Olufe,
Gbo ‘gbe Qmo Re

C:
Pardon our offences,
Loose our captive chains,
Break down every idol
Which our soul detains.
D:
Fi ese wa ji wa,
Si da wa n‘ide,
Fo gbogbo orisa,
Ti mbe l‘okan wa.

C:
Give us holy freedom
Fill our hearts with love;
Draw us, holy Jesus,
To the realms above.
D:
Fun wa ni omnira,
Fife s‘ okan wa;
Fa wa, Jesu mimo
S‘ibugbe l‘oke.

C:
Lead us on our journey,
Be Thyself the way
Through terrestrial darkness
To celestial day.
D:
To wa l‘ona ajo,
Si je Ona wa
La ookun aiye ja
S‘imole orun.

C:
Jesus, meek and gently
Son of God most High;
Pitying, loving Saviour,
Hear Thy children's cry.
D:
Jesu Onirele,
Omo Olorun,
Alanu, Olufe,
Gbo ‘gbe Omo Re

C:
I want to be like Jesus,
So lowly and so meek,
For no one mark’d an angry word
That ever heard Him speak.
D:
Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
Ninu iwa pele
Ko s'enu t'o gb'oro 'binu
L'enu Re lekan ri

C:
I want to be like Jesus,
So frequently in prayer;
Alone upon the mountain-top,
He met His Father there.
D:
Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
L'adura 'gba gbogbo
L’ori Oke ni On nikan
Lo pade Baba Re

C:
I want to be like Jesus,
I never, never find
That He, though persecuted, was
To any one unkind.
D:
Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
Emi ko ri ka pe
Bi nwon ti korira Re to
O' s'enikan ni'bi

C:
I want to be like Jesus,
Engaged in doing good,
So that of me it may be said,
"She hath done what she could."
D:
Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
Ninu ise rere
K' a le wi nipa t' emi pe
'O se won t’O le se"

C:
I want to be like Jesus,
Who sweetly said to all,
"Let little children come to ME."I would obey the call.
D:
Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
T' o f'’ iyonu wipe
"Je k' omode wa s’odo Mi"Mo fe je ipe Re

C:
But oh, I'm not like Jesus,
As any one may see;
Then, gentle Saviour, send Thy Grace,
And make me like to Thee.
D:
Sugbon nko dabi Jesu
O si han gbangba be;
Jesu fun mi l' ore-ofe,
Se mi, ki ndabi Re

C:
Jesus loves me, this I know,
For the Bible tells me so;
Little ones to Him belong,
They are weak, but He is strong.
D:
Jesu fe mi, mo mo bee,
Bibeli l‘o so fun mi;
Tire l‘awon omode,
Nwon ko l‘agbara On ni.

C:
Jesus loves me, He Who died
Glory's gate to open wide;
He will wash away my sin,
Let His little child come in.

Jesus loves me, loves me still,
Though I'm very weak and ill;
From His shining throne on high
He will watch me where I lie.
D:
Jesu fe mi sibe si,
Bi emi tile s‘aisan;
Lor‘akete aisan mi
Yio t‘ite Re wa so mi.

C:
Jesus loves me, He will stay
Close beside me all the way,
Then His little child will take
Up to Heav'n, for His dear sake.
D:
Jesu fe mi, y‘o duro
Ti mi ni gbogb‘ ona mi:
‘Gba mba f‘aiye yi sile,
Y‘ o mu mi re ‘le orun.

C:
When He cometh, when He cometh
To make up His jewels,
All HIs jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own
Chr: Like the stars of the morning,
His bright Crown adorning
They shall shine in their beauty
Bright gems for His Crown
D:
‘Gbat‘ O ba de ‘gba t‘O ba de
Lati sir‘ oso Re;
Gbogbo oso Re iyebiye,
Awon ti O fe.
Bi irawo owuro, won ns‘ade Re l’oso
Ewa won o yo pupo, ewa f‘ ade Re.

C:
He will gather, He will gather
The gems for His Kingdom
All the pure ones all the bright ones,
His loved and His own.
D:
Yio kojo, yio kojo,
Oso ijoba Re;
Awon mimo, awon didan,
Awon ti o fe.

C:
Little children, little children
Who love their Redeemer,
Are the jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own.
D:
Awon ewe, awon ewe,
T‘o fe Olugbala;
Ni oso Re iyebiye,
Awon ti O fe.
Bi irawo owuro, won ns‘ade Re l’oso
Ewa won o yo pupo, ewa f‘ ade Re.

C:
There's a friend for little children
Above the bright blue sky;
A friend who never changeth
Whose love can never die
Unlike our friends by nature,
Who change with changing years,
This friend is always worthy
The precious name he bears.

There's a rest for little children
Above the bright blue sky
For those who love the Saviour,
And “Abba father” cry
A rest from every trouble
From sin and danger free,
Where every little pilgrim
Shall rest eternally.
D:
Isimi kan mbe f‘omode
L’oke orun l’ohun;
F‘awon t‘o f’ Olugbala
Ti nke “Abba Baba”
‘Isimi lowo iyonu,
Low‘ ese ati ewu;
Nibit’ awon omode
Y‘o simi titi lai.

C:
There's a home for little children
Above the bright blue sky
Where Jesus reigns in glory;
A home on peace and joy
No home on earth is like it
Nor can with it compare
For every one is happy
Nor can be happier there.

There's a crown for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
And all who look to Jesus
Shall wear it by and by
A crown of brightest glory
Which he will then bestow
On those who found his favour,
And loved him here below.
D:
Ade kan mbe fun omode
L’oke orun l’ohun;
Enit‘o ba nwo Jesu,
Y‘o ri ade na de;
Ade t‘o fi fun gbogbo
Ti y‘o fi fun gbogbo
Awon ore Re l’aiye
Awon t’ o fe nihin.

C:
There's a robe for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A harp of sweetest music,
A palm of victory
All, all above is treasured,
And found in Christ alone
Oh, come, dear little children
That all may be your own.

There is a path that leads to God,
All others go astray;
Narrow but pleasant is the road,
And Christians love the way.
D:
Ona kan l’o ntoka s‘orun
Isina ni ‘yoku
Hiha si l‘oju ona na,
Awon Kristian lo fe.

C:
It leads straight through this world of sin,
And dangers must be pass'd;
But those who boldly walk therein
Will get to heaven at last.
D:
Lat‘ aiye o lo tarata
O si la ewu lo;
Awon ti nfi ‘gboya rin i,
Y‘o d‘orun nikehin

C:
How shall an infant pilgrim dare
This dangerous path to tread?
For on the way's many a snare
For youthful travelers spread.
D:
Awon ewe y’o ha ti se
Le la ewu yi ja?
‘Tori idekun po l'ona
F‘awon odomode.

C:
While the broad road, where thousands go,
Lies near and opens fair;
And many turn aside, I know,
To walk with sinners there.
D:
Gbigboro l‘ona t‘ opo nrin
O si teju pelu
Mo si mo pe lati d‘ese
Ni won se nrin nibe.

C:
But lest my feeble steps should slide,
Or wander from Thy way,
Lord, condescend to be my guide,
And I shall never stray.
D:
Sugbon k’ ese mi ma ba ye
Ki nma si sako lo;
Oluwa jo s‘Oluto mi,
Emi ki o sina.

C:
Then I may go without alarm
And trust His word of old
"The lambs, He'll gather with His arm,
And lead them to the fold."
D:
Nje mo le lo l’ aisifoiya
Ki ngbekel‘ oro Re
Apa Re y‘o s‘agutan Re
Y‘o si ko won de ‘le.

C:
Thus I may safely venture through
Beneath my Shepherd's care;
And keep the gate of heav'n in view.
Till I shall enter there.
D:
Beni ngo la ewu yi ja
Nipa itoju Re;
Ngo tejumo ‘bode orun
Titi uno fi Wole.

C:
Around the throne of God in heaven
Thousands of children stand,
Children, whose sins are all forgiven,
A holy, happy band.
Chr: Singing: Glory, glory, glory!
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

In flowing robes of spotless white
See every one array’d,
Dwelling in everlasting light,
And joys that never fade.
D:
Wo! olukuluku won wo,
Aso ala mimo;
Ninu imole ailopin,
At'ayo ti ki sa,
Nkorin ogo, ogo, ogo. (2ce)

C:
What brought them to that world above
That heav'n so bright and fair,
Where all is peace, and joy, and love
How came those children there?
D:
Ki l'o mu won de aiye na,
Orun t'o se mimo,
Nib' alafia at'ayo,
Bi won ti se de 'be?
Nkorin ogo, ogo, ogo. (2ce)

C:
Because the Saviour shed His blood
To wash away their sin:
Bath'd in that pure and precious flood,
Behold them white and clean.

On earth they sought the Saviour's grace
On earth they loved His name;
So now they see His blessed face,
And stand before the Lamb.

And is that fountain flowing yet?
Bless'd Saviour, lead us there;
That we those happy ones may meet,
And in their praises share.
D:
Orisun na ha nsan loni?
Jesu, mu wa de 'be;
K' a le ri awon mimo na,
K' a si ba won yin O,
Nkorin ogo, ogo, ogo, (2ce).

Oluso-agutan,to wa
Awa fe itoju Re
Fun wa ni ibukun t‘a nfe,
Si pese aye fun wa,
Chr:Jesu mimo, Jesu mimo
O ra wa, Tire ni wa
Jesu mimo, Jesu mimo
O ra wa, Tire ni wa

C:
We are Thine; do Thou be friend us,
Be the Guardian of our way;
Keep Thy flock, from sin defend us,
Seek us when we go astray:
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Hear Thy children when they pray
Blessed Jesus, Blessed Jesus,
Hear Thy children when they
pray.
D:
Tire ni wa; fi wa s‘ore,
Ma se amona fun wa,
Gba agbo Re lowo ese.
Wa wa gbat‘ a ba sina
Jesu mimo, Jesu mimo&c

Je k‘a tete wa oju Re,
Je k‘a tete se‘fe Re,
Oluwa at' Olugbala,
Fi 'fe Re kun okan wa.
Jesu mimo, Jesu mimo&c

C:
What a Friend we have in Jesus,
All our sins and griefs to bear!
What a privilege to carry
Ev'rything to God in pray'r!
Oh, what peace we often forfeit,
O what needless pain we bear,
All because we do not carry
Ev'rything to God in pray'r!
D:
Ore wo l’ a ni bi Jesu,
Ti o ru ‘banuje wa;
Anfani wo lo po bayi,
Lati ma gbadura si;
Alafia pupo l’ a nsonu,
A si ti je ‘rora po,
‘Tori a ko fi gbogbo nkan
S’ adura niwaju Re.

C:
Have we trials and temptations?
Is there trouble anywhere?
We should never be discouraged,
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Can we find a friend so faithful
Who will all our sorrows share?
Jesus knows our ev'ry weakness,
Take it to the Lord in pray'r.
D:
Idanwo ha wa fun wa bi?
A ha ni wahala bi?
A ko gbodo so ’reti nu,
Sa gbadura s’ Oluwa.
Ko s’ oloto ore bi re
Ti o le ba wa daro;
Jesu ti mo ailera wa,
Sa gbadura s’ Oluwa.

C:
Are we weak and heavy laden,
Cumbered with a load of care?
Precious Saviour, still our refuge
Take it to the Lord in pray'r;
Do thy friends despise, forsake thee?
Take it to the Lord in pray'r;
In His arms He’ll take and shield thee,
Thou wilt find a solace there.
D:
Eru ha nwo wa l’ orun bi,
Aniyan ha po fun wa?
Olugbala je aabo wa,
Sa gbadura s’ Oluwa.
Awon ore ha sa o ti?
Sa gbadura s’ Oluwa,
Yo gbe o s’ oke l’ apa Re,
Iwo yo si ni ‘tunu.

C:
Pray, always pray; the Holy Spirit pleads.
Within thee all thy daily hourly needs.
D:
Ma gbadura; Emi mbebe, n‘nu re,
Fun gbogbo aini re igbagbogbo.

C:
Pray, always pray; beneath sin's heaviest load
Prayer sees the blood from Jesus' side that flow'd.
D:
Ma gbadura; l‘abe eru ese,
Adura nri eje Jesu ti nsan.

C:
Pray, always pray; though weary, faint, and lone,
Prayer nestles by the Father's sheltering throne.
D:
Ma gbadura; b‘are tile mu O,
Adura ngbe wa s‘eba ‘te Baba.

C:
Pray, always pray; amid the world's turmoil
Prayer keeps the heart at rest, and nerves for toil.
D:
Ma gbadura; n‘nu wahala aiye,
Adura l‘o nfun okan n‘isimi.

C:
Pray, always pray; if joys thy pathway throng.
Prayer strikes the harp and sings the angels' song.
D:
Ma gbadura; b‘ayo ba yi o ka,
Adura nlu harp o nko ‘rin angel‘.

C:
Pray, always pray, if loved one pass the veil.
Prayer drinks with them of springs that cannot fail
D:
Ma gbadura b‘awon t‘o feran sun,
Adura mba won mu omi iye.

C:
All earthly things with earth shall fade away,
Prayer grasps eternity, pray, always pray.
D:
Gbogb‘ ohun aiye y‘o b‘aiye koja,
Adura wa titi; ma gbadura.

C:
From every stormy wind that blows,
From every swelling tide of woes,
There is a calm, a sure retreat;
‘Tis found beneath the mercy-seat.
D:
Ninu gbogbo iji ti nja,
Ninu gbogbo igbi ‘ponju,
Abo kan mbe, ti o daju
O wa l‘abe ite anu.

C:
There is a place where Jesus sheds
The oil of gladness on our heads
A place than all beside more sweet
It is the blood-stain'd mercy-seat.
D:
Ibi kan wa ti Jesu nda
Ororo ayo s‘ori wa;
O dun ju ibi gbogbo lo,
Ite-anu t‘a f‘ eje won.

C:
There is a spot where spirits blend,
And friend holds fellowship with friend;
Though sunder'd far, by faith they meet
Around one common mercy-seat.

Ah, whither could we flee for aid,
When tempted, desolate, dismay'd?
Or how the hosts of hell defeat,
Had suffering saints no mercy-seat!
D:
A! nibo ni a ba sa si
Nigba ‘danwo at‘ iponju?
A ba se le bori esu
B’osepe ko si ‘te anu.

C:
There, there on eagle wing we soar,
And time and sense seem all no more,
And heaven comes down our souls to greet,
And glory crowns the mercy-seat.
D:
A! bi idi l‘a fo sibe
B‘enipe aiye ko si mo,
Orun wa pade okan wa,
Ogo si bo ite-anu.

C:
There is an eye that never sleeps
Beneath the wing of night;
There is an ear that never shuts,
When sink the beams of light.
D:
Oju kan mbe ti ki toogbe
Nigbat‘ ile ba su,
Eti kan si mbe ti k‘ise
'Gbati orun ba wo.

C:
There is an arm that never tires,
When human strength gives way;
There is a love that never fails,
When earthly loves decay.
D:
Apa kan mbe ti ko le re
‘Gba ‘pa enia pin;
Ife kan mbe ti ko le ku
‘Gba‘fe aiye ba ku.

Oju na nwo awon Seraf!
Apa na d‘orun mu;
Eti na kun f‘ orin angel‘,
Ife na ga l‘oke.

C:
But there's a power, which man can wield
When mortal aid is vain.
That eye, that arm, that love to reach
That list'ning ear to gain.
D:
Ipa kan l‘enia le lo,
‘Gbat‘ ipa gbogbo pin,
Lati ri oju at‘apa
Ati ife nla na.

C:
That power is prayer, which soars on high
Through Jesus to the throne,
And moves the hand, which moves the world,
To bring salvation down.
D:
Ipa na ni adura wa
Ti nlo ‘waju ite;
T‘o nmi owo t‘ o s‘aiye ro
Lati mu ‘gbala wa.

C:
We love the place, O God,
Wherein Thine honour dwells
The joy of Thine abode
All earthly joy excels.
D:
Olorun awa fe,
Ile t' ola Re wa;
Ayo ibugbe Re
Ju gbogbo ayo lo.

C:
It is the house of prayer,
Wherein Thy servants meet;
And Thou, O Lord, art there
Thy chosen flock to greet.
D:
Ile adura ni,
Fun awon omo Re
Jesu si wa nibe,
Lati gbo ebe won.

C:
We love our Father's board,
Oh what on earth so dear!
Where faithful hearts, O Lord,
Still find Thy presence near.
D:
Awa fe ase Re,
Ti nte okan l' orun
Iwo l' onje iye,
Ti onigbagbo nje.

C:
We love the word of life,
The word that tells of peace,
Of comfort in the strife,
And joys that never cease.
D:
Awa fe oro Re,
Oro alafia
T' itunu at 'iye
Oro ayo titi.

C:
We love to sing below
For mercies freely given;
But oh! We long to know
The triumph-song of heaven.
D:
Awa fe orin Re,
Ti a nko l' aiye yi;
Sugbon awa fe mo,
Orin ayo t' orun.

C:
Lord Jesus, give us grace
On earth to love Thee more,
In heaven to see Thy face,
And with Thy saints adore.
D:
Jesu Oluwa wa,
Busi 'fe wa nihin;
Mu wa de 'nu ogo,
Lati yin O titi.

C:
Jesus, where'er Thy people meet,
There they behold Thy mercy-seat;
Where'er they seek Thee, Thou art found,
And every place is hallow’d ground.
D:
Jesu, nib‘eni Re pade,
Nibe, nwon r‘ite anu Re,
Nibe, won wa O, won ri O
Ibikibi n’ ile owo.

C:
For Thou, within no wall confined,
Inhabitest the humble mind;
Such ever bring Thee where they come,
And going take Thee to their home.
D:
Ko s‘ogiri t‘ o se O mo,
O ngbe inu onirele;
Nwon mu O wa bi won ba wa,
‘Gba won nlo ‘le, nwon mu O lo.

C:
Dear Shepherd of Thy chosen few
Thy former mercies here renew;
Here to our waiting hearts proclaim
The sweetness of Thy saving name.
D:
Olusagutan eni Re,
So aanu Re ‘gbani d‘otun
So adun oruko nla Re,
Fun okan ti nwa oju Re.

C:
Here may we prove the power of prayer,
To strengthen faith and sweeten care,
To teach our faint desires to rise,
And bring all heaven before our eyes.
D:
Je k‘a r’ ipa adua nihin,
Lati so ‘gbagbo di lile
Lati gbe ife wa s’oke,
Lati gb‘orun ka ‘waju wa.

C:
Lord, we are few, but Thou art near,
Nor short Thine arm, nor deaf Thine ear;
O rend the heavens, come quickly down,
And make all hearts O Lord
Thine own

Command Thy blessing from above,
O God, on all assembled here
Behold us with a Father's love,
While we look up with filial fear.
D:
Pase ‘bukun Re t‘oke wa
Olorun, s‘ara Ijo yi;
Fi ife ti Baba wo wa
‘Gbat‘ a f‘eru gb‘oju soke.

C:
Command Thy blessing, Jesus Lord,
May we Thy true disciples be;
Speak to each heart the mighty word,
Say to the weakest, Follow Me.
D:
Pase ibukun Re, Jesu,
K‘a le se omo eyin Re;
S’ oro ipa s‘okan gbogbo,
So f‘alailera, ‘tele mi.

C:
Command Thy blessing, in this hour,
Spirit of truth and fill this place
With humbling and with healing power,
With quickening and confirming grace.
D:
Pase ‘bukun l‘ akoko yi
Emi ooto, kun ibi yi,
F‘agbara iwosan Re kun,
At‘ ore-ofe isoji.

C:
Come, my soul, thy suit prepare
Jesus loves to answer prayer,
He himself has bid thee pray,
Therefore will not say thee nay.
D:
Mura ebe, okan mi,
Jesu nfe gb‘ adura re;
O ti pe k‘o gbadura,
Nitorina yio gbo.

C:
Thou art coming to the King,
Large petition with thee bring,
For His grace and Power are such,
None can ever ask too much.
D:
Lodo Oba n‘iwo mbo,
Wa lopolopo ebe;
Be l‘ore-ofe Re po,
Ko s‘eni ti bere ju.

C:
With my burden I begin:
Lord, remove thie load of sin
Let Thy blood, for sinners split,
Set my conscience free from guilt.

Lord, I come to Thee for rest,
Take possession of my breast,
There Thy blood right maintain,,
And without a rival reign.
D:
S‘odo Re, mo wa ‘simi,
Oluwa, gba aiye mi;
Nibe, ni ki O joko
Maa je Oba okan mi.

C:
While I am a pilgrim here,
Let Thy love and spirit cheer,
As my guide, my guard, my Friend,
Lead me to my journey's end.
D:
N‘irin ajo mi l‘aiye,
K‘ ife Re ma tu mi n‘nu,
Bi Ore at‘ Oluso
Mu mi d‘opin irin mi.

C:
Lord be with us with Thy blessing,
Fill our hearts with joy and peace.
Let us each, Thy love possessing,
Triumph in Redeeming grace.
Oh, RefResh us, 2ce
Traveling through this wilderness.

Thanks we give and adoration
For Thy Gospel's joyful sound.
May the fruits of Thy salvation
In our hearts and lives abound;
May Thy pResence (2ce)
With us evermore be found!

So, when'er the signal's given
Us from earth to call away,
Borne on angels' wings to heaven,
Glad the summons to obey,
May we ever (2ce)
Reign with Christ in endless day!
D:
Nje n‘igbat‘a ba si pe wa
Lati f‘ aiye yi sile
K‘ Angeli gbe wa lo s‘orun,
L‘ayo ni k‘a j‘ipe na;
K‘ a si joba, k‘ a si joba
Pelu Kristi titi lai.

C:
Come, Thou Fount of every blessing,
Tune my heart to sing Thy grace;
Streams of mercy never ceasing
Call for songs of loudest praise.
Teach me, Lord, the raptuorous measure
Sung by flaming hosts above;
Bid me tell the countless treasure
Of my Lord's unchanging love!
D:
Wa, iwo isun ibukun,
Mu mi ko ‘rin oRe Re;
Odo anu ti nsan titi
BeRe orin ‘yin kikan;
Oluwa, ko mi l‘orin na
T‘ogun orun nko l‘ oke
Je ki nroyin isura na
Ti ife Olorun mi

Nihin l‘ a ran mi lowo de
Mo gbe Ebenezer ro
Mo nReti nipa ‘nu ‘Re Re
Ki nde ‘le l‘alafia;
L‘ alejo ni Jesu wa mi,
‘Gba mo §sako lo l‘agbo
Lati yo mi ninu egbe
O f’ eje Re s‘ etutu.

C:
Oh to grace how great a debtor
Daily I'm constrained to be!
Let that grace, break every fetter
That withholds my heart from Thee;
Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it,
Prone to leave the God I love;
Saviour, take my heart, seal it,
Seal it from Thy courts above!
D:
Nit or‘-ofe lojojumo
Ni ‘gbese mi si npo si;
K‘ oRe-ofe yi ja ewon
Ti nse ‘dena okan mi,
Ki nsako sa l‘okan mi nfe
Ki nko Jesu ti mo fe
Olugbala gba aiya mi;
Muu ye f‘agbara orun.

C:
Saviour, again to Thy dear name we-raise
With one accord our parting hymn of praise
We stand to bless Thee ere our worship cease,
Then lowly kneeling wait Thy word of peace.

D:
F‘alafia fun wa, b‘a ti nRele,
Je k‘a pari ojo yi pelu Re;
Pa aiya wa mo, si so ete wa
T‘a fi pe oruko Re n‘ile yi.

C:
Grant us Thy peace, Lord, through the coming night,
Turn Thou for us its darkness into light;
From harm and danger keep Thy children free,
For dark and light are both alike to Thee.
D:
F‘alafia fun wa l‘oru oni;
So okunkun Re d‘imole fun wa,
Ninu ewu, yo awa omo Re,
Ookun on ‘mole j‘okanna fun O.

C:
Grant us Thy peace through out our earthly life,
Our balm in sorrow, and our stay in strife;
Then, when Thy voice shall bid our conflicts cease,
Call us, O Lord, to Thine eternal peace
D:
F’ alafia fun wa loj‘ aiye wa,
Re wa l‘ekun k‘O si gbe wa ni ‘ja,
‘Gbat O ba si f’ opin s’ idamu wa,
Pe wa, Baba, s‘orun alafia.

C:
Pass me not, O gentle Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.
Chorus:
Saviour, Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.
D:
Ma koja mi, Olugbala,
Gbo adura mi,
'Gbat’ Iwo ba np' elomiran,
Mase koja mi!
CHORUS
Jesu! Jesu! Gbo adura mi!
Gbat' Iwo ba np' elomiran,
Mase koja mi.

C:
Let me at Thy throne of mercy
Find a sweet Relief;
Kneeling there in deep contrition,
Help my unbelief.
D:
N' ite-anu je k' emi ri,
Itura didun;
Teduntedun ni mo wole,
Joo ran mi lowo.

C:
Trusting only in Thy merit,
Would I seek Thy face;
Heal my wounded, broken spirit,
Save me by Thy grace.
D:
N' igbekele itoye Re,
L' emi o w' oju Re;
Wo 'banuje okan mi san,
F' ife Re gba mi.

C:
Thou the spring of all my comfort,
More than life to me,
Whom have I on earth beside Thee?
Whom in heav'n but Thee?
D:
Wo orisun itunu mi,
Ju 'ye fun mi lo;
Tani mo ni l' aiyé l' orun
Bikose Iwo?

C:
My trust I place now and ever
In one my soul can deliver,
A Refuge stray, failing never,
For His word is sure.
Chorus
I am Al-pha, and Omega,
The beginning and the ending,
Which is and which was,
And which is to come.
I am Alpha and Omega,
The Beginning and the ending,
The Almighty, the Almighty, saith the Lord.
D:
Mo fi gbogbo okan mi tan
Eni t’o le gb’ emi mi la;
Aabo nla ti ki ‘ye lailai,
Oro Re daju.
Chr: ‘’Emi ni Alfa at’ Omega,
Ipilese ati opin,
Ti O wa, t’O ti wa
Ti O si mbowa;
Emi ni Alfa at’ Omega,
Ipilese ati opin,
Olodumare, Olodumare’’l’Oluwa wi

C:
My heart with joy now is telling
Of Him who finds there a dwelling,
Whose Love is gently compelling
On His word to Rest.
Chr: I am Al-pha, and Omega
D:
Okan mi nso pelu ayo
Ti Eniti ngbe inu mi,
If’ Eniti ntel’ oro Re,
Lati mu duro,
Emi ni Alfa at’ Omega &c.

C:
Jehovah God, Still attend me,
From doubt and fear still defend me,
Faith to sustain ever send me,
That my soul fail not.
Chr: I am Al-pha, and Omega

Simply trusting every day,
Trusting through a stormy way;
Even when my faith is small,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Chorus:
Trusting as the moments fly,
Trusting as the days go by;
Trusting Him what’er befall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
D:
Hymn 256
Sa gbekele l’ojojo,
Gbekele l’arin ‘danwo,
Bi ‘gbagbo tile kere,
Gbekele Jesu nikan
Chr: Gbekele ni ‘gbagbogbo,
Gbekele lo jo jumo
Gbekele lonakona,
Gbekele Jesu nikan.

Emi Re ntan imole,
Si okan okunkun mi,
L’owo Re nko le subu,
Gbekele Jesu nikan
Gbekele ni ‘gbagbogbo &c.

B’ona ba mo ngo ko ‘rin,
B’ o ba di ngo gbadura,
L’ arin ewu ngo kepe,
Gbekele jesu nikan.
Gbekele ni ‘gbagbogbo &c.

C:
Trusting Him while life shall last,
Trusting Him till earth be past;
Till within the jasper wall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
Chorus: Trusting as the moments fly
D:
Gbekele titi d’opin,
Tit’aiye y’o fi koja,
Ti a o si de nu ogo
Gbekele Jesu nikan.
Gbekele ni ‘gbagbogbo &c.

C:
‘Tis the promise of God full salvation to give
Unto him who on Jesus, His Son, Will believe
Chorus: Halleluyah ‘tis done, I believe onthe Son
I am saved by the blood of the
Crucified One
Halleluyah! ‘tis done, I believe on
the Son
I am saved by the blood of the
Crucified One.
D:
Igbala kikun ni Olorun se 'leri
F' eniti o ba gba Jesu omo Re gbo
Chr: Alleluya: O pari mo gba Omo gbo 
Mo ri 'gbala ninu eje Olugbala.
Alleluya; O pari mo gba Omo gbo.
Mo ri 'gbala ninu eje Olugbala

C:
Tho' the pathway be lonely and
dangerous too,
Surely Jesus is able to carry methrough
D:
Bi ona mi tile kun fun ewu pupo
Dajudaju Jesu yio mu mi la ja. 
Alleluya: O pari mo gba Omo gbo &c

C:
Many lov'd ones have I in your
heavenly throng:
They are safe now in glory, and this is their song
D:
Olufe pupo ni mo ni l‘ode prun
Nwon wa ninu ogo, eyi si l‘ orin won
Alleluya: O pari mo gba Omo gbo &c

C:
The little children stool beside Jesus their King
And with a smile on His face as they sing their songs
D:
Awon omode duro l' egbe Oba won    
O nRerin si won bi nwon ti nko orin won.
Alleluya: O pari mo gba Omo gbo &c

C:
There are prophets and kings in that throng I behold,
And they sing as they march through the streets of pure gold;
D:
Woli at' Oba wa ni ipejopo na
Nwon nko ‘rin bi won ti nla ‘ta wura koja.
Alleluya: O pari mo gba Omo gbo &c

C:
There's a part in that chorus for you and for me
And the theme of cur praises for ever will be.
D:
Awa pelu ni lati ko n'nu orin na
Oro orin iyin wa titi lai l’ eyi
Alleluya: O pari mo gba Omo gbo &c.

Y’o dahun gbogb’ adura,
Ileri ati ‘fe Re,
Ko sa ti yi pada ri,
Ogo ni f’ oruko Re.

C:
All prayers He will answer;
I will cling to His promise
I know He will never fail
Glory to His matchless name.
D:
Y’o dahun gbogb’ adura
Ngo rom o ileri Re,
Mo mo On ko je da mi,
Ogo ni f’oruko re.

Y’o dahun gbogb’ adura,
Jek’ a bere ni ‘gbagbo;
Emi Re ran ni lowo.
Ogo ni f’oruko re

Y’o dahun gbogb’adura,
Wa s’ ibi ite anu;
O ri idaniloju,
Ogo ni f’oruko Re

C:
When we walk with the Lord in the light of his Word
What a glory he sheds on our way!
While we do his good will, he abides with us still,
And with all who will trust and obey.
Chorus: Trust and obey, for there's no other way
To be happy in Jesus, but to trust and obey.
D:
Gba t’a b’ Oluwa rin
N'nu ‘mole oro Re,
Ona wa yio ti mole to!
Gbat’ a ba nse ’fe Re,
On yio ma ba wa gbe,
Ati awon t’o gbeke won le E.
Chr: Sa gbekele,
ona miran kosi
Lati layo n’nu Jesu,
Ju pe k’ a gbekele.

C:
Not a shadow can rise, not a cloud in the skies,
But His smile quickly drives it away;
Not a doubt or a fear,
Not a sigh nor a tear,
Can abide while we trust and obey.
D:
Ko s’ ohun t’ o le de,
L’ oke tabi ni ‘le
T'o le ko agbara Re l’ oju;
Iyemeji eru,
ibanuje, ekun
Kol e duro bi a gbekele.

C:
Not a burden we bear,
Not a sorrow we share,
But our toil he doth richly repay;
Not a grief nor a loss,
Not a frown or a cross,
But is blest if we trust and obey.
D:
Ko si wahala mo
Tabi ibanuje
O ti san gbogbo ‘gbese wonyi
Ko si arokan mo,
Tabi ifa juro
Sugbon ‘bukun b’a ba gbekele.

C:
But we never can prove
The delights of His love
Until all on the altar we lay;
For the favor he shows,
And the joy he bestows,
Are for them who will trust and obey.
D:
A ko le f’enu so
Bi ‘fe Re ti po to
Titi ao fi f’ara wa rubo
Aanu ti o nfihan,
At’ ayo t’O nfun ni
Je t’awon to ba gbekele.

C:
Then in fellowship sweet
We will sit at his feet,
Or we’ll walk by his side in the way;
What he says we will do,
Where he sends we will go,
Never fear, only trust and obey.
D:
Ni ‘dapo pelu Re,
A o joko l' ese Re.
Tabi ki a ma rin pelu Re.
Awa y’ o gbo Tire,
A o j’ ise t’ O ran wa,
Ma beru, sa gbekele nikan.

C:
Whoever receiveth the Crucified One,
Whoever believeth on God's only son,
A free and a perfect salvation shall have
For He is abundantly able to save.
Chrous: My brother, the Master is calling for thee;
His grace and His mercy aRe
wondrously free!
His blood as a ransom for
sinners He gave,
And He is abundantly able to save.
D:
Enikeni ti o ba gba Jesu gbo;
T’ o si gba ise ori agbelebu,
Yio ri igbala kikun gba l‘ofe,
‘Tori Kristi l’ agbara lati gbala.
Chr: Enyin ayanfe, Olugbala npe yin

 The conqueror’s song!

PEACE, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?

what can shake thy sure repose?
With salvation's walls surrounded,
thou may'st smile at all thy foes.
D:
Ohun ogo Re l‘a nrohin, 
Sion, ti Olorun wa,
Oro Eni t‘a ‘ko le ye, 
Se O ye fun bugbe Re 
L’ori apat’aiyeraye 
Kini, le mi ‘simi re 
A f‘odi ‘gbala yi o ka 
K‘o le rerin ota re.

C:
See, the streams of living waters,
springing from eternal love,
well supply thy sons and daughters
and all fear of want remove.
Who can faint while such a river
ever flows their thirst to assuage?
Grace, which like the Lord, the Giver,
never fails from age to age.
D:
Wo! Ipado omi iye 
Nt’ife Olorun sun wa
O to fun gbogbo omo Re 
Eru aini ko si mo; 
Tal‘ o le re, ‘gba odo na 
Ba nsan, t‘o le pongbe re? 
Or‘-ofe Olodumare 
Ki ye lat‘ irandiran.

C:
Savior, if of Zion's city
I through grace a member am,
let the world deride or pity,
I will glory in Thy name.
Fading are the worlding's pleasures,
all its boasted pomp and show;
solid joys and lasting treasures
none but Zion's children know.
D:
Ara Sion alabukun 
T’a f’ eje Oluwa we: 
Jesu ti nwon ti ngbekele, 
So won d’oba, Woli Re; 
Sisa l‘ohun afe aiye, 
Pelu ogo asan re, 
Isura tooto at‘ayo, 
Kik‘omo Sion l‘o mo

C:
Through the love of God our Saviour
All will be well
Free and changeless in His favour
All, all is well
Precious is the blood that heal’d us;
Perfect is the grace that seal’d us;
Strong the hand stretch’d forth to shield us
All must be well
D:
Nipa ife olugbala
ki y’o si nkan
Oju rere Re ki pada
ki y’o si nkan
Owon l'eje t' o wo wa san
Pipe l’ edidi or' ofe
Agbara l' owo t' o gba ni
Ko le si nkan

C:
Though we pass through tribulation,
All will be well
Ours is such a full salvation
All, all is well
Happy still in God confiding,
Fruitful, if in Christ abiding;
Holy,  through the Spirit's guiding
All, will be well
D:
Bi a wa ninu iponju
ki y’o si nkan
Igbala kikun ni tiwa
ki y’o si nkan
Igbekele Olorun dun,
Gbigbe inu Kristi l' ere
Emi si nso wa di mimo
Ko le si nkan

C:
We expect a bright to-morrow,
All will be well
Faith can sing through days of sorrow
All will be well
On our Father's love relying,
Jesus every need supplying,
Until Jesus will be coming
All will be well
D:
Ojo ola yio dara
ki y’o si nkan
‘Gbagbo le ko’rin n’ iponji,
ki y’o si nkan
A gbekele 'fe baba wa
Jesu nfun wa l' ohun gbogbo
Titi Jesu yio fi de
Ko le si nkan

C:
God moves in a mysterious way
His wonders to perform;
He plants His footsteps in the sea
And rides upon the storm.
D:
Ona ara l' Olorun wa
Ngba sise Re l' aiye;
A nri 'pase Re lor' okun,
O ngun igbi l' esin.

C:
Deep in unfathomable mines
Of never-failing skill
He treasures up His bright designs
And works His sovereign will.
D:
Ona Re enikan ko mo,
Awamaridi ni;
O pa ise ijinle mo,
Oba awon Oba.

C:
Ye fearful saints, fresh courage take;
The clouds ye so much dread
Are big with mercy and shall break
In blessings on your head.
D:
Ma beru mo, enyin mimo,
Orun t' o su be ni,
O kun fun anu: y' o r’ ojo
Ibukun s’ ori yin.

C:
Judge not the Lord by feeble sense,
But trust Him for His grace;
Behind a frowning providence
He hides a smiling face.
D:
Mase da Oluwa l' ejo,
Sugbon gbeke re le;
'Gbati o ro pe O nbinu,
Inu Re dun si .

C:
His purposes will ripen fast,
Unfolding every hour;
The bud may have a bitter taste,
But sweet will be the flower.
D:
Ise Re fere ye wa na,
Y' o ma han siwaju;
Bi o tile koro l’ oni,
O mbo wa dun l’ ola.

C:
Blind unbelief is sure to err
And scan His work in vain;
God is His own interpreter,
And He will make it plain.
D:
Afoju ni alaigbagbo,
Ko mo 'se Olorun;
Olorun ni Olutumo,
Y' o m' ona Re ye ni.

Igbagbo mi duro l‘ori, 
Eje at‘ ododo Jesu, 
Nko je gbekele ohun kan, 
Lehin oruko nla Jesu. 
Mo duro le Kristi’ Apata, 
Ile miran, iyanrin ni.

B‘ire-ije mi tile gun, 
Or‘-ofe Re ko yi pada; 
B‘ o ti wu k’ iji na le to 
Idakoro mi ko ni ye. 
Mo duro le Kristi’ Apata, 
Ile miran, iyanrin ni.

Majemu, ati eje Re 
L‘em‘o ro mo, bi ‘ikunmi de; 
‘Gbati ko s‘atilehin mo 
O je iReti nla fun mi.
Mo duro le Kristi’ Apata, 
Ile miran, iyanrin ni.

C:
When the last trumpet's voice shall sound,
Oh may I then in Him be found,
Robed in His righteousness alone,
Faultless to stand before the throne.
On Christ, the solid rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand.
D:
‘Gbat‘ipe ‘kehin ba si dun, 
A! mba le wa ninu Jesu; 
Ki nwo ododo Re nikan 
Ki nduro niwaju ite. 
Mo duro le Kristi’ Apata, 
Ile miran, iyanrin ni.

C:
Oh, for a faith that will not shrink 
Though press’d by many foes 
That will not tRemble on the brink 
Of poverty or woe.
D:
A ba le n‘ igbagbo aiye, 
B‘o ti wu k‘ ota po, 
Igbagbo ti ko je mi’ra 
Fun aini at‘ osi.

C:
That will not murmur nor complain 
Beneath the chast'ning rod, 
But, in the hour of grief or pain, 
Can lean upon its God.
D:
Igbagbo ti ko je r’ ahun 
L‘ abe ibawi Re, 
Sugbon ti nsimi l‘ Olorun 
Nigba ibanuje.

C:
A faith that shines more bright and clear 
When tempests rage without, 
That when in danger knows no fear, 
In darkness feels no doubt.
D:
Igbagbo ti ntan siwaju 
‘Gbat‘ iji ‘ponju de; 
Ti ko si je siyemeji 
N‘nu wahala gbogbo.

C:
A faith that keeps the narrow way 
Till life's last spark is fled, 
And with a pure and heav'nly ray 
Lights up a dying bed.
D:
Igbagbo ti ngb‘ona tooro, 
Titi emi o pin, 
Ti y‘o si f‘imole orun 
Tan akete iku.

C:
Lord, give me such a faith as this, 
And then, whate'er may come, 
I’ll taste e'en now the hallow'd bliss 
Of an Eternal Home.
D:
Jesu f‘igbagbo yi fun mi, 
Nje b‘o ti wu ko ri, 
Lat‘ aiye yi lo, Ngo l‘ayo 
Ilu orun rere.

C:
Blessed assurance; Jesus is mine!
Oh, what a foretaste of glory divine!
Heir of salvation, purchase of God,
Born of His Spirit, wash'd in His blood.                                         

Chorus:
This is my story, This is my song,
praising my Saviour all the day long;
This is my story, This is my song,
Praising my Savior all the day long.
D:
O da mi l’oju, mo ni Jesu 
Itowo adun orun l' eyi je 
Mo di ajogun igbala nla  
Eje Re we mi, a tun mi bi, 

Chorus:
Ngo so itan na, ngo ko’rin na  
Ngo yin Olugbala mi titi  
Ngo so itan na, ngo k’orin na  
Ngo yin Olugbala mi titi.

C:
Perfect submission, perfect delight,
Visions of rapture now burst on my sight;
Angeles descending bring from above
Echoes of mercy, whispers of love.                                              
[Chorus]
D:
Ngo teriba fun tayotayo     
Mo le ri iran ogo bibo Re     
Angeli nmu ihin didun wa     
Ti ife at‘anu Re si mi.                                               
[Chorus]

C:
Perfect submission, all is at Rest,
I in my Saviour am happy and blest;
Watching and waiting, looking above,
Fill'd with His goodness, lost in His love.                                              
[Chorus]
D:
Ngo teriba fun, ngo simi le 
Mo di ti Jesu mo d' eni 'bukun .  
Ngo ma sora, ngo si gbadura  
Ki ore Re ma fi mi sile.                                               
[Chorus]

C:
Speak to me by name, O Master, 
Let me know it is to me; 
Speak, that I may follow faster, 
With a step more firm and free, 
Where the shepherd leads the flock, 
In the shadow of the Rock.
D:
Maa wi, pe mi, Oluwa mi, 
Je ki nle mo ohun Re: 
Ma wi, ki nyara tele O, 
Ki nsunmo girigiri 
Nibi ti O nto agbo Re; 
L’abe ibi itura.

Maa wi, yala lohun jeje 
Ma je k‘emi lo laigbo; 
Ma wi, Oluwa, Iwo mo 
Gbogbo ero okan mi, 
Iwo mo ohun ti mo nfe 
So mi di eni ‘bukun.

C:
Master, speak! And make me Ready, 
When Thy voice is truly heard, 
With obedience glad and steady 
Still to follow every word. 
I am listening, Lord for thee; 
Master, speak! O speak to me!
D:
Maa wi, je ki emi mura 
Bi mo ba ti gb‘ ohun Re; 
Pelu ‘gboran ati ayo, 
Ni ki nfi tel‘oro Re 
Mo tetisile Oluwa 
Ma wi, Oluwa, ma wi

C:
O Thou in whose presence my soul takes delight, 
On whom in affliction I call, 
My comfort by day and my song in the night, 
My hope, my salvation, my all
D:
Iwo niwaju enit‘okan mi nyo 
Ti mo npe nigba iponju, 
‘Tunu mi l‘osan at‘ orin mi l‘oru 
‘Reti mi at‘ igbala mi.

C:
Where dost Thou, dear Shepherd, resort with thy sheep, 
To feed them in pastures of Love? 
Say, why in the valley of death should I weep, 
Or alone in this wilderness rove
D:
Nibo l‘O nko awon agutan Re lo, 
Lati f' onje ife bo won, 
Eese ti ngo fi sokun li ainidi 
Tabi nikan rin l‘aginju?

C:
He looks and the thousands of angels Rejoice, 
And myriads wait for His word; 
He speaks and eternity fill’d with His voice, 
Re-echoes the praise of the Lord.
D:
O siju wo, opo Angeli si yo, 
Pupo si duro d‘oro Re; 
O soro, aiyeraiye si gb‘ohun Re, 
E ko’rin iyin s'Oluwa.

Olugbala emi y‘o je Ipe Re, 
Emi mo adun ohun Re; 
Pa mi mo ‘tori Iwo ni gbogbo mi, 
Ngo ma yo ninu Re titi.

C:
Where He lead me I will go,
For I have learn’d to trust Him so,
And I Remember ‘twas for me,
That he was slain on Calvary.

Chorus:
Jesus shall lead me night and day
Jesus shall lead me all the way
He is the truest Friend to me,
For I remember Calvary.
D:
Ona t‘O yan l‘emi o to, 
‘Tori mo gbeke mi le E, 
Mo ranti pe nitori mi 
Ni O se ku ni Kalfari    
                                                                                                     
Chorus:
Jesu nto mi l‘osan l‘oru 
Jesu nto mi l‘ona gbogbo 
O  je Ore tooto fun mi, 
Tori mo ranti Kalfari.

C:
O I delight in His command,
Love to be led by His dear hand;
His divine will is sweet to me
Hallowed by blood stained Calvary.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo ti feran ase Re to? 
Mo fe k‘owo Re ma to mi, 
Ife rere Re ti dun to 
T‘O fihan l‘oke Kalfari. 
[Chorus]

C:
Onward I go, nor doubt nor fear,
Happy with Christ my saviour near,
Trusting some day that i shall see
Jesus my friend on Calvary.
[Chorus]
D:
Mo nlo pel‘okan diduro 
Ninu Kristi Olugbala; 
Ni igbekele pe l’aipe 
Ngo ri Jesu ti Kalfari. 
[Chorus]

C:
Jesus, I will trust Thee, trust Thee with my soul;
Guilty, lost, and helpless, Thou canst make me whole.
There is none in heaven or on earth like Thee.
Thou hast died for sinners therefore, Lord, for me.
D:
Jesu, emi o fi okan mi fun O: 
Mo jebi, mo gbe, Sugbon ‘Wo le gba mi 
L‘aiye ati l‘orun ko s‘eni bi Re, 
Iwo ku f’elese, f‘emi na pelu.

C:
Jesus, I may trust Thee, name of matchless worth
Spoken by the angel at Thy wondrous birth;
Written, and for ever, on Thy cross of shame,
Sinners read and worship, trusting in that name.
D:
Jesu, mo le simi le oruko Re. 
Ti angeli wa so l’ojo Ibi Re, 
‘Yi t‘a ko t‘o han l’or‘ agbelebu, 
Ti elese si ka, nwon si teriba.

C:
Jesus, I must trust Thee, pondering Thy ways,
Full of love and mercy all Thine earthly days:
Sinners gather’d round Thee, lepers sought Thy face
None too vile or loathsome for a Saviour’s grace.
D:
Jesu, emi ko le sai gbekele O, 
Ise Re l‘aiye kun f’anu at‘ife, 
Elese yi O ka, adete ri O, 
Ko s‘eni buruju, ti ‘Wo ko le gba.

C:
esus, I can trust Thee, trust Thy written word,
Though Thy voice of pity I have never heard.
When Thy Spirit teacheth, to my taste how sweet
Only may I hearken, sitting at Thy feet.
D:
Jesu, mo le gbeke mi le oro Re, 
Bi nko tile gbo ohun anu Re ri, 
Gbat‘ Emi Re nko ni, O ti dun po to, 
Ki nsa fi' barale, k‘eko lese Re

C:
Jesus, I do trust Thee, trust without a doubt:
Whosoever cometh, Thou wilt not cast out.
Faithful is Thy promise, precious is Thy blood
These my soul’s salvation, Thou my Saviour God!
D:
Jesu tooto-tooto mo gbekele O, 
Enikeni t‘o wa, ‘WO ki o tanu, 
Ooto ni ‘leri Re, owon l‘eje Re 
Wonyi ni gbala mi, ‘WO l‘Olorun mi

C:
Revive Thy work, O Lord, 
Thy mighty arm make bare; 
Speak with the voice that wakes the dead, 
And make Thy people hear,
D:
Ji se Re nde, Jesu 
Fi agbara Re han, 
Fo‘hun t’ o le j‘ oku dide, 
Mu k‘enia Re gbo

C:
Revive Thy work, O lord
Disturb this sleep of death
Quicken the smouldering embers now
By thine Almighty breath
D:
Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu, 
To orun iku yi, 
Fi emi agbara nla Re; 
Ji okan ti ntogbe.

C:
Revive Thy work, O Lord, 
Create soul-thirst for Thee 
And hungering for the Bread of Life, 
Oh may our spirits be.
D:
Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu, 
Mu k’ onbe Re gbe wa, 
Mu k‘ife Re kun okan wa, 
Nipa Emi Mimo.

C:
Revive Thy work, O Lord, 
Exalt Thy precious name; 
And, by the Holy Ghost, our love 
For Thee and Thine inflame.
D:
Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu, 
Gbe oruko Re ga, 
Mu k’ ife Re kun okan wa. 
Nipa Emi Mimo.

C:
Revive Thy work, O Lord, 
And give refreshing showers 
The glory shall be all Thine own, 
The blessing, Lord, be ours.
D:
Ji‘se Re nde, Jesu, 
Ro ‘jo itura Re, 
Ogo y’o je Tire nikan, 
K‘ibukun je ti wa.

Oluwa, mo gbo pe, Iwo 
Nro ojo ‘bukun kiri; 
Itunu fun okan aare, 
Ro ojo na s‘ori mi, 
An‘ emi An‘emi 
Ro ojo na s‘ori mi.

C:
Pass me not, O gracious Father,
Sinful though my heart may be;
Thou might'st leave me, but the rather
Let Thy mercy light on me.
D:
Ma koja, Baba Olore, 
Bi ese mi tile po, 
‘Wo le fi mi sile, sugbon 
Je k‘anu Re ba le mi 
An‘ emi, An‘emi 
Je k‘anu Re ba le mi.

Ma koja, mi, Olugbala, 
Je k‘emi le ro mo O, 
Emi nwa oju rere Re, 
Pe mi mo awon t‘O npe, 
An‘ emi, An‘emi 
Pe mi mo awon t‘O npe.

C:
Pass me not, O mighty Spirit,
Thou canst make the blind to see;
Witnesser of ‘Jesus’ merit,
Speak the word of power to me.
D:
Ma koja mi, Emi mimo, 
‘Wo le laju afoju, 
Eleri itoye Jesu, 
S’oro ase na simi, 
An‘ emi, An‘ emi 
Soro ase na simi.

C:
Have I long in sin been sleeping,
Long been slighting, grieving Thee?
Has the world my heart been keeping?
Oh! forgive and Rescue me.
D:
Mo ti sun fonfon nin‘ese, 
Mo bi O ninu koja, 
Aiye ti de okan mi, jo, 
Tu mi, k‘o dariji mi, 
An‘emi, An‘emi 
Tu mi, k‘O dariji mi.

C:
Love of God so pure and changeless,
Blood of Christ so rich, so free.
Grace of God so strong and boundless,
Magnify it all in me.
D:
Ife Olorun, ti kii ye, 
Eje Krist‘ iyebiye, 
Ore-Ofe alainiwon 
Gbe gbogbo re ga n‘nu mi 
An‘ emi, An‘emi 
Gbe gbogbo Re ga n‘nu mi:

C:
Pass me not, but pardon bringing,
Bind my heart, O Lord, to Thee,
All my heart to Thee is springing;
Blessing others, oh bless me.
Even me, even me,
Let some drops now fall on me
D:
Ma koja mi, dariji mi, 
Fa mi mora, Oluwa, 
‘Gba O nfi‘bukun f’ elomi 
Masai f‘ibukun fun mi, 
An‘emi, An‘ emi 
Ma sai fi‘bukun fun mi.

C:
Speed Thy servants, Saviour speed them;
Thou art Lord of winds and waves
They were bound, but Thou has freed them,
Now they go to free the slaves.
Be Thou with them, Be Thou with them,
‘Tis Thine arm alone that saves.
D:
Sin awon onse Re, sin won 
W’ Oba efufu igbi; 
A de won, O da won sile, 
Nwon nlo‘da eru n’ide: 
Wa pelu won, wa pelu won, 
Apa Re, l‘o le gbala.

Nwon f‘ ile at‘ ore sile 
Ni ase Re Oluwa; 
N‘ ile ati l’oju omi 
Je Alafehinti won, 
Jo pelu won, jo pelu won, 
Si ma to won l’ailewu.

C:
Where no fruit appears to cheer them,
And they seem to toil in vain,
Then in mercy, Lord, draw near them,
Then their sinking hopes sustain;
Thus supported, Thus supported
Let their zeal revive again.

D:
N‘nu opolopo isoro, 
K‘ won gbekele O, Jesu 
‘Gbat‘ ise na ba si ngbile, 
Ki nwon mase gberaga; 
Ma fi won ‘le, Ma fi won ‘le 
Titi nwon o r‘oju Re

C:
There to Reap in joy for ever
Fruit that grows from seed here sown,
There to be with Him who never
Ceases to preserve His own,
And with triumph, And with triumph
Sing a saviour’s grace alone.

Standing by a purpose true, 
Heeding God's command, 
Honour them, the faithful few:
All hail to Daniel's Band! 

Chorus:
Dare to be a Daniel! 
Dare to stand alone! 
Dare to have a purpose firm! 
Dare to make it known!

Many mighty men are lost, 
Daring not to stand, 
Who for God had been a host, 
By joining Daniel's Band! 
[Chorus]
D:
Opo akin l’o nsegbe 
Nwon ko to duro; 
Nwon ba wo egbe Daniel 
Nwon ba ja f‘Olorun.  
[Chorus]

C:
Many giants, great and tall, 
Stalking through the land, 
Headlong to the earth would fall, 
If met by Daniel's Band!
D:
Opolopo omiran 
Ti nhale kiri 
Ni iba subu lu ‘le 
B‘ egbe Daniel ko won.

C:
Hold the Gospel banner high 
On to victory grand! 
Satan and his host defy, 
And shout for Daniel's Band!  
[Chorus]

There's one above all earthly friend
Whose love all earthly love transcends,
It is my Lord and Christ divine,
My Lord because, I know He's mine.

Chorus: 
I know He's mine, this Friend so dear,
He lives with me He's ever near.
Ten thousand charms, around Him shine,
And, best of all, I know He's mine.
D:
Kristi mimo, Oluwa mi, 
Ife Re ju t‘araiye lo; 
Ore otito li O je 
Mo mo pe Oluwa mi ni, 

Chorus: 
On je t‘ emi, ore mi owon, 
O mba mi gbe nigba gbogbo; 
Ogo didan wa yi I ka, 
Ju gbogbo re, Oun je t‘ emi.

C:
He's mine because He died for me
He saved my soul, He set me free,
With joy I worship at His shrine,
And cry, "Praise God," I know He's mine.
[Chorus]
D:
Temi ni, O sa ku fun mi, 
O gba mi, O si da mi n‘de, 
Pelu ayo ni mo nke pe, 
Ogo ni fun Olorun mi. 
[Chorus]

C:
He's mine because He's in my heart,
And never, never will we part,
Just as the branch is to the vine,
I'm joined to Christ, I know He's mine.
[Chorus]
D:
T‘emi ni, O ngbe okan mi 
A ki y‘o pinya tit‘aiye, 
Bi eka l‘ ara ajara 
Beni mo je l‘ ara Kristi. 
[Chorus]

C:
Someday upon the street of gold
Mine eyes His glory shall behold
Then while His arms around me twine,
I'll cry for joy, "I know He's mine."
[Chorus]
D:
L’ ojo kan ni ‘lu didan ni, 
Oju mi y‘o ri ogo Re; 
Nigbana ngo ro mo l‘orun, 
Ngo fo f‘ ayo p‘On je t‘emi. 
[Chorus]

C:
My life, my love I give to Thee,
Thou Lamb of God who died for me;
Oh may I ever faithful be,
My Savior and my God!

Chorus 
I’ll live for Him who died for me,
How happy then my life shall be!
I’ll live for Him who died for me,
My Savior and my God!
D:
Mo f'aiye at' ife mi fun
Od'aguntan t’O ku fun mi;
Jeki nle je olotito,
Jesu Olorun mi.

Chorus:
Ngo wa f' enit' O ku fun mi,
Aiye mi y’ o si dun pupo;
Ngo wa f' enit O ku fun mi,
Jesu Olorun mi.

C:
I now believe Thou dost Receive,
For Thou hast died that I might live;
And now henceforth I trust in Thee,
My Savior and my God! 
[Chorus]
D:
Mo gbagbo pe Iwo ngbani
'Tori 'Wo ku k'emi le la;
Emi y’o si gbekele O,
Jesu Olorun mi. 
[Chorus]

C:
O Thou who died on Calvary,
To save my soul and make me fRee,
I’ll consecrate my life to Thee,
My Savior and my God! 
[Chorus]
D:
Iwo t' O ku ni Kalfari,
Lati so mi d’ ominira;
Mo y’ ara mi soto fun O,
Jesu Olorun mi. 
[Chorus]

C:
I am not bought with riches 
Neither silver nor gold 
But Christ hath redeemed me 
I am safe in His fold 
In the book of His kingdom 
With its pages so fair 
Through Jesus my Saviour 
My name's written there 

Chorus: 
My name's written there 
On the page white and fair 
In the book of God's kingdom 
My name's written there.
D:
Oluwa nko bere fun Fadaka on wura, 
Ngo jijakadi f‘orun, ngo si wo ‘nu agbo; 
N‘nu iwe Ijoba Re ti o Fewa pupo, 
So fun mi Oluwa mi, ooko mi ha wa n’ be? 

Chorus:
Ooko mi ha wa n’ be? 
Ninu iwe nla ni 
Iwe ti Ijoba Re 
Ooko mi ha wa n’ be?

C:
My sins, they were many 
Like the sands of the sea 
But the blood of my Saviour 
Is sufficient for me 
For His promise is written 
In bright letter that glow 
Tho' your sins be as scarlet 
I will make them like snow.  
[Chorus]
D:
Oluwa, ese mi po bi iyanrin okun. 
Sugbon eje Re, Jesu, ti to fun gbogbo Re. 
‘Tori ‘Wo ti se‘leri ninu oro Re pe; 
“B‘ese Re pon b‘ododo, ngo fo won fun bi sno.”  
[Chorus]

C:
Oh that beautiful city 
With its mansions of light 
With its glorified beings 
In pure garments of white 
Where no evil thing cometh 
To despoil what is fair 
Where the angels are watching 
My name's written there  
[Chorus]
D:
N‘ilu daradara ni at‘ opo ‘bugbe Re, 
Nibit‘ awon mimo wa nin‘aso funfun won, 
T‘ohun eri ko le de lati b‘ewa re je, 
‘Bit‘awon angeli nso, Ooko mi ha wa nbe?  
[Chorus]

C:
I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour callinig,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
‘’Take thy cross, and follow, follow me’’

Chorus: 
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
I'll go with Him with Him, all the way.
D:
Mo gbo Olugbala mi npe, 
Mo gbo Olugbala mi npe; 
Mo gbo Olugbala mi npe, 
“Gb‘agbelebu Re si te le Mi” 

Chorus: 
Ona t‘ O la l‘emi’ o rin 
Ona t‘ O la l‘em’ o rin 
Ona t‘ O la l‘em’o rin 
Em‘o tele, tele titi lai.

C:
I'll go with Him through the garden
I'll go with Him through the garden
I'll go with Him through the garden
I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way. 
[Chorus]
D:
Em‘o ba koja ogba ni 
Em‘o ba koja ogba ni 
Em‘o ba koja ogba ni 
Em‘o tele, tele titi lai.  
[Chorus]

C:
I'll go with Him through the judgment
I'll go with Him through the judgment
I'll go with Him through the judgment
I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way. 
[Chorus]
D:
Em‘o ba koja idajo 
Em‘o ba koja idajo 
Em‘o ba koja idajo 
Emi o tele; tele titi lai.  
[Chorus]

C:
He will give me grace and glory
He will give me grace and glory
He will give me grace and glory
All go with me, with me, all the way. 
[Chorus]
D:
Y‘o fun mi l‘ore at‘ogo 
Y‘o fun mi l‘ore at‘ogo 
Y‘o fun mi l‘ore at‘ogo 
Y‘o je t‘emi t‘emi titi lai.  
[Chorus]

C:
I have a friend who is ever nigh 
Whether I sleep or wake; 
Ever He guards with a watchful eye, 
He knoweth the way that I take. 

Chorus: 
He knoweth the way that I take, 
And keeps me when asleep or awake; 
And lead me for His own name's sake, 
He knoweth the way that I take.
D:
Mo l‘Ore kan to wa ni ’tosi' 
L‘osan ati l‘oru, 
O nfi oju Re so mi titi 
O mo ona ti emi ngba.
 
Chorus: 
O mo ona ti emi ngba, 
O si npa mi mo l‘osan, l’oru 
O nto mi li oruko Re, 
O mo ona ti emi ngba.

C:
I have a friend who is always near 
One who will ne'er forsake; 
What tho’ my pathway be dark and drear, 
He knoweth the way that I take.  
[Chorus]
D:
Mo ni Ore kan t‘o sunmo mi 
Ko je ko mi sile; 
Bi ona mi tile s‘okunkun 
O mo ona ti emi ngba.  
[Chorus]

C:
I have a friend who will guide me on 
Until the shadows break, 
Leading me on, till my crown is won, 
He knoweth the way that I take.  
[Chorus]
D:
Mo l‘Ore kan ti y‘o ma to mi 
Tit‘ opin y‘o fi de 
O nto mi titi ngo fi d‘ade 
O mo ona ti emi ngba.  
[Chorus]

C:
My happy heart is singing 
My heav'nly Father's love; 
He send so many blessings 
Like sunbeams from above. 

Chorus: 
But Jesus is the best of all 
Yes, Jesus is the best of all 
Of all the joys that may surround  me, 
The best of all is Jesus.
D:
Okan ayo mi nko‘rin 
Ife Baba orun; 
O ran opo ibukun, 
B‘orun lat’ oke wa,
 
Chorus: 
Sugbon Jesu l‘o  san julo. 
Beni Jesu l‘o san julo. 
N‘nu gbogbo ti o yi mi ka 
Jesu nikan l‘o julo

C:
Tho' other joy may fail me, 
And sorrows may befall, 
My Saviour will be with me. 
And He is best of all.  
[Chorus]
D:
B‘ ayo miran gbogbo pin, 
Ti ‘banuje si de, 
Jesu yio pelu mi, 
On si pupo ju  
[Chorus]

C:
O, let me tell to others 
The story of His grace, 
Rejoicing in His service, 
Until I see His face.  
[Chorus]
D:
Ngo so fun elomiran 
Itan or‘ofe Re; 
Ngo ma yo n‘nu isin Re 
Titi ngo r‘oju Re  
[Chorus]

C:
And when I view the glories, 
Within the jasper wall, 
I'll sing with all the ransomed, 
My Saviour's best of all.  
[Chorus]
D:
‘Gba mo ba si ri ogo 
Ninu odi Jasper; 
Ngo ko ‘rin irapada, 
P‘Olugbala san ju.  
[Chorus]

C:
Thee will I love, my stRength, my Tower, 
Thee will I love, my joy, my crown, 
Thee will I love with all my power, 
In all Thy works, and Thee alone; 
Thee will I love, till sacred fire 
Fill my whole souls with puRe desire.
D:
Ngo feran Re, ‘Wo odi mi, 
Ngo feran Re, ‘Wo ayo mi 
Ngo feran Re patapata, 
Ngo feran Re tor’ ise Re 
Ngo feran Re, tit‘ okan mi, 
Yio fi kun fun ife rere.

Wo Orun mi gba ope mi, 
Fun imole Re  t’ O ti fun mi
Gba ope mi ‘Wo l’ O gba mi 
L’owo awon ti ns’ota mi 
Gba ope mi fun ohun Re 
T’ o mu mi yo lopolopo

C:
Uphold me in the doubtful race, 
Nor suffer me again to stray 
StRengthen my feet with heavenly grace 
Still to press forward in Thy way; 
That all my pow'rs with all their might 
In Thy sole glory may unite.
D:
N’nu ire-ije mi l’aiye 
Ma se alaboiuto mi; 
Fi agbara fun ese mi 
ki nle t’ ese m’ ona rere, 
ki mba le f’ ipa mi gbogbo
F’ oruko Re t’ o l’ ogo han.

Ngo feran Re, ‘Wo ade mi 
Ngo feran Re, Oluwa mi; 
Ngo feran Re nigbagbogbo, 
L‘ojo ibi, l‘ojo ire, 
‘Gbati ojo iku, ba de, 
Ngo feran Re titi lailai.

C:
How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
In a beliver's ear!
It soothes his sorrows, heals his wounds
And drives away his fear.
D:
B‘oruko Jesu ti dun to 
L‘eti onigbagbo; 
O tan ‘banuje on ogbe, 
O le eru re lo.

C:
It makes the wounded spirit whole,
And calms the troubled breast;
‘'Tis manna to the hungry soul,
And to the weary rest.
D:
O wo okan r‘o gbogbe, san, 
O mu aiya bale; 
Manna ni fun okan ebi, 
Isimi f‘alaare.

C:
Dear name! The Rock on which I build,
My shield, and hiding place,
My never failing treasury, filled
With boundless store of grace!
D:
Apata ti mo ko’le le, 
Ibi isadi mi 
Ile isura mi t‘o kun 
F‘opo ore-ofe

C:
Jesus, my Shepherd, Husband, Friend,
My prophet, Priest, and king,
My lord, my Life, my Way, my End,
Accept the praise I bring.
D:
Jesu, Oko mi, Ore mi, 
Woli mi, Oba mi, 
Alufa mi, Ona iye, 
Gba orin iyin mi.

C:
LOVE divine, all loves excelling,
Joy of heaven to earth come down;
Fix in us Thy humble dwelling
All Thy faithful mercies crown:
Jesus, Thou art all compassion,
Pure, unbounded love Thou art,
Visit us with Thy salvation,
Enter every trembling heart
D:
Ife orun alailegbe,
Ayo orun sokale,
Fi okan wa se ‘bugbe Re,
Se asetan anu Re.
Jesu Iwo ni alaanu 
Iwo l’onibu ife 
Fi igbala Re be wa wo 
M’okan eru wa duro

C:
Come, almighty to deliver,
Let us all thy grace Receive:
Suddenly Return, and never,
Never moRe Thy temples leave,
Thee we would be always blessing,
Serve, Thee as Thy hosts above,
Pray, and praise Thee, without ceasing
Glory in Thy perfect love.
D:
Wa, OlodumaRe, gba wa
Fun wa l’ore-ofe Re.
L’ojiji ni k’O pada wa, 
Ma si fi wa sile mo;
Iwo l’a o ma yin titi,
Bi won ti’nse ni orun 
Iyin wa ki yio l’ opin 
A o s’ogo n’nu ‘fe Re.

C:
Finish then Thy new creation,
Pure and spotless let us be;
Let us see Thy great salvation,
Perfectly Restor'd in Thee,
Changed from glory into glory,
Till in heaven we take our place,
Till we cast our crowns before Thee,
Lost in wonder, love and praise.
D:
S’asepe awa eda Re
Jek’a wa lailabawon 
K’ a ri titobi ‘gbala Re
Li aritan ninu Re. 
Mu wa l’ at’ ogo de ogo,
Titi di ibugbe wa;
Titi awa o fi wole
N’iyanu, ife, iyin.

Oruko kun mbe ti mo fe 
Mo fe ma korin Re; 
Iro didun ni l' eti mi, 
Oruko didun ni.

C:
It tells me of the Lamb of God 
Who died to set me free; 
It tells me of His precious blood, 
The sinner's perfect plea.
D:
O so ife Olugbala 
T‘O ku lati ra mi, 
O so eje Re ‘yebiye 
Etutu f’ elese

C:
It tells me of a Father's smile 
Beaming upon His child; 
It cheers me through this little while, 
Through, desert, waste, and wild.
D:
O so ti iyonu Baba, 
Ti O ni s‘Omo Re, 
O m‘ara mi ya, lati la 
Aginju aiye ja.

C:
Jesus, the name I love so well, 
The name I love to hear, 
No saint on earth its worth can tell, 
No heart conceive how dear.
D:
Jesu, oruko ti mo fe, 
T‘o si dun l‘eti mi; 
Ko s‘eni mimo kan l‘aiye 
T‘o mo b‘O ti po to.

C:
This name shall shed its fragrance still 
Along this thorny road, 
Shall sweetly smooth the rugged hill, 
That leads me up to God.
D:
Oruko yi j‘orun didun 
L‘ona egun t‘ a nrin; 
Yio tun ona yangi se 
T‘o lo sod‘Olorun.

C:
And there with all the blood-bought throng 
From sin and sorrow fRee, 
I'll sing the new eternal song 
Of Jesus' love to me.
D:
Nibe pelu awon mimo 
Ti nwon bo nin‘ ese 
Emi o ko ‘rin titun ni 
T‘ife Jesu si mi.
